Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ycpan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights for a city break in HK. The hotel room was spacious with a good view over the bay. They had a safe in the room. We had problems with our TV remote control, but it was quickly solved by very friendly staff. The breakfast was very enjoyable. We would happily stay there again in the future. Do NOT take the free shuttle bus from HK express train station, because the hotel was in the end of the bus route and it took about an hour to get to the hotel. It was very quick to get to the express train station from the hotel on the shuttle bus though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexander1jed
Reviews.Content: Visited as family with one child. Excellent location. Great service and rooms typical Asian quality which is always good in this category of hotel. Would stay again. Very close to central tourist attractions. Starbucks next door great for breakfasts. Rail service great for transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot opposite the noon-day gun!”
Reviews.Author: Finnas
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Excelsior purely because it was close to the Royal Hong Kong Yacht Club, and stayed on a club floor. Very happy with the accommodation and service - it's interesting these days how the way a hotel provides Internet access can make a difference to choosing the hotel and coming back. The staff at Excelsior made our stay relaxing and fun. One of our great "finds" was a door in a narrow side alley in the building next to the hotel that led down stairs into a tunnel under the road and came up next to the noon-day gun. Also great location for shopping - a short walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Worn rooms in a central location”
Reviews.Author: travelaydeebug
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - 5/5. Great area in Causeway Bay. Walking distance to many shops and restaurants and a one minute walk to the MTR (Causeway Bay subway station). There's a Starbucks across the street and SOGO department store by the subway. Shops in the area are opened most nights until 11pm! Honestly, the location is the main selling point for the hotel. SERVICE - 5/5. Service was great. Nothing to complain about. Check-in was easy and fast. ROOM - 3.5/5. The room needs updating badly. The decor looks old, worn and from the 80s. The desk chair had rips in the leather and the bathroom needed re-grotting. Felt like a 3.5-4 star hotel. Wireless internet was at an additional charge (if not for my corporate rate) and local calls were also at a charge (though not much). Our room didn't have a view at all so our blinds were mostly closed. The room was fairly clean and was cleaned twice a day. VALUE - 3.5/5. With my corporate rate, they gave me a bottle of red wine and a bowl of fruit that was stocked daily. That was a nice, unexpecting touch. I stayed using a corporate rate but using other travel websites, I could find other comparable hotels (newer) for the same price. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Martin4368
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 5 nights on our way to Macau. Unfortunately this was 4 days to long in Hong Kong. Like the City itself this motel is way overpriced for what you get, the rooms are very tired and are need of an upgrade for sure. Stayed on the Executive level and well that was a waste of time and money for sure. Sorry but just can't recommend staying here, must be better options elsewhere, saying this probably best to just by pass this overpriced City anyway

Reviews.Title: “Nothing except location”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin_4
Reviews.Content: Though we live in Hong Kong recently ought to stay few night in hotel due to reallocaion. Excelsior was choosen because of location and this is hard to miss. In all other respects - not encouraging. Matured and tired rooms, Internet for extra payment (many of the hotels provide this for free in Hong Kong now). We got a notice that there will be no hot water in the room without any approach from hotel maagement to smooth the inconvinience caused. In the evening one lady hit the forehead with the entrance door. A lot of blood near the entrance, shocked people etc. Though staff seems know what to do technically (first aid etc) but at the same time they made no efforts to chill out the people (both who stayed with a lady and who walked in into the hotel) so the accident do not affect the hotel. Given that lobby is small I doubt people got nice first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the end of our holiday 'down-under'.”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer999_11
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have been able to book this through Avios, using old points transferred from Airmiles. We were thrilled with our harbour view room, and it's SuperKingsize bed - really comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a very wide choice of food. We only had a salad one evening in Dicken's Bar, the rest of our time preferred to eat out as the choice of eateries was very wide in the area. The Staff were charming and friendly without being over-powering and are all fantastic assets to the business. The Concierge staff will lead you through the tunnel under the road to see the Noonday Gun - an unusual tourist attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Small Basic Room and Average Service,”
Reviews.Author: kim511
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Excelsior Hotel Hong Kong for 1 night in Deluxe Harbor View room. Reception is efficient but cold attitude. Deluxe Harbor View room is small with very basic tiring furnishings and nothing special about the harbor view. Given the price, there are better choices around Causewaybay area and we would not recommend Excelsior Hotel due to high price, small room, and old furnishing. You might wish to explore following options with similar pricing: Parklane Hotel - Bigger room, Windsor House (mall) across the street, 5 minutes walk to Sogo Department Stores, 1 minute walk to 24 hours huge supermarket, Crown Plaza Hotel - Bigger room, more luxury, new furnishing, 5 minutes walk to Times Square mall, 10 minutes walk to Sogo Deparment Store Harbor Grand Hotel, Hung Hum - Bigger room, great harbor view over looking beautiful Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Satyavrata
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a massive hotel, but if run very eficciently by the Mandarin Oriental Group. The staff are all superb, friendly and approciable. The reception can get quite busy especially in the early evening as it used by many airline crew (although they have a separate counter). The rooms are getting quite tired, but are very clean. There is a buffet on the first floor which is very good value for Hong Kong. The oyster were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Re. Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: vincanity
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Caseway bay, very close to time square which is one of the best shopping district in HK. I stayed here for two nights, and the room we were given overlooked the ocean. The view of the ocean was absolutely gorgeous, and we were also able to see the kowloon side from out room. We were also lucky enough to experience the symphony of lights from the kowloon side. It was definitely one of the best light show I have ever seen. Will def recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service but rooms could do with an update.”
Reviews.Author: Aileyxo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior for 3 nights at the end of July 2012 with my mum. My mum has stayed at this hotel on countless occasions for work, however, this was my first visit. On arrival at the hotel I was very impressed by the friendliness of the reception staff and throughout our stay they could not have been more helpful. Yes, the rooms are small and dated and could do with an update but were clean with fantastic views over the harbor to Kowloon. The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect for our needs. The Causeway Bay MTR station is less than a 5 minute walk away and the hotel is surrounded by shops and restaurants with a Starbucks straight across the road for free wifi and a morning coffee! We ate dinner in the hotel on 2 nights in both the English pub and the cafe on 1st floor. We had Western Cuisine on both nights made just like at home, however, on the expensive side! I would recommend this hotel on it's location and service. The rooms can be easily overlooked as there's so much to do in Hong Kong you spend so little time in it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aru_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent service . warm welcome. terrific view from window. superb service. It was too cold and since I was not carrying more warm clothes as I came from singapore , the hotel staff promply found a room heater for my room . the service and cleanliness was too good & the front desk was very cooperative

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: IGH63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excelsior on HK Island for 7 days in June. We have stayed there several times before and have never been disappointed. On this occasion, we were with friends and both couples stayed on the Executive floor taking advantage of the hotel special 7 nights long stay package with lots of extras. Access to the Executive club is great and a sanctuary amidst the madness that is Hong Kong.......breakfast is served at the Club and one can eat at the main breakfast area if you wish. Throughout the day some refreshment is on offer at the Club ( snacks, soft drinks, fruit, tea and coffee) and in the evening there is a Cocktail session for 2 hours, 6-8pm. Great fun and excellent value. The hotel is seriously busy and the service is excellent. The front desk staff are helpful and the Concierge service is superb....nothing is too much trouble. The Dickens bar and restaurant downstairs at the hotel has sports TV, great food and service and a really bubbly atmosphere. Always crowded with expats, locals and tourists but not too crowded....just right! The rooms are compact but adequate and we usually stay in a Deluxe Harbour View room that gives a nightly 'light show' of the lit up buildings across the water in Kowloon. The hotel is in the heart of Causeway Bay shopping district and 100 metres from the MRT station. Restaurants are everywhere and Times Square has it all in terms of brand name shopping and the local shops do the rest. The only downside is that there is no pool at the hotel but 10 min walk away is Victoria Park with a superb outdoor pool....summer only I think. We cannot think of any better place to stay for value for money and access to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ThomasChoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Old hotel and rooms are little dated still very clean and well managed. Location is its main attraction. Just a stone throw away from major shopping malls and the MTR. Check in and check out was easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: AlleyOopDinosaur
Reviews.Content: We went to Hk and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The services we experienced during our visit was excellent, from airport limo. transfers to the hotel, check-in, reception, concierge & etc. Location is great, next to World Trade Centre, walking distant to Sogo, Times Square and many other shops. Therefore, lots of shops and restaurants nearby and there is a supermarket in the basement of Times Square with a food court. Access to many types of transportation, taxis are everywhere and very reasonable, except for traffic which may not be too great during peak period. We took taxis every where we go as it is the most convenient way for us, travelling with an 83 year old mother with a cane. We just have to step right outside the door of the hotel and the concierge will get a taxi for us. Rooms are clean and not too small even with an extra bed as there were 3 of us. We will stay in this hotel again is we are in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerboy
Reviews.Content: The staff were superb at this hotel. Really helpful and pleasant. It's in a really good location, 5 mins from Causeway MRT and near two shopping plaza's. Only down side is that the rooms are a little tired and worn. However, if you get a harbour view the views are amazing. Good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: RichWestSussex
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and use it every time I am in Hong Kong. It is right in the middle of Causeway Bay and many shops and restaurants surround the hotel. The rooms are not huge but are very comfortable and have a small fridge, tea and coffee etc and everything else you would expect to find. The hotel has a good gym and a busy bar downstairs and a lovely restaurant overlooking the harbour. The staff have always been very friendly and helpful and will arrange any trip or outing for you to anywhere in the area or beyond. Opposite the hotel is the site of the Noon day gun which is accessible from the hotel via an underground walk-way.

Reviews.Title: “First class staff but slightly dated room.”
Reviews.Author: BB2Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my missus first week Aug 2012 for five nights. Location excellent (ideal for shopping, nightlife and access to transport links). Very welcoming and informative front door and reception staff. Room was big although a little dated. We had a deluxe view over harbour which would have been perfect except for a major land reclamation project directly in front of the hotel. (The photo in hotel blurb is slightly misleading as part of the Marina area opposite has now gone). Room facilities very good and staff could not do enough to assist. Take advantage of turn down service. Fresh towels, water and a bathroom clean all part of the service. Breakfast at level one was very good. We paid extra however for Executive lounge on 31st Floor. This was best value anywhere. It costs $HK250 pp per day - about £20. For that you get breakfast, lunch, evening canapes and all you can drink - not alcohol in afternoon. Also included a newspaper and internet access. Canapes were magnificent! The staff in the lounge were second to none and the manager was a delight. Overall this was a very good base with great facilities but it was just a little dated. If its your first time in Hong Kong use the trams, Star Ferries, funicular railway to the Peak - best views, good restaurants and shopping here. Bus ride to Stanley, Aberdeen and Repulse Bay is great fun and dirt cheap. Go over on Star Ferry to Kowloon. Taxis everywhere and cheap but your heart will be in your mouth with traffic! Have fun. BB2

Reviews.Title: “Very basic room - nice but nothing luxurious”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJohn64
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at 5 other hotels on this trip this was an interesting comparative hotel. It is in a great location at Causeway Bay if you want to be on the island or want to shop. However the rooms are basic - functional, but basic. Nothing wrong with them but more 4 star than 5 star. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Requests to room service (for example for fresh milk for me room) were prompt and no hanging around expecting a tip. I did about 16 hours in the hotel so it was a good choice - I hardly unpacked. Room service for early the next morning (I had to catch a flight) was prompt as requested. Gym was small but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Still has charm”
Reviews.Author: carol h
Reviews.Content: Not the swankiest of HK hotels by any means but a return stay at the Excelsior didn't disappoint. Despite the rather run down appearance of the reception and the size/decor of the rooms, this hotel still has a great deal of charm. The staff are really good and very welcoming. We particularly enjoyed the service and food at the in house chinese restaurant. The dim sum was excellent good and the staff even provided a shawl when I said the air con was a bit fierce. Breakfast also has a great choice. Great location on the island and would recommend this hotel which is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rongpona
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior hotel is a real value for money hotel in Hong Kong. Very friendly and helpful staff. Check in experience was one of the best I have ever had.One person took charge of my entry and accompanied me right upto the room. He explained all about the location,facilities nearby and answered all queries i had on Hong Kong! He also personally walked down with me to the street to show me the way to a nearby pharmacy. The rooms are not very large but adequate. I stayed with my wife and 12 yr old son for whom and additional bed was provided. regarding room selection, I stayed in the room 2112 with city view as I had opted for that option. I could have opted for a bay view room for 500 HKD for 4 nights. If you are particular about view, the Victoria garden view is better now as the Bay view is affected by the Causeway Bay Typhoon shelter currently under construction. Location is superb with shops,malls-Times ,Sgo etc.and MTR station all within 2 -5 minutes walk.For the fitness minded,apart from the hotel gym,the Victoria garden,just adjoining the hotel is great option. The roof top restaurants offer a breathtaking view of the city. The breakfast buffet is really sumptuous and one of the best I have seen with the widest variety of choices. I would recommend the made to order fresh fruit juice stand, a part of the buffet offerings. The only drawback is the absence of a swimming pool. All in all,a great stay and would return again whenever I am back in HKG.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: LABarbs
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for 1 night and found it perfect for travelers who love to shop. The place is very near in Coastway bay area where you can find Sogo, Times Square and LEe square garden, aside from the branded boutique shop around the area. THe standard room is just an average room.

Reviews.Title: “A Mandarian Oriental in name only”
Reviews.Author: Diane2028
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Excesior for a week. It is in a good position overlookng the harbour. We were fortunate to be put in a harbour view room but dont know if I would have paid th £800 extra for two rooms with the view. The rooms are satisfactory but walls are paper thin, You can hear what is happening in the room next door and flushing of next doors toilet through the night. We did not book breakfast as it was £20 per head and we were not sure how hungary we would be in the mornings. There is a nice coffee shop in the hotel which does coffee and fresh pastries The gym is quite extensive and I had a very nice massage. However the room is next to the changing rooms and I was disturbed by someone thinking it was the mens changing room, not ideal. Overall it was and adequate hotel for what we wanted but it is very buy and do not expect the service or facilites normally expected from a Mandarin Oriental

Reviews.Title: “good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mother00
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong Kong a number of times and usually stay on Kowloon. However I was attending a meeting on the island at the University and stayed with our friends. We got a very good deal for an Excutive Floor room from Qantas holidays. The hotel is definitely past its prime and could do with refurbishment. However the rooms are spacious for Hong Kong, though the bathrooms are very small. The Staff in the Executive Lounge and Business Centre were very helpful indeed. The all day snacks in the Executive Lounge were good. I enjoyed our stay there and it is well located to shops MTR. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel without the bling I think it fits the bill. I did find the lack of a ewimming pool in summer a drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great weather & great city!”
Reviews.Author: Shells23
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to HK and absoutley loved our stay. Views are spectacular but if you don't have a full harbour view room the views are not great at all. Plus there are building works (reclaiming the land) immediately opposite the hotel. We found Dickings Bar in the hotel great for a drink and a bite to eat as we arrived fairly late. We found the staff to be surprising unhelpful though. We travelled home on a late evening flight. We were promised a room that we could quickly shower in/change before our flight but when we wanted to use the room later that evening the hotel said that they don't offer a shower/changing facility. The Peak Tram is a must. There are shopping malls every few steps in HK - loved the air con and Star Ferry also provides a great city view. The Excelsior roof top bar is great too. All in all the Excelsior is a nice hotel, a little dated but very clean, comforatble and if you pay for a room with a view it'll make your holiday. Would love to return to HK!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: aamManila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing extremely fancy but service is good and rooms are clean. The blow drier works in a peculiar manner though. Located in a drawer below the TV set, you have to pull out the drawer completely before the drier will start. Something like, the drawer is the ON OFF button of the drier. I had to ask the Housecleaning staff how it works and she explained it in an "irritated" manner: like she gets asked the same question many times a day or an " Haven't you worked a blow drier before?" attitude. They do not have a swimming pool but there is a gym and a sauna room for guests. They have a breakfast room and quite a few dining areas. However, it is great to walk around the streets in Causeway Bay to find local Chinese or Western food. Shopping is at the doorstep of the Excelsior Hotel-everything is within a few minutes walk. Great location in Hong Kong's shopping district!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, good seaview luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamalad_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: It's the 2nd week I'm in HK and moved from Cyber Port to Causeway Bay. It's very convenient location to everywhere and I booked sea view room in this hotel. All the staffs are nice and helpful. There're always crowd of people in the lobby check-in & check-out and noisy sometimes, but it doesn't matter. The sea view room is great:comfortable king size bed, cozy sofa, convenient working stations. The only one thing I have little concern is that the bathroom is not such big. Considering I'm in Causeway Bay area, it's not a big deal. All in all, it's a great luxury hotel in a very convenient location and have wonderful sea view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Location!"”
Reviews.Author: PING228
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel! I haved stayed here 4 times. The executive floor with habour view is the best. Breakfast at the cafe is fabulous. Llight lunch, snacks, cocktails are complimentary at the executive club with breathtaking view. Service is excellent! Even though the room is a bit old, it is clean and acceptable. I would definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location great service”
Reviews.Author: Janineg8
Reviews.Content: It's a bit expensive for the size of the room you get but it is located on the water front and close to causewaybay metro line to get around. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and very average...”
Reviews.Author: TooshMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business, last time in March. The rooms are decent sized but very old. This was what I remember hotels looking like in the 80s. The bed is comfy though. Bath is also ok. They need to get some renovation done...and this would be good again. Close to all the shopping in Causeway Bay...I have walked to the large malls about 10 min away on the last few trips. Also, walk able to the Happy Valley Rugby stadium, during Sevens week...but then the hotel gets really crowded...so watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, reasonably located, ok for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Strapittoapigeon
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for one night. Was convinced to upgrade (later check out, laundry cost reduction and lounge). Could not use the lounge in hotel as I was "not dressed appropriately". I begged to differ with the heat! Good breakfast. Smallish rooms that really need an upgrade but are more than adequate for what I needed. I busy place with lots going on and people constantly around the lobby it can prove hard to get staff attention. All in all would probably use again - the main indicator of satisfaction. Felt a little pricey but that is probably Hong Kong...

Reviews.Title: “Still far too average and dated”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: It has been just over 6 months since my last visit and I am not surprised to see that little has changed. I wont go into too much detail because my previous review back in December 2011 is all still relevant. Staff are friendly in most parts and I found the front desk and concierge staff to be very efficient which is something I value most from hotel staff. I very briefly popped down to the refurbished Dickens Bar and found it to be dark, cold and full of the same miserable and unhelpful staff on the planet.....I did a uturn and went straight up to the Terrace on the roof. This too however was a silly mistake as the bar staff here were totally incompetent!!!! Although the view was great (and the light show was taking place as we arrived) we were there for a total of 45 minutes before our drinks arrived. When we got there we sat down, there was only about 6 other tables occupied. 5 minutes later we had to ask the waiter who was standing beside me (less then 6 ft away) the whole time and never once bothered to acknowledge us for a drinks menu. Then after 10 minutes I had to approach him again to take our order because he couldnt be bothered approaching us again. Then 25 minutes later I asked where our drinks where and he disappeared to go look. Eventually another bar person came up to ask us what we originally ordered and then finally the drinks arrived. Then the most unusual thing occured, the same waiter stood over me until I signed the bar tab...I told him politely I would fill it in when I was ready to which he replied "ok but I must stand here till you do"! It was APPALLING service! The other major negatives about this hotel are the room decors which are so dated its not funny anymore, the lift waiting times and the cost of everything! I needed to have a shirt laundered...it came to almost $10...not acceptable! This hotel has had its day, its time for the Excelsior to Excel again because right now its at the bottom of the barrel of prestige hotels in HKG.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price - rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: BritinBangkok
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise staying at the Excelsior in Causeway Bay. The hotel is an old establishment having been around for many decades and there are remnants of the old days in the way the rooms are designed and decorated. The internet prices being quoted per room were quite reasonable for a Oriental managed hotel and although the rooms are very small, they are clean, odour free, and the A/C reasonably quiet and keeps the temperature cool at night. Bed linen is nice and cosy and the pillows large and fluffy. An iPod docking station is offered at the bedside although it didn't seem to work very well at the time. You do hear the activity of other guests in their rooms and I guess it's a popular hotel because it goes on incessantly. The hotel is a bit outside of the main areas of TST and Central, but Sogo is nearby and there are lots of small shops and restaurants around the area to keep things interesting as well as the MTR closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Money and amazing view of Harbour”
Reviews.Author: amit511
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Excelsior for couple of nights in a business trip. From outside the Hotel did not seem so great but they have done an excellent job in perfecting it from Inside. Its close to the business district and the station is also at a walking distance. Had little bit of struggle with Dinner but breakfast spread was good. Though it is a little far from Airport but I am guessing that would be the case with all hotels which are closer to the Business District.

Reviews.Title: “The lttle frills hotel on Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyPicky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good business hotel. Neat rooms, though needs some refurbishing. The restauarnats rae okay - but the buffet at the Cafe on 1st Floor is quite a bore. Especially if you are staying at the hotel for an extended period of time - like i spent 10 days here. The food is the same and at times, the morning food gets carried foward for dinner and the next morning breakfast as well...

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: PKa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior at the end of June 2012. We had 2 deluxe harbour view rooms, one for my family (2 adults and 12 yrs old) and one for my parents. Everything was excellent from the moment we entered into the arrivals hall B at the airport. Our driver was there to greet us and in few minutes we were on our way to the hotel with their 5 seater Toyota. Check-in was a breeze, we entered at 9:30 AM and one of the rooms was ready so we unloaded unnecessary stuff there and prepared to leave to explore the city. Before we could leave, hotel delivered some fruits and bottle of red wine and jug of jasmine tea into the room, nice suprise :). Went out to see the city and when we came back at 3PM our second room was also ready. The rooms, well yes, they are not the most modern in Hong Kong for sure, and could use some work, but then again, everything works. Size of the rooms was ok, even in our room with the extra bed, we never felt too cramped. And the view was amazing, even with reclaiming work done at the front of the hotel. We ate once at the Dickens, food was nice, service good and the prices not too bad. We also had drinks at the TOTT terrace and while views and drinks were fine the service...well, it was slow and somehow, I don't know, it made us feel not wanted, I don't know.But that TOTT experience was the only even remotely bad experience in this hotel. The location could not be better, couple of minutes to MTR and couple mor to trams. And Causeway Bay is really full of shopping and dining places. So yes, I could back to this hotel anyday, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel with great views over the bay”
Reviews.Author: Navi76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excelsior Hotel at end of April this year. Stayed 6 blissful nights on the 14th floor. This hotel is great location with good views over the bay. The room was small and clean whth everything that you needed. Hong Kong is so great that we hardly spent any time in the room as there were lots of places to go and things to see. The breakfast in the hotel was amazing, never experienced a hotel quite like it. There was a variety of different types of food, continental, traditional hong kong style soups, noodles etc , british - Everything cooked to order and fresh, It was such an experience. The hotel had a lovely bar which we spent some time in but we were more often than not out. We dined in the hotel restaurant one night as it had a beautiful setting which was great, food was just as luxurious as the setting, a great meal. Hong Kong is one of my favourite places as it was just how i imagined it to be. I will be returning and would definitely stay at this hotel again...everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: melosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights here. I slept well every night & loved its proximity to the MTR . It is true that the rooms are small..but they aren't THAT small by HK ( or even NYC) standards. I've stayed in much smaller. They could do with a refresh - especially the bathrooms ,but then the prices would probably go up a bit While, not a bargain property - it is great value for HK and the location. I loved the little touches ..like leaving a bookmark next to your book. I've stayed at Mandarin Orientals before and could notice some influences here & there that would mark it as part of the family - but don't expect full MO lservice /amenities here. I didn't bother with the "upgrade" they offered- because truly I spent very little time in my room as I was in HK for leisure & wanted to enjoy every minute I was there soaking up the atmosphere that makes Hong Kong my favorite city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Business/holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week recently, and was very happy with the accomodation. Rooms are a bit small, but it is an older hotel, and the view more than made up for this shortfall. The top floor restaurant has excellent views, alhough found the menu to be a bit pricey. However, it would probably be comparable to other top end hotels with similar views. Fresh fruit every day was a bonus. Make sure you go to the SOGO store just behind the hotel for some good shopping and Times Sq is only 5 mins walk away. Lot of good restaurants with friendly staff nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: MrsACM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a side harbour view, which was worthy of the upgrade without getting silly. Great location, easy access to the Tram system and also to the crossing of the harbour. Without any question a highlight of our trip was dining at The rooftop restaurant overlooking the bay. We preferred the Island to Kowloon, and was pleased with our hotel selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / bar”
Reviews.Author: ianbeale
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently .... nice fresh new look to the Dickens bar ... happy hour prices only apply to some drinks so worth checking before ordering . During the euro football , the bar is screening all games live , so a great place to watch a late night game ... some start at 3 am local hk time ... Some times it can take a while , even if you are first in line , for the reception staff to acknowledge your presence .. a tad annoying ... WHY DO THE MAIDS HAVE TO YELL DOWN THE CORRIDOR TO EACH OTHER AT ALL HOURS OF THE DAY AND NIGHT ????? The room i had was small ish , but practical,,, hotel is in a great location and 2 mins from the great subway system .

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality with an attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: AndyHeppelle
Reviews.Content: Located where the noontime gun looks over the harbour, this hotel combines welcoming hospitality with efficient service and an attention to detail that makes for a unique experience

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Moichee
Reviews.Content: My experience was good at this hotel primarily because of the personal attention and service given. I was impressed with a manager by the name of Henry, who personally saw me off when I left the hotel for the airport. The general service quality was excellent even though at times it was hard to get through on the phone when I called for the reception. The location is hard to beat as it is right at the door step of alot of shops and activity. Will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: CLL10
Reviews.Content: From the first touch point i.e checking in till the last day of my stay....I must say it has been superb!! Stayed there for 7 days and even when you call up to inquire on places of visit, room service etc etc....they call you by name!! how personalised.....Since I went there with my mom, the receptionist was very very thoughtful and suggested a room not too far from the elevator (how many hotels would do that for u??) Food at the restaurant was good and the egg tarts were really yummy!! a must have....Great Staff very professional curteous and delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, no thanks.”
Reviews.Author: tceandm
Reviews.Content: A great view from the bar on the 34th floor is about as good as gets for this hotel. Land is incredibly expensive in Hong Kong and so you don't expect the kind of room you might get else where in the East but... Expensive, noisy, small rooms (avoid corner rooms ! you have never seen anything so pokey!), staff that really couldn't care less with the sole exception of Robert the concierge. If you like the feel of airport check in's then this is for you! A real shame.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd H
Reviews.Content: You can't do better than The Excelsior in Hong Kong. Great staff, great room, great breakfast and the Dickens's do a fantastic curry buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chiangipannie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Causeway Bay next to the MTR station, very convenient going anywhere. The service is overall good except the wi-fi service is not free, and it cost hk$ 35.00 per hour. Even that the connection is not good. The staff are polite except that one early mooring I called the front desk and I rang for 10 minutes and no one answered the phone so I had to run down to the desk. Otherwise it is all good. The room are clean and the housekeeper are good. I will stay again next visit to hk.

Reviews.Title: “rooms a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: DavidSnellUk
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location 1 minute walk from Causeway Bay MTR station great for business and shopping efficient check in usual very high level of service cons: rooms a bit dated rooms small even by Hong Kong standards

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel especially if you get a free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Bob666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business as part of preferred hotel. Usually stay at Park Lane but was pleased that company had moved to Excelsoir as was expecting something more upmarket with Mandarin brand. Overall, the Excelsoir was more or less the same as Park Lane: although the room was smaller, I was happy to receive a free upgrade to harbour view. This gave me a great view to watch the sunset over the harbour whilst sipping a beer. I like the pub atmosphere of the Dickens Inn: although the service was slow on occassion. The Chinese restaurant was very good with excellent waiter: although the prices were on the high side. Good location near Causeway Bay MTR. Overall recommended as long as don't pay more than HKD1400.

Reviews.Title: “Great value is great position for business trip”
Reviews.Author: winecaddie
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Excelsior and we were very happy with all aspects of our stay there. The price was great for the value offered. The room is OK, not large, but then this was HongKong and we were staying at a 4 star hotel. The Executive lounge facilities were very useful. The staff were very friendly, helpful and the elevator system efficient. Close to the Metro and vibrant restaurant & shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Excelsior 4 times in the past 6 years and each time has been a great experience. From the person from the hotel meeting us either at the airport or the cruise ship terminal (always on time in a spotless vehicle) to the front desk staff to the concierge (Steve has been there for at least 6 years and is always helpful), I've found the service to be excellent. The rooms are spacious and if you're lucky enough to have a harbour view room, you can sit and watch the boats go by endlessly. Yes, there is land reclamation happening in front of the hotel in the bay but that's part & parcel of Hong Kong these days. The buffet is a bit pricey compared to North American standards but the food is good and there's a good selection. Excellent location - close to the Causeway Bay MTR station and an easy walk to Sogo and Times Square. Victoria Park is just down the street if you're looking for some parkland in the midst of a big city. I'm already planning my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: eDUBShanghai
Reviews.Content: The good: Absolutely the location in the heart of Causeway Bay, I got to do as much shopping, go to movie, n meet friends without wasting time on traffic. The bad: The room is a bit small n the hotel is very old. The ugly: Not really... This is a very pragmatic n convenient hotel, n I'll recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased me”
Reviews.Author: Yarmm
Reviews.Content: I love to stay here, it was near shopping centre in causewaybay, the room was great,comfy and clean, the food was AWESOME, bless the chef! Its a small hotel but i had very good experience here...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MajidNasiriNejad
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Hong Kong. The location was excellent near the main streets and public transportations. lots of shops and mall. the problem was just internet fee was not included in the room rate. it was very cheap but I don't know why was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: DidiandBW
Reviews.Content: Second stay in the past year. Always good. Never disappointing. Lovely staff. Excellent breakfast selection. Great bar in the basement. Good shops and local transport.

Reviews.Title: “A classic Hong Kong experience”
Reviews.Author: ScottN59
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Hong Kong in years and the hotel rates were appallingly high. I got a good deal at The Excelsior and expected the adage "you get what you pay for". I was wrong. It was a real surprise. The location was great (although their famous harbour view fast disappearing with reclaimed land and rampant land development in front of the hotel) and the rooms clean, functioning and terrific value. By far the best aspect was the staff - they couldn't do enough to make me feel at home. It's my first choice for future Hong Kong trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: NongFooTom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior in Hong Kong last night, and got a decent rate of HKD 1,780 on a Monday night, for a regular room. Checkin was very typical, front desk was well trained and scripted and my luggage was brought up to my room promptly. Room was clean and orderly. No extras, no surprises. I was hungry and devoured two bags of peanut M&M that were calling my name from near the mini-bar. That was a happy moment. Bed was comfortable and I slept very well. Got up, checked out. Got in the taxi queue, and realized that in HK taxis are very scarce during rush hour, so waited about 30 minutes for the 15 people ahead of me to get their taxis. I checked at the front desk to see if they could call a taxi for me or if there was a hotel car, but nothing was available, but to get back in the taxi queue. I had meetings until 2, and they held my luggage until I returned later to retrieve it. Overall, good service. Nothing extra, but also nothing missing.

Reviews.Title: “Club Floor Room Choice”
Reviews.Author: Konrad J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Service is great but be careful they don't position your room under the club floor dining area, as therse are quite noisy. The views form the club lounge are really spectacular and a great way to destress from Hong Kongs blistering pace. I would stay again but not under the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a Mandarin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: G4Tokyo
Reviews.Content: The reference to Mandarin in the hotel's name, might have raised my expectations a little too high. There was nothing really wrong with the hotel, but the rooms are showing their age despite recent renovations and I was expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChilliFrank
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business and holiday trip and stayed on one of the the 'executive floors'. There were a few inclusive extras thrown in when you pay a little extra such as a personalised check-in facility without queueing in the lobby (this can get busy at times). We also had access to the executive lounge where you can have a little snack and a glass of wine (both complimentary) early evening. We used to go here before we went out for dinner. We also paid for the limousine pickup at the airport and this was very slick. This hotel is not the best in terms of great luxury nor impressive public areas, but it runs like clockwork, has great staff and is in a great location with harbour views across to Kowloon available. A little tip about room temperatures ... most guys like a room to be cooler than their woman and the room control would not let me set it below 20c so I asked for help at the excecutive reception area and they got their enginerr to change it to allow me to set to 16 or 17c. Interestingly, they confirmed that they usually 'lock out' the lower temperature range.

Reviews.Title: “Decent standard in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: DavidRed
Reviews.Content: I'd certainly use this hotel for personal as well as business travel. I found staff very polite and helpful and the location could not be better for shops restaurants and MTR station. I think it offers good value and would recommend it for a short break in Hong Kong. For a longer break I might choose a larger room in this hotel, or splash out on a five-star. But if you're overwhelmed by the choice for your short break this is a safe choice unlikely to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Location with a view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: MaryCairn
Reviews.Content: A beautiful facility . The rooms are small in comparison to North America, however, all amenities are provided and the room is certainly comfortable. If you are fortunate to have a room facing Victoria Harbour, all the better for the amazing view. The restaurant is amazing with more than enough choices of delicious food. The English pub downstairs is also very good. The location is very convenient for shopping and excursions as well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Lady of Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: PhileasMole
Reviews.Content: I first went ot the Excelsior in 1981 - and nothing has changed! Oh yes, the hotel facilities have been upgraded and refreshed to 21st Century standards but the sheer excellence of everything about the place has not been dulled by the passage of time. The rooms are the same spacious and well appointed one of years ago - perhaps a LITTLE tired now but nothing to complain about, the staff are friendly, courteous and helpful, the food excellent (TRY the room service fish 'n' chips - outstanding!), the location convenient and on and on and on. NOW REMEMBER - this is a 4 star tourist hotel. It's managed by the Mandarin Oriental Group and lives up to that standard but it is NOT a luxury hotel. Merely comfortable, practical, reasonably priced and EXCELLENT value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: xpao87x
Reviews.Content: DETAILS: - Stayed for 2D/1N from May 3, 2012 to May 4, 2012. Standard twin bed room on the 17th floor. PROS: - Room – was sufficient for our overnight stay. It had all the amenities as well as a mini couch given that our room’s size was at a bare minimum. The thing that I loved most about our room was it was right across the elevator. - Food – was so-so. I tried their Steak Teppanyaki which was part of their special menu and it was quite alright. Presentation was good. - Location – is excellent. A clear 10/10 for me. I’ve stayed in the Excelsior for 4-5 times already because of its perfect location. It’s near all the shopping hubs along Causeway Bay and the nearest MTR only takes around 5 minutes. CONS: - Room – just a minor complaint about the size of the bed. 4 of us stayed in the room which might become a hassle if you’re planning to stay long haul. I can’t blame the establishment though since our room choice was meant for just two people to stay in. The only thing is, some other hotels offer much bigger beds. - Staffs – what can I say, it’s Hong Kong. Some locals are still snobbish. OVERALL - Stay here – if you want a hassle free location during your stay in Hong Kong. - Do not stay here – if you want more rest & relaxation during your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Colin-E-Rice
Reviews.Content: Despite this being a huge hotel in the middle of one of the most crowded cities in the world, the staff of the Excelsior are so charming and want you to enjoy every moment of your stay. We took the Mercedes Limo from the airport, and when we arrived at the hotel we were personally greeted outside the hotel and led to the check-in counter. Everyone, down to the security and breakfast table waiters, seem personally pleased to looking after you (the only exception was one surly chamber maid, perhaps she was afraid of speaking English). When we took the limo back to HK airport, several of the conceirge waved goodbye to us right at the street, it was like saying good-bye to your own family. Quite an experience. The hotel itself is right in the centre of Causeway Bay close to all the action, and with a roaring highway out front, don't expect this to be a peaceful neighbourhood; you're really right in the centre of the action. The rooms are in excellent shape, with super sound-proofed windows so you can't hear any of the din outside. We slept like a log on the king-sized bed with over-sized heavenly pillows, there's a sofa-seat in the window bay with probably one of the best city views in the world, plush and clean carpets (we don't often walk bare-footed in a hotel), large safe, flat TV. Spotless bathroom with powerful H&C bath/shower, decent toiletries. Only grumble: The TV seemed on the small side given this is a luxury hotel, a 42in+ would be better, and it oddly didn't swivel, especially given the comfy bay window sofa was a pleasant spot to sit and watch after a long day shopping, I had to drag/scrape the screen around. Also the TV channels kept pausing and blanking out with irritating regularity, it was like watching YouTube over a crappy broadband. Overall, if you want be in the middle of all the action HK has to offer, this is the best . Tourist tip: take the tunnel through the car-park to see the noon-day gun. Ka-boom!! not often you can stand 3 metres from a 3-pound cannon firing-off

Reviews.Title: “Very fair value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Youssef M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Excelsior for a business trip to Hong Kong with a small business group. We were very satisfied about what we have expected from the level of the services provided to us. The concierge is very professional also as the housekeeping and the room service. The situation of the hotel is perfect if you have some business around on Hong Kong Island. To resume it's a very faire value for money, not very expensive compared to other hotels in Hong Kong with the same same standards. Kind Regards,

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a busy place... with good service”
Reviews.Author: Jill35dg
Reviews.Content: This is a humming hotel in that is is always busy....lots of airline crews use it too as well as tour groups. The better rooms are really very practical and useful... do try and get some view of the harbour if you can. Staff are responsive and helpful and being part of the Mandarin Oriental hotel group, helps the service standards dramatically. Service levels are generally high in Hong Kong and they certainly are among the top niche for their level and price range. It seems prices for all food outlets has gone up but they are all good places...Totts the roof top bar does a delightful Sunday Brunch- don't rush it. My only moan is related to internet charges... one can sit in a cafe and buy a cup of tea or coffee and get free internet but not in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulus Stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: FranciMilano
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights for our summer vacation. I did my reservation via their web site one week before my arrival in Hong Kong, and we decide for a double room + extra bed for our child. When we arrived, the girl at the reception suggested a better accommodation for an extra (ridicoulus extra!) at the top floor, with free access to the Executive Club (for our breakfast and light lunch). We were just entered in our beautiful room, when two housemaids came with extra pillows, hot tea and a gift for our boy! From our room, we could see the spectacular view of the Victoria Harbour!!! The breakfast was fantastic and so were the dinner we had in two different inside restaurants. All the people was very friendly and helpful, giving us a lot of informations and advices, including the day trip to Macau (they prepared a packed lunch for our boy!!!). We left an old T-Shirt in the room, and the day of our departure, I got an e-mail from the hotel, where they would send it back to Italy (!!!). Furthermore, we got another email form the General Manager, who thank us for the appreciations we wrote in the survey we did. I strongly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable price for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: VirgoQualitySeeker47
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong hotels are not cheap so this was good value with a spacious room by Hong Kong standards. Comfortable beds and a view of the harbour although this was busy with diggers, cranes etc as they are reclaiming land near the old yacht club. We had a view of the noon day gun and were able to watch this being fired from the room. Sadly the weather was cloudy and cold so the views weren't as good as they might have been. Breakfast was expensive but as this hotel is next to a conference centre and linked to a shopping mall there are alternative places to go for a more casual breakfast. We were there two nights so did try the hotel breakfast one day as it was a wet Sunday - it was good if you have time to have a leisurely breakfast and don't mind paying the price.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tinaklo
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior hotel is the most convenient place to stay if you want shopping, restaurant and everything. Although the hotel is quite old , the interior is kept quite well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “great location in HKG”
Reviews.Author: francesco c
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Excelsior hotel in Hong Kong for couple of days. Well, the hotel is very well located! The subway is very close, lots of restaurants and shops nearby and not far from the main attraction. The staff is very attentive and caring and always ready to help you. The only downside for me was the appearence, as it a good restyling of the rooms is needed. Not that the rooms are bad or ugly, it's just that looks a bit old. For breakfast and dinners I choose to eat outside, as it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn G
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Excelsior! Perfect location (near food, shopping, the MTR,Victoria Park, and overlooking the harbour), excellent staff, lovely hotel. As a surprise, my husband called ahead to have flowers arranged and put in our room, as it was our 25th wedding anniversary. Not only did they have a gorgeous flower arrangement in the bed, but the General Manager had a bottle of complimentary champagne on ice and fruit in the room for us! And they had moved us to a higher room for better harbor views. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: warmhappyfeet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights over a weekend after a business trip into China so I could see Hong Kong and some relatives. The Excelsior is a Mandarin Oriental property but isn't quite up to a full Mandarin Oriental hotel. Nonetheless it is a nice hotel. It is certainly older but it is still a very good hotel. The room I had was a harbour view but on the corner so it was an odd shaped room. You can see by the hotel pictures it is a roundish hotel. The odd shaped room made the layout a bit odd but it is still useable. By Hong Kong standards it's a decent sized room. Upon check in the staff was very good. I think that is one thing that is Mandarin Oriental level. The time we were there it was quite rainy so it was good to see that the hotel had many umbrellas in good working condition for the guests. We were able to sample a few of the restaurants in the hotel due to the bad weather keeping us from straying too far away. Had a lunch buffet at the Dickens bar downstairs. Very good array of food and the place was packed at lunch. Had dinner at their Italian restaurant Cammino. It was a bit over priced but the food was good. Had the spaghetti bolognaise. It was excellent. Also had the breakfast buffet on their second floor that is open to the lobby and has views of the harbour. Good staff here again and a large array of food choices including a juice bar where you can choose the fruit you want mixed together and they juice it in front of you. It is not cheap but buffets at major hotels never are but this one was very good to go along with the cost. As noted above, the location is excellent. It is attached to the World Trade Center shopping mall which has some unique stores in it. Check out UNIQLO for inexpensive interesting clothing. It is also just down the passage away from Sogo and many other stores. That also means it is also very close to the Causeway Bay MTR station. It is truly just steps away from the hotel doors. We did get a very good rate so I think that would depend on how much you end up enjoying this hotel. In the end if I got a good rate again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room”
Reviews.Author: nijunihk
Reviews.Content: Most of these reviews are accurate. The rooms are tired-looking, but everything worked & was clean. Room size is adequate for 2 people w/luggage (especially for HK). In my mind, location is perfect, though it may not be perfect for everyone (judging by the complaints about crowds). Causeway Bay can be wall-to-wall on the weekend (sometimes during the week too) - fair warning. Taxi from Hong Kong Station (Airport Express) to Excelsior was HK$45 @ 23:00 on a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to stay here many times and have always had a good experience. The location of the hotel is great, right in the middle of Causeway Bay with great views of the harbour and Kowloon. The rooms are a little small and, as commented on in other reviews, a little dated but everything works, the beds are great and they contain every facility you could possibly need. There is a good choice of bars and restaurants. The gym is good and the service excellent. The only negative is the price of the in-room internet. The Excelsior will always be one of my first choices when staying in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excelsior, for the third time, during the Hong Kong Sevens last month, and I have to say that our stay was excellent as always. We arrived late in the afternoon on the 22nd to book into three rooms. One of the rooms was ready but unfortunately two were not. This was to be expected due to the 7's being on and the hotel was undoubtably full. However, the staff could not have been more apologetic and moreso helpful. We were able to freshen up in the room that was available, and extra towels and amenities were immediatley sent to the room. The other two rooms were soon ready for occupation and all was well. We received a letter from the management team the next morning apologising for the issue which was a nice touch. Another nice touch was the hotel prepared a packed breakfast for us on the Saturday and Sunday due to our very early departure to the Hong Kong Stadium. Nothiing was too much trouble throughout our stay and I cannot praise the hotel high enough. Thank you very much to all and we look forward to our next visit, hopefully next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Older property, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Excelsior quite often. The hotel is decent in all regards, and has recently undergone some renovations. I love staying in Causeway Bay, and this hotel provides good value in that location. Nothing is cheap in Hong Kong. But the service is pretty good, the views from the rooms are nice, and there is lot to do within a few minutes walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: dcc78
Reviews.Content: My group of 4 went to Hong Kong during the Easter holidays and we stayed in The Excelsior. Although there was a queue to check-in, the reception was pretty fast and we had our rooms, upgraded to a higher floor. The ambience was excellent and everything was orderly. In fact, I left an umbrella behind after checking out. The hotel wrote and offered to post it to me (at a fee) and this little detail impressed me too. Integrity and attentiveness. Another points worth mentioning is that this hotel is centrally located, just a minute walk to the MTR station. Shopping and dining outlets are all at the doorsteps. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: ilovehkg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5D/4N with my whole family, we occupied 4 rooms. Each room has different views but what made us stayed again(and again) this this hotel is its services - all the staffs(reception, bellboys and housekeeping) are friendly and accommodating. Location is just another plus and great factor. I would like to commend on the services offered b MS, BETTY LAM for accommodating our needs on each room. She was very helpful and friendly when we were checking in. I am looking forward to my next trip and stay in The Excelsior, Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Imogen_8
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to watch the Hong Kong 7's with Gulliver’s Travel company as tickets for the 3 day tournament are impossible to get on the open market (in fact a number of people who bought tickets on ebay this year were turned away at the gate as the tickets were fake. The Excelsior hotel is in the Causway Bay part of Hong Kong and easy walking distance to stadium. This is hotel which came with the trip package, so we didn't search through trip advisor advice beforehand. We arrived after a long flight and were met at the door by very helpful staff who took our bags before we had checked in and brought them to our room. There was no expectation of a tip and the porters were very pleasant. The check in was easy and our room was on the 23rd floor. We had not booked a harbour view room as it was a lot more expensive, but we had a good side view of the harbour and Kowloon, Our room was clean and had all the facilities which are standard in a room in 2012 including a base unit for MP3 players. The only thing lacking was free internet access so we limited our time on line on our trip. If you don't bring an ipad or computer the only access on line is through the business centre at great expense. Also Hong Kong does not have internet cafes (that we could find) and free wireless internet access around the city is virtually impossible to access with an iphone. Bring an ipad or equivalent with you if you want access to the world. The bathroom of the room was compact and clean. The room was a little dated, but not an issue unless you want boutique style. The day cleaning was very efficient and usually done by the time we got back from breakfast. Breakfast was very impressive. There is a vast buffet with every cuisine catered for. You can be healthy or really go for it. The staff at breakfast need the correct day's ticket you will be issued with when you check in. All of the staff speak good English and a particularly helpful member of staff was Andisy (if I can remember to spell his name correctly) who got us extra large glasses of orange juice without prompting, saving us trips to and from the buffet. By eating a hearty breakfast we were set up for the day and did not eat again until supper. The concierge was very helpful telling us where to catch the bus to Stanley etc. The MRT is a 2 min walk from the hotel and the star Ferry is a 10 min walk over to Kowloon. There are loads of places to eat around the hotel and the shopping is brilliant. We only ate once at the hotel in Dickens bar on the evening we were checking out. This meal was much more expensive than those around and about in the area, but it was just easier to eat there. The food is European in style and was yummy. However we loved the street food and Dim sum restaurants where you can eat very cheaply. We both felt very comfortable and enjoyed our stay. We would stay at the Excelsior again and would recommend it as a good base for a trip to HK. A number of airlines use it as their hotel and I was informed by our flight attendant that the excelsior has been the base for BA for 25 years which is a credit to them. Hong Kong is a fantastic city to visit and the 7s rugby is a brilliant experience. We hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my Dad for six nights at the Excelsior Hotel. We were thrilled with our stay - especially the helpful staff and service and breakfast buffet. We were there for the HK 7s, and it was a busy time, but our stay was very successful. We had a room with a view over to Kowloon. The room (twin share) was on the small side - but is to be expected in HK. Room was clean, tidy and well maintained. Dad had laundry done, and this was promptly returned. Great location for walking around - close to HK stadium, transport, places to eat and shop. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: summersail
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. Service is outstanding. The rooms are average size and the décor is dated. There is a nice work area if you are staying for business reasons. The bathroom is very small and towels were not of best quality, they were not thick and fluffy. The bed was comfortable and the bed linens were good quality. The room was kept very clean. The price was reasonable for the location. This is not a luxury hotel. Would be much nicer if the rooms were updated and more modern. The high level of service provided really makes a difference. The penthouse restaurant/bar was very nice, good food and the view was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in HK”
Reviews.Author: KraZkatlady
Reviews.Content: If you like the idea of being in the middle of a Black Friday sale in the USA, then this is the place for you. Located in the heart of Busy Causeway Bay, it is a nightmare trying to navigate to and from the hotel with the throngs of shoppers circling round Sogo department store. This is a very basic hotel, so don't expect any sort of luxury. Just be glad that your room has a view other than the one facing another ugly building. This place is cheap compared to other hotels in Central, but if money can buy you happiness, I would defintely go buy it elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Stewart L
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in this hotel, The staff could not of been friendlier and when I needed to use the business centre at midnight they were only too pleased to open it up for me.I went for the Hong Kong 7's so the location was an easy 20 minute walk away and a 5 minute taxi ride from evening entertainment. The accommodation was very comfortable and extremely clean.I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Baby Brother of Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: hkvisitor1997
Reviews.Content: If all you want only the best in service and superb luxurious everyway, this is not for you, on the otherhand, hotel is for sleeping, like to explore on your own, this is a perfect choice, 5 minutes walk to MTR Causeway Bay station, 5 minutes to Sogo, the most comprehensive shop for Japanese fashions and japanese grocery store outside of Japan, if you want to shop Hermes, Gucci, LV etc at Lee Garden is 10 minutes walk, for lunch, dinner or snack, World Trade Centre is just next door, also for all you need shopping, Excelsior offer some of the best food in town, you be surprise to see dozens airlines personnel at this hotel, there must a good reason and no one talks about it, the hotel show it's age, but good size room and good standard services, in this neigborhood most shops and restaurants are cater to the local Hong Kong folks, treat you just like everyone else, not as a tourist, what you see is what you would pay, no bargaining necessary, this is not Tsim Sha Tsui, most tourist are from the Mainland China, if you are not people friendly kind, keep out of Causeway Bay, this maybe the busiest streets in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Sure, we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: pathfinder09
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient since it is in the center area of HK. They have very accommodating staff in the lobby as well in the reception area. They serve good breakfast in the mezzanine floor and dinner at Totte's Bar in the penthouse level-nice view as well, overviewing the bay at night. The service is very good, in terms of changing the sheets and cleaning your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cymbelline O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our annual convention. It's a nice hotel with an excellent location. Beside this hotel is a mall and just a few steps away, you will find yourself near SOGO and Times Square. It's also very close to a MRT station which is extremely necessary. Fortunately, if you're on a budget, you can opt to take a bus which is conveniently a few minutes away from the hotel. It's relatively a quiet place later at night, but still safe to go around. The rooms on the 7th floor are quite small, but it was still manageable. Had all the amenities to enjoy a 3 day trip in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - but a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: si_mandee
Reviews.Content: If you come to HK for shopping, or business, Excelsior would be a good choice. Surrounded by malls and shops that open till 11pm, also with street foods available till late. Location is also close with MTR Causeway bay. Nothing super special about the room - except that it is clean and comfy. They also provided dock for your iphone / ipod. Furniture is a bit outdated though... Be super careful with the room key as it is super sensitive, i had to change mine twice during my 5 days stay there. I put them in separated compartment away from my cell phone - but somehow it didn't worked. Good thing that the staffs were helpful, they helped me changed my cards immediately. Foods in cafe shop were also okay, not super nice - but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wkee_18
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. It is just mins away from causeway bay MTR station. It is also in the heart of all the action. Right in the shopping stretch (next to sogo) and you can also walk to Times Square. If you are hungry, there are plenty of street food (curry fishball, etc) available minutes by foot away. The room is very small but with so much to do outside, it is good enough just for sleep. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: s w
Reviews.Content: My son stayed at the Excelsior on January 2012. On the way to the airport, he left his computer in the taxi. Vincent Ng and his staff retrieved the laptop, investigated means to return it, and arranged for it to be shipped to Australia (not as simple as it may sound). This was done cheerfully, proactively, and in as helpful a way as one might wish. Outstanding service. On a different note, my wife and I ate in Top of the Town in December 2011. An excellent meal, friendly staff but not intrusive, a wonderful location. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: User124
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for anyone looking for a top hotel (in terms of service) at a super location, but can't care too much for room size or luxury. That doesn't mean that the rooms are bad; not at all. But, they are getting a bit older and are not overly big. TOT (Talk of the Town) on the top floor is a popular and good spot for an evening drink. This actually adds to the hotel's attractiveness for people who are arriving late, do want to have a few drinks, but don't want to go out any more. A lot of hotel guests are airline staff, to give you an idea of the type of place. Good for both Business (unless you are adamant on walking to Central, if that is where you'll have to be) as well as Leisure/Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ng_ryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as a stopover. The room was large enough for 2 people, but certainly quite small for a 5 star hotel. Then again, space is at a premium in HK so that was to be expected. Location was great, right in the heart of Causeway Bay. The MTR station was only a 5 minute walk away while there is a bus stop outside the hotel that takes you to most parts of Hong Kong. One piece of advice though. Do not take the compliamentary shuttle bus offered by the MTR from Hong Kong station, unless you want an impromptu tour of Hong Kong island. Although the Excelsior Hotel was very close to Hong Kong Airport Express station, it was the 2nd last stop on the shuttle. This resulted in a 40 minute ride on the shuttle bus, and this was about 6:15am on a Saturday. Overall, a nice hotel but certainly not 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, only let fault is its dated”
Reviews.Author: NesslouTravels
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a suite on the 18th floor, slightly dated but they have thought of everything - ill also have to say the best hotel bed I've ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Top spot in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: saigondave
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights at the end February on business and I find the service outstanding. Check-in was busy but staff brought me to a side counter where i was served. Concierge service is excellent. Room was not overly spacious but well appointed, and very clean. I expect wifi to be free (as it is in many lower end hotels in Asia) but unfortunately like many other major hotels it was fairly pricey. Very handy to shops and to get to the World Trade Centre one doesn't even go outdoors! Check out Muji on the 4th floor for cool Japanese stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated, but wonderful friendly service”
Reviews.Author: AviatorHouston_UK
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to HK and we chose this hotel due to it being part of Mandarin Oriental group (we stayed recently at MO, Singapore). We chose a room on the executive floor. This costs more but gives you an improved room and use of the executive club. Being part of this club entitles you to complimentary breakfast, lunch, evening snacks and cocktails. Also free coffee, beer and soft drinks all day. In other words much more than the upgrade cost. On checking in we were offered an upgrade to a suite for $400HK per day. Fantastic value for an very large room and separate living room and kitchen. A few extra goodies were delivered to the room. The location of the hotel, overlooking Victoria Harbour to Kowloon is perfect. Easy access to the MTR/trams/buses a few streets away. Lots of restaurants and shops close by but, surprisingly, very few bars. The bars in the hotel are expensive but your Exec Club membership gives you 20% off drinks and food in the hotel. We ate once at the hotel's cantonese restaurant 'Yee Tung Heen' and it was excellent. Downside of the hotel is that it is fairly old with rather brutal architecture. The rooms are slightly dated but very clean. The bathroom is very small with a difficult to control shower over the bath. Whilst that was quirky it did not bother us too much. All in all, a very good hotel with extremely pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Position Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ1950
Reviews.Content: We decided on this, our 3rd trip to Hong Kong, to stay on the island and chose The Excelsior because of its close proximity to shops, restaurants, MTR, trams, buses and of course the harbour view. Check-in was smoothly and efficiently handled, our room (on the 18th floor) was larger than expected, with a comfy king sized bed, with large soft pillows. There was a 2 seater couch, an armchair, a very roomy working desk, luggage bench, large wardrobe, mini bar, etc., and the bathroom, although small, was well fitted out. The view out over the harbour was mesmerising. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning - wow, what a huge variety of foods. Loved the freshly squeezed fruit or vegetable juice bar. We had a drink at TOTTS and enjoyed it so much, decided to eat there the first night of our stay. Very delicious meal! Unfortunately the Dickens Bar was closed for renovation during our stay so we didn't get to check this out. Can recommend the little coffee shop by the lifts - very tasty snacks and great coffee! A special thanks to the ladies on the housekeeping staff for the bookmarks you left by our novels on the bedside tables. Very thoughtful!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Thexder
Reviews.Content: Convenient location - near Causeway Bay MTR station, shopping malls, restaurants, etc. Rooms are small as in all HK hotels. There is an airport shuttle bus that comes here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Happy6683
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel for a week. The location is excellent given the close proximity to shopping centers, food and mtr. The downside is that it is very noisy due to some construction in the hotel and the service is quite slow. Also, there are lots of people loitering around at the lobby which makes the place looks very messy

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kavzchat
Reviews.Content: We had travelled to HongKong for a fair organised by HKTDC. The Excelsior is very close to the Convetion Center-- typically the fair organisers have a bus pick up right at the hotel doorstep. It's also well connected to the airport-- shuttle bus to the city from the hotel and a train after that. The surroudings are great-- cross the road and check out the noon day gun, parks close by, great shopping-- if you find time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: silpinge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in Feb 2012. Overall it was a very pleasant room, on level 20, described as superior side harbour view which gives you about a 90 degree view of the harbour which is fine once you get used to not having a full view. Big room by HK standards, 30 sqm. Very comfy king size bed and bedding. Good hot shower. A remarkably quiet room, so the walls must be thick. Very friendly staff. An annoyance (not uncommon it must be said) was that the bedside lighting is way too bright and non-directional. The biggest downside is that the wifi is not free. We didn't use it on principle as there are several cafes around that have free wifi. Great location, two minutes to the MTR and a zillion shops, cafes and eat places on your doorstep. Victoria Park, a five-minute walk away, is an easily ignored treasure, an oasis of quiet and calm, with beautiful lawns and flowers. If you get the H2 shuttle from Central, it's more or less on the end of the line, so it's a good half-hour trip from Central. But you could regard that as a free sightseeing trip.
