A taxi or MTR would be quicker. On the other hand, the shuttle bus back to Central only takes 10 minutes or so. We find that with a couple of large suitcases, it's easier than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: Boonlom
Reviews.Content: As we were booked on an Air Asia package I was not sure what kind of a room to expect. But the room was very good and our request at check in for a twin was honored without any problem. Very comfortable room (a little on the small side) with everything you can expect.Very attentive and friendly staff including the most helpful concierge. And a top location for any traveler. I would stay there again on my next visit and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: JTFomes
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 0500 and the hotel staff went out of their way to get us a room-infact we checked in at 0700[amazing]. Book a front view room and you'll get the best view of Hong Kong and the Harbour that money can buy. The hotel is right beside the Underground and about a 20 minute walk to Central Star Ferry and The Outlying Territories Ferrys so the world is your lobster! For a fee, the hotel will extend checkout to late evening-vital as most of the airline departures are very late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Never had anything as good as this!”
Reviews.Author: TheDaneInAsia
Reviews.Content: I do not know if this is common to Hongkong or Asia in general - let there be no doubt that I felt cared for and comfortable to an extent that I have never met anywhere before. The service rendered was beyond expectations by far, and I definitely felt appreciated as the person I am, and not just as a customer. Thank you for an excellent stay in Hongkong, and I would recommend this hotel again and again to anyone, who is going to beautiful, terrific, exhausting Hongkong!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be refurbed”
Reviews.Author: dawn20
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location. The hotel itself is very dated and very tired. We stayed on the executive floor which I would recommend, even these rooms should be overhauled. But the staff make up for all of this and you are seldom in your room. Just on another note would highly recommend purchasing a travel card as these can be used on all buses, trams, trains, and also used when using the peak train. "Brilliant"

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: torero5
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpful staff.Breakfast and dinner buffet superb. Rooms very tired and in need of refurbishment. I suggest that you bring ear plugs with you, as this hotel has very noisy houskeeping staff, they start banging and crashing from 0730 till late at night, no consideration for guests trying to sleep, also very noisy plumbing, continuous water pipe noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: pinkfransis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a member of Mandarin Oriental hotel groups. Location wise is really good..it is smack dab in causeway bay and when you step out of your lobby it is shopping heaven and they are always busy/fully booked. However..the room itself is really dated. I think ITS TIME to do some renovation people!!!! It's pretty easy to get around with MTR and there is an MTR station close by/5 minutes walking from this hotel. Next time I am in Hongkong, I would defenitely try different hotels such as The Marcopolo or The Mira just because their rooms probably newer compared to The Excelsior. Overall good stay but not 100 % satisfied with the look of your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Elegance”
Reviews.Author: houseoflords001
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel - clean rooms, attentive staff, good position for sightseeing and a fantastic buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Large, well-located, busy, multi-function hotel”
Reviews.Author: meirionydd
Reviews.Content: We had a harbour-facing room on the executive floor. It was large, comfortable, clean and well-equipped. We ate in the Yee Tung Heen restaurant which served good Cantonese food with excellent service. We found the Expresso coffee bar useful and enjoyed the Dickens Bar in the basement which was a well-done approximation of a British pub with good pub grub; it even had English bitter and was clearly popular with expats. The roof terrace and night club looked good. There were several other very popular restaurant choices in the hotel. Service was good despite a lot of coming and going; they were used to handling crowds. Causeway Bay shops and Wan Chai traditional markets within easy walking distance and public transport close by. Land reclamation and associated building works in front of the hotel made the Star Ferry less accessible but doubtless that will pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old Hotel , make sure to stay in the Club floor”
Reviews.Author: PeterAngliongto
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times, including last week in the 19th floor and last year on the club floor. One of the great things is obviously the location, it's right besides everything, walking distance to michelin rated restaurants, literally right besides tons of shops and food outlets. The hotel itself I liken to a zoo, it's huge and there are always throngs of people all the time everywhere. Check in and out is as close to a fast food experience on a luxury level you can get. Design and atmosphere is not an exclusive hotel or unique experience but more of a very busy though well managed airport.If you stay at a club floor room, you can escape this and check in and out at the lounge in the 30+ something floor. Much Much better. The rooms on the lower levels are small but not tiny. Still in good shape despite the use and age. No red marks at all in terms of service. Club floor rooms are larger and better finished. The extra lounge exclusively for club floor guests also is quite manageably nice and always stocked with some food though small. Over all a good choice for a variety of people , if on business stay on the club floor rooms, if a family or couples travelling for leisure than a good choice for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location, no fresh air as windows locked!”
Reviews.Author: ThatMrRobinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, fantastic location close to one of the main shopping areas and MTR underground station just a few yards down the road. Hotel very has a very modern lobby area with an excellent reception, efficient and polite staff and very helpful concierge and porters never far away. Exiting the elevators it is fair to say that the rest of the hotel does not match the modern, contempory feel of the hotel lobby but it is clean and well kept. The room was very comfortable with a luggage shelf for my suitcase, kettle and mini bar fridge. There are UK plug sockets in the walls and an adaptor provided for using appliances with a different voltage. The bed was extremely comfortable, nice firm pillows and lots of them! Bathroom a little on the small side but very clean and the shower was excellent. Only downside was the air conditioning unit being the only form of ventilation. The windows in this hotel are locked & the air conditioning is difficult to get right. The room became hot and cold quite quickly although I have stayed here before and staff have unlocked my window for me on request. My room didn't have a particularly nice view (some tired looking apartments opposite), but in the past I have been given a view of the harbour which definitely makes the room feel more spacious and is well worth requesting. The maids did clean rooms quite early in the morning as I was sleeping which was a pain but this obviously can't be avoided. Breakfast buffet is fantastic with an endless array of choices and chefs present to help create your perfect omlette or eggs. There is a coffee shop in the lobby with lovely friendly staff, and the ToTT's bar on the top floor is absolutely amazing, especially the outdoor roof terrace which is perfect for some fresh air and a cockatil looking out across the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: Xan2010
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here the 3 times over the past years for a biz convention. Excellent spread for breakfast. Service staff are very attentive - from waiters to the front desk. In particular the mostly Indian door man in "red", are epitome of the good service culture here. Situated right by the harbour and the noon day gun (don't be alarmed, it goes of 12 noon daily) and of course the incredible streets of food and shopping. The Causeway Bay subway station is just round the corner. Just 8 to 10 mins by taxi from Hong Kong station if you take the Airport Express. Sogo Shopping Mall is right behind the hotel and Time Square is barely 10 mins away by foot. Price may be a little premium due to the reasons mentioned, but I guess its worth it after all. Good place for a biz stay and even with family. Kowloon across the harbour is just one stop away via the MTR (subway).

Reviews.Title: “Perfection revisited”
Reviews.Author: HongKong27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2010 and decided to return to celebrate my birthday this January 2012. This hotel does not disappoint - the Concierge's department is superb the best one I have ever encountered - nothing is too much trouble for them to help you with and advise. The staff in the Dickens Bar are great - if you go there ask for Shanti, Carol and Demi as they are so nice to deal with and so helpful. The food in the Dickens Bar is fine - very English based for when you have been eating Chinese Food for a while! The breakfast however is far too expensive but there are several cheap places around the corner. Room quality is excellent with really comfortable beds and pillows, room service is terrific and they even gave me a cake for my birthday and a birthday card! Causeway Bay is the best situated hotel for a lovely stay and good access to the rest of Hong Kong side and access to Kowloon side and beyond - forget the other hotels stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Female travelling alone”
Reviews.Author: gillod
Reviews.Content: Having done a few reviews now, I decided to focus on the things that are more important to me personally. Here goes. Keys are handed out without staff mentioning my room number. There are plenty of staff in the lobby. In the room, there are two plugs in front of the mirror, with adaptors, which is great. There is hair conditioner in the bathroom. Its surprising how often top class hotels don't supply this. The hairdryer is 1000w so takes a long time to dry my hair. There are tea and coffee supplies and a kettle. I spend a lot of time in my room, so it really is worth asking for a room with a view. There is nothing worse than being in Hong Kong and not having a view of the harbour. Charge for internet - HK130. Very central location with lots of shopping and restaurants. Top tip. Try the custard tarts from the lobby cake shop. I guarantee you will go back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Must experience once!”
Reviews.Author: Sri13
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay at this hotel for the first time when I was traveling on work. Got in, early morning ~2am and went to bed. Woke up to such an awesome sight of the harbour that I spend a few hours at the window.The rooms are spacious and the staff are friendly. Didnt try the food in the hotel. This hotel probably has the best location in terms of access to all major touristy destinations on the Kowloon side. Be it Times Square, Lang Kwai Fong etc. Ideal place to start seeing Kowloon walking.

Reviews.Title: “First class location and service on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: RandB264
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the waterfront of Hong Kong harbour. It has great views from the rooms on the front and is close to the MTR undergound station, shopping areas and bus/tram routes.The staff are extremely helpful, efficient and friendly. It was a joy to be staying here for the 10 nights that we did. We had very wide choices at breakfast and also enjoyed evening meals at the hotel's "Cafe on the First" on some evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay on an Executive floor!”
Reviews.Author: HexhamDave
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week as a long planned birthday trip for my wife and our first return to Hong Kong after living there for four years in the seventies. The Excelsior had been one of our regular haunts and we decided to stay there mainly because of its location in Causeway Bay and proximity to the MTR station. We decided to go for an Executive room because of the added value and it really paid. We always remembered the Excelsior as a frenetic hotel full of Japanese tourists. Nothing much has changed except there are also a lot of mainland Chinese staying there. The Executive lounge on the 31st floor became our home-from-home during our stay. The staff in the lounge could not have been more helpful or charming. The lounge, where you also check in and check out, is open till 11pm and teas, coffee, soft drinks and beer are available all the time. But there is also a snack lunch service [say, soup, curry, cheese, fruit and assorted pastries], afternoon tea with scones and cream, more snacks and wine from 6-8pm. And it is all included in the room rate. This meant that we only had to buy one meal a day and hardly any drinks. During the week, we probably saved on food/drink costs twice the cost of the supplement for the room. We were also entitled to a 20% discount on all food and drink anywhere else in the hotel. How does Hong Kong in 2012 compare with 1980? Much cleaner in the street and harbour, no spitting, no more bargains eating out or shopping - everything seemed more expensive than the UK, very good public parks, still the same efficient public transport with the addition of the MTR and air conditioned buses, still very good and friendly service everywhere. Best eating out experience was Cafe Too at the Island Shangri La - expensive but worth every penny for the extraordinary buffet.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior, Hong Kong in January 2012. As we had flown overnight we got to the hotel early in the day; the reception staff checked us in and then gave us a voucher to have a tea/coffee while they sought out a cleaned room for us. We we able to go to the room by 10.30 a.m. That was just the start of the excellent service which all the hotel staff provided. The hotel rooms are good, we had a harbour view, and the hotel location is good for the MTR and ferry across to Kowloon. The restaurants were good, particularly Cammino; not cheap but good value for the quality. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Manny S
Reviews.Content: The perfect location in Kowloon. Close to major shopping, MTR and ferry. TOTT's on the roof is great for bar food and outdoor experience. I have been staying at this hotel on an annual basis for the past 10+ years and it always exceeds my needs. Service is always good. Hotel website has deals that are emailed. Good values. Just finished up a week stay with my wife and daughter with no issues. If you are looking for a hotel just to lounge around the local facilities at, this is probably not the best place for you. .

Reviews.Title: “good location...but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: didiIreland
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is well situated if you need to be in Causeway bay and is only about 10 minutes in a taxi away from The IFC and the Star Ferry. However the hotel is dated with old rooms.There are so many other nicer and cheaper hotels in the area.And if you want to be near the night life of Wan Chai or Lang Quai Fong then choose one closer than The Excelsior. If you're looking to stay here I would defiantly recommend looking around at other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Tourist & Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CynWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior holds a special place in my 'hotel heart' - it was the hotel I stayed at on my very first trip to Hong Kong, in 1994. 18 years on, it remains a bustling enterprise, a favourite for tourists and large groups if my experience this month is anything to go by. Many of the reviews mention the hotel's location in Causeway Bay - which is indeed a busy part of the island. The proximity to the many shopping delights HK is famous for, in addition to being just metres from the MRT, makes it great for visitors. The hotel is showing the wear and tear of its age though and could well do with a spruce up. My room was a harbour view king, good size with all the amenities. Wifi is pricey in comparison to many hotels of a similar standard. ToTT's on the top floor serves good bar meals as well as full dining and has a reasonable drink list and a happy hour scheme. Breakfast in the cafe on the 1st floor is okay, not outstanding given my many experiences of other hotels in Hong Kong. Dickens bar in the basement has Guinness on tap, and very helpful and pleasant staff. Checkin time involved a 20 minute wait in a queue, which had less to do with numbers of visitors attempting to check in at the same time and more with the time taken per visitor. Check out was fast and efficient. Be aware that as the hotel caters for large groups, the lifts can sometimes be overloaded and it can take some time to "catch one". I waited for 15 minutes on Level 16 during one particularly busy time, finally deciding to jump on one going up and then simply ride it all the way back to the ground floor. Generally a good hotel, if you can get a low rate, worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TAMember12282011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Right in the middle of everything and very curtious staff. Book on the execetive floor and have full access to free drinks and ongoing buffet. The TOTT restaurant is located on the top floor and has a fabulous view of Hong Kong. Live band play most nights from 10pm to 12am. We had a Tommahawk steak for two, not cheap but delicious. One of the best meals I've eaten. The jewelry shop by reception is superb, and comes very reccomended. Better value and service than anywhere in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: fabnancyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 10 nights at the Excelsior and mostly enjoyed our time there. Firstly the location was unbeatable. Close to absolutely everything and being centrally located along the MTR line, it was convenient to travel either direction. Check in was quick and professional. Housekeeping was prompt with the daily routine but not thorough at all with the vacuuming. But when requested for something, they acted quickly. Size of the room was adequate. Nice to have a bathtub but pity about the shower head and shower curtains being so outdated and impractical.There seemed to be bed bugs also because we got quite itchy at night on most nights. The hotel got very noisy at times during the day due to renovation works. Understand that there is no good time to carry out this type of work at any time in Hong Kong, it was still annoying when we wanted to stay in and relax during the day. We paid to use their WIFI but the connection was cutting out alot due to unknown reason. We took the matter to concierge, they acknowledged and followed up the matter promptly. The overall service was very good. Check out was efficient. We would return again mainly because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: jamiexx
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here for many years but returned over the New Year period. Stayed on the Exec floor and it is worth the extra money. The hotel is always busy but the Exec Club makes things just that little bit different. Evening drinks/canapes were always available and the Exec Floor staff really attentive. Dickens bar was great, as usual and the Hotel is in a very convenient position for MTR, Shopping etc The staff were all so helpful and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Citynic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Aug. Yes it is dated and a bit tired but room was a good size and comfortable. Bathroom was huge although sliding doors and location next to bed a bit strange. Didn't eat in hotel as proximity to Causeway Bay excellent. Ability to walk just a few steps from hotel and straight into Sogo or MTR station was amazing. Also great for jumping on tram to get to Central. As we have spent a lot of time in Hong Kong before we didn't feel need to be in TST or Central but doesn't feel out of the way. Only a short walk to Times Square and lots of eating options. Supermarket around the corner and fast food everywhere. Hotel is definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: MvanW
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, top of the line service. I would recommend spending a bit more and use their Executive rooms. The service you'll get at the lounge will make it worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: WhiteHorseWalker
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the Excelsior by our consultant at Travelbag when we booked a trip to see family in Australia. We stayed for 3 nights on the way out and it was a fantastic base and very comfortable. It was the perfect stopover, 3 nights giving us plenty of time to get over the journey (economy) and enabling us to see some of a place we've long wished to visit. The room was very comfortable, breakfast superb - you could choose from just about any cuisine you fancied - and the staff were very helpful. My husband lost a filling and the concierge sorted out a dental appointment for him the same day. Centrally situated, it was very easy to get around - the metro was very cheap and quick and easier than walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the shopping and dining experience in Causeway Bay, especially for the night owls!”
Reviews.Author: EvitaPeroni
Reviews.Content: There is no better location than this hotel in HK! Though room is a bit old, check in takes a long time and room is not ready when check in...I still love it because you can just step out of the hotel and find everything from food, shopping to entertainment at your finger tips! Best view ever to see the countdown firework on New Year eve too.... If you are not spending too much time in the hotel (who does that in HK anyway?) stay here and you will know what I meant! Concierge service is a plus - for arranging my airport shuttle bus at only HKD150, on time, hassle free!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abramis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for couple of nights due to business. I did not know anything of the hotel before my visit, booking was done by local associates. The pros - Good location near Causeway bay shopping - Decent breakfast - Good buffet lunch The cons - Price value, as room rates were much over 2000 HK$ per night (better options available) - Room itself was not very spacious - My room and overall the hotel looks bit tired - Service is pretty average - My view from the room was pretty bad (backside of building) To sum it up; Excelsior is not great hotel, I would rather describe it to be one of those ok hotels, which you after couple of years can not remember by name. Everything works ok, is of decent quality. Hotel deserves 3 star rating on my scale. Would prefer staying elsewhere = better price value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Joyer10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated since my last trip 5-6 years ago. The hotel room is reasonable arranged to leave you more space. Sofa is embedded into the wall and my room is facing the harbor which looks nice. Internet works fine although you would experience a slow down sometime @ night when every one returns from the business meetings. The best part of it is the breakfast and you should not miss it if your hotel package includes it. This is one of the few hotels that offer freshly squeezed fruit juice with a variety of choices. It is probably one of the reason that I choose to book this hotel. The hotel staff are very friendly and you got everyday fruit basket. If you are Asia Miles members remember to request for adding your mileage.

Reviews.Title: “Homely if not a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: blondambition
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean,homley and welcoming however if its all mod cons your after this hotel will dissapoint. Rooms as usual small as in Hong Kong. In need of an update. Decor tired. Breakfast buffet excellent value worth a visit. Lobby very!!! busy. Staff very polite and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Arrian K
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The staff is always responsive and very polite. I always stay here whenever I travel to Hong Kong. Great locations as well. Try their restaurant, Yee Tung Heen was sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, some great staff, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Reception: Small area which gets crowded regularly especially with so many air crew arrivals. During my stay it was not helped by an enourmous Christmas Tree and a shed sized Gingerbread house, must admit they looked great. The staff however were very efficient and checking us all in and arranging to have luggage delivered to the room. Rooms: Very very VERY dated. Apart from the flat screen TVs and iPod docking station these rooms are in dire need of an update. The wood effect is very Ninties and the whole effect is very cluttered. The bed was comfortable enough however the pillows were very hard. I was also placed right beside the house keeping store room and was disturbed as early as 6am with chatter and noise from it. I could also here the person in the room next to me as I was given an adjoining room. I found the bathroom not to be the cleanest especially around the bath tub and toilet. The climate control in the room was not very effective. I could not get the temperature down to a cool level and the windows did not open. Alas I had no view this time around although I have been in rooms before with a lovely view of the harbour. Gym: Excellent gym with a spacious and well equipped layout. The staff were very friendly in offering to show me the facilities. However I though the charge to grab an apple from the basket on the reception counter was a bit much. (You soon learn that EVERYTHING is charged at this hotel). Bar: I went for a few drinks in the Dickens bar the first night I was there. I was APPALLED at the prices. I rarely expect to pay more then Dublin prices for a pint but my god they make Ireland look cheap in this place. On top of that the staff behind the bar are perhaps the rudest bar staff I have ever encountered. Not just this time but when I think about it, they have been rude everytime I have visited. On this occassion they just stood behind the counter busying themselves with cleaning glasses and not making eye contact with any customers until you literally had to shout at them to get any attention, and Im too polite to shout. When I asked what beers they had they simply shoved a menu in my face instead of just telling me, then disappeared off before giving me a chance to make a selection leaving me there for another 5 minutes before I could get their attention again. I have subsequently found a number of atmospheric bars in the area who do not over charge and actually have amazing views over the harbour so I shall be frequenting them instead. Lifts: The lift waiting times were terrible. I was on floor 12 and there is a bank of 4 lights which serve floors 1-19. One of these lifts was out of service for the length of my stay leaving 3 to barely cope. Rarely did I wait an acceptable time for a lift, I often found myself waiting up to 5 minutes and then when the lift does arrive it would be completely full and stop at almost every floor. I find this extremely frustrating. Location: This hotel is in perhaps the best part of Hong Kong. Shops immediately outside the door, right next to major shopping centers and markets, right besite the Causeway Bay MTR station, loads of restaurants nearby. Just a cab ride to all the night life spots...truly a brilliant location. Value: This is one EXPENSIVE hotel with everything costing extra. If you get a good deal then fine but if you get a similar deal at one of the better known hotels nearby I would say go to them. I have no choice, my company book me in here but if I had a choice I would probably go somewhere else. My last stay in Hong Kong was in the Kowloon Grand Bay and it was so amazing in comparison however its location did leave a lot to be desired. Overall it was a very average stay. Most of the staff I found very approachable and helpful apart from the bar staff. The breakfast was amazing and not too expensive and the lcoation just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hong Kong classic”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Good option in an overpriced city. Beats anywhere on Kowloon side on location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: There are no bargains in Hong Kong hotels, but The Excelsior is amazing value. The service is up to the Mandarin standard (it's part of the same group, and I'm pretty sure staff go through the same training). The location is unbeatable, the rooms are a decent size for Hong Kong, and the view is sensational. Rooms on the business floors are also a good buy; they come with a complimentary hot breakfast, all-day tea and coffee, drinks in the evening, plus terrific service from the concierge/business centre (where you can even pay your bill at the end of your stay, and avoid the check-out queue in the lobby). The food is less spectacular: pretty ordinary at the main restaurant (the buffet is better). The Cantonese restaurant is excellent but very pricey, more so since its recent renovation. But the rooftop cocktail bar has a fabulous view of Hong Kong by night (weather permitting) -- the only problem is it should be twice the size. But it really comes back to the staff. Service in Hong Kong is often off-hand at best; we keep returning to The Excelsior because they're genuinely welcoming, friendly and helpful. If you're staying more than a day or two, that makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, good sleep”
Reviews.Author: Cahyadi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, the room was clean and comfort. The hotel is known that has a delicious breakfast in Hong Kong, many choice from chinese to western. pure juice is good to, you can combined 2 or more fruits and they will served it to you.The hotel is located in great area, many shopping mall is around it. Just a minute walk beside or behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not particularly flash, but good attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: egofilm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior, as our company conference was there also. Rooms were a good size for HKG, and the rates were about average -but could have included breakfast for the rate i felt. Friendly check in, though couldnt get in room until 13h00, which was a touch annoying after a 13 hour flight, but bags were looked after fine while we went back out. Small details were what caught my attention, and were a very pleasant surprise. I left three books out on the bedside table in the morning- when i got back to the room after the day's meetings, three hotel bookmarks had been placed next to them. Bottles of water ( free ) were always replaced, no exceptions. Room was always serviced swiftly while out at breakfast. Staff always greeted guests, and help with anything was always available. Breakfast was very good, and plenty of room & tables. Coffee could be a bit better. Lunch i thought was a little limited on the buffet front, but not really a concern for us. Overall- good for business, location is easy to get to Central / Wanchai, Star Ferry, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I've been so fortunate lately ...”
Reviews.Author: stuchisnall
Reviews.Content: … in the choice of the hotels that I’ve stayed in. However, if I had read some of the “Trip Advisor” reviews on the Mandarin Oriental Excelsior hotel in Hong Kong before I’d booked I probably wouldn’t have chosen it as the place to stay. And what a big mistake that would have been. I have written four previous reviews for Trip Advisor, one of which was for the Holiday Inn Golden Mile in Kowloon, Hong Kong. As I wrote at the time, I couldn’t really fault the hotel but also said that, only because of the continual harassment by touts for 24-hour tailors, fake watches, etc, I would probably go for a hotel on the Island side next time – and that’s what I did. I could probably write a really long favourable review on the Excelsior but would, instead go with all the”favourable” comments written by other reviewers regarding service, views, and everything else the reviewers raved about. I can’t really comment on some other unfavourable reviews but my experience was completely different and I’d urge people to stay there if they have the chance. 30th Floor executive room – views over the harbour – great. Furniture and decor need updating / the rooms smell musty (reviews of 6 November, 14 September & 30 August). It sounds to me as though they are describing a different hotel - not my experience at all. It’s a good hotel (not the top of the line but still classy), service second to none, great value for money, has some outstanding facilities including the rooftop ToTT, there is a direct pedestrian (indoor) walkway to the adjacent World Trade Centre mall and NO TOUTS crossed my path on Hong Kong Island. The last morning before we checked out, we strolled along the harbour front opposite the hotel and took a water taxi around the inner and outer harbour. My partner, although she doesn't really like being on water, enjoyed it. Worth doing! Just one final thing about getting to and from the hotel and the airport. My partner and I eventually found that the easiest and least stressful way is by getting a return ticket on the airport link train to Hong Kong Central Station then get the free shuttle bus (H2) which drops you outside the hotel – vice versa too

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: alcuin850
Reviews.Content: Onlyk issue was I was not impressed with sound proofing between rooms. Active neighbours woke me 2 nights out of my 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: CnD0523
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the Hotel service. Initially, the hotel was unable to provide us with a room when we checked in at midday due to some plumbing issues with the hotel. However, they upgraded us to a harbour view room with complimentary breakfast later in the evening. We didn't mind the delay. The room was excellent, breakfast was great, and the location is very convenient. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with consistent, friendly and very efficient services”
Reviews.Author: Chiewy
Reviews.Content: We are impressed!! Every staff we come across are so proactive and professional. It may be in the lobby, at the lounge or along the corridor, we could feel the warm hospitality and helpfulness. You could ask for something or for some help, they will go beyond this and ask you is there anything that we need. Location is great, and food provided at the excecutive lounge is great. I Before we arrive, I thought we are going to enjoy Hong Kong restaurants, but the food provided at the lounge satisfied my desire. Definitely recommended for all kinds of travellers, be it for business, family travel or even honeymooners. Really enjoyed our stay. Mr & Mrs Chiew Chung Yee

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: virnaar
Reviews.Content: love the room, the bed and the bathroom! breakfast was very good and tasty the location also suitable with the shopping center

Reviews.Title: “hotel worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: aida_pad
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel from nov 4 to nov 7 and was so much impressed that this hotel is still very well maintained. since the last time i have stayed here 10 years ago located in the center to causeway bay and assessable to all shopping spree, restaurants, shop and transportation convinience . all walking distance manage by the mandarin group of hotels contact your travel agents to get reasonable rate you will never regret friendly staff ready to serve their customers anytime of the day

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: Probably the same story for many an ageing hotel, but for the MO group, it is far from a flagship hotel. Starting with the positive, the staff are extremely helpful right across the board in all departments. The location, from my point of view on business, was right in the middle for two key meetings. The view across the harbour from the upper floors is spectacular by day and by night. The hotel is heavily used by the airline crews and I am not sure that this is either positive or negative; mixed feelings. On the negative side, I would expect a little more luxury in the rooms and décor than currently exists. Very basic rooms and the shower in the bathroom is surely from the 1980’s. All in all, satisfactory, but next time I will be choosing somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogotojapan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excelsior hotel for 1 night at the Superior Harbour View room. Services and amenities are of four star standard. The hotel is quite old but acceptable. In terms of location, it is near shopping areas and MTR. Sogo is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 4*”
Reviews.Author: gerry250940
Reviews.Content: Having commuted for twenty five years UK to HK. I have stayed in the Excelsior over 150 times. Not the most luxurious hotel in HK...but I would'nt stay anywhere else. It is exceptional

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PinkYella
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for a trip to Hong Kong, the hotel is centrally located and staff are exceptionally helpful-nothing is too much trouble. I celebrated my birthday during our stay and returned mid morning to the room to find the Manager had left a personally adressed birthday card in our room. We used the public bus service to get to the hotel from the airport rather than a taxi- this stops right outside the hotel so is ideal. Make sure you buy your ticket before you board. The hotel is a two minute walk to the train station so perfect if you are signseeing and buses heading towards popular tourist spots only 5 minutes away. The bus ride to Shenley takes in beautful views over the island and is definately recommended- make sure you sit on the top deck. Rooms in the hotel are very clean and spacious, if a little dated, but beds are super comfortable and some rooms have views over the harbour. The excellent roof bar also has harbour views, and entertainment is provided on certain weeknights. The ferry terminal is a 10 minute walk away, and we used this on several nights as taxi drivers are reluctant to drive to the mainland during rush hour, and is also a cheap way around. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: AuldCreamery9
Reviews.Content: Harbour views may not be what you expect. We booked this hotel for the location. It is in the heart of things. The rooms are good , there is a good choice of restaurants both in the hotel and within walking distance. The leisure centre is adequate. The greatest thing about the hotel has to be its location. Attached to shopping centres, adjacent to the harbour and noon day gun, close to Happy Valley and really within walking distance of most things of interest. When you book a hotel in Hong Kong, location should be a top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Willing, but can't deliver all the way”
Reviews.Author: pevast
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior, nicely situated in Causeway Bay. The Hotel has been there for ages. Staff are mostly doing everything to assist you and show their guests that this is a hotel matching their stars. Friendly, yes. Obsevant, yes. Well staffed, yes. Some glitches but for most part the staff is doing what they can. But, the hotel isn't up to standard. The staff can't cover up for the many shortcomings present here. The rooms interior is long overdue on freshing up. Floor 33 smells more like a sewer pit then a decent hotel. Good help anyone staying on that floor. Corridors in general smelly and torned. Stained carpets, murky walls. Rooms, well cared for by housekeeping, but in general not fresh. OK, elevators, most public areas and restaurants quite fine and nice, but again, the total impression doesn't change. The hotel really needs some serious attention, and now. Prices reasonable but in view of general impression, it will not compensate. There are many more hotels in Hong Kong, this one needs to put their act together to stay ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: gautam105
Reviews.Content: Visited HK in May this year and stayed at The Excelsor HK for around 5 days. It was a comfortable stay with Hotel offering very basic services. Rooms are clean but the one I stayed in did have a partial view of the closeby harbor. Hotel is well connected with easy access to Metro and closeby shopping places. Food options were not upto the mark but was decent. It is a good one time stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Semi42
Reviews.Content: After reading various reviews on this hotel, some were bad, but all who upgraded to the executive rooms reported a totally different experience. We decided to upgrade to the exec rooms and are so glad we did. The food was excellent and the service and staff were first class. The hotels location was excellent for shopping and the MTR station just a short walk away

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: aumbricht
Reviews.Content: Good location and easy to reach by complimentary airport train shuttle bus. Rooms are small but well decorated and have a good feel to it with a reasonable size king bed. Location is great and has a bar downstairs to hang out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Small but functional”
Reviews.Author: MazBakar
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel via their shuttle bus service from the airport. I found that very convenient and cost efficient. The lobby was abuzz with people but checkin was a breeze. I noticed that a lot of airline staff stayed here as well. Location-wise - very close to shopping and food. As a first time traveller to Hong Kong, I found it very convenient to explore the surrounding area by foot. The room itself is rather small, but I guess in Hong Kong it's normal. The bed is comfortable, room is clean. Internet connection is reliable. Suitable for business travellers or those who like everything at their doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel with The View”
Reviews.Author: Shammoislost
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location and the view. Its located near all the big shopping complexes like Time Square, SoHo etc. Also nearby is the MTR which is very important. In fact both the MTR and shopping malls are within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Also nearby are the fast food chains - McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut and Burger King. So if you are tired of hotel or local cuisine, you can splurge in the good old fashioned fast food. Secondly, the harbour view is fantastic. But for that, be sure to take the room on the Harbour view side. We were there on a business trip and the conference took place in the hotel. Therefore, we were privileged enough to stay in the hotel for a very long time. We tried the roof-top bar on top - i really liked the name "Talk of the Town". It also had an amazing view. The new and revised buffet is also very good. The service people were eager to help. Only drawback might be, the hotel decor probably looks a bit old fashioned. But compared to the pluses, thats a small blip.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel for short stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite frequently to Hong Kong for work and have stayed in a various hotels. Some of the hotels I have stayed in are international brand names 5-6 stars hotels to simple budget 3 star local hotels. However, with each trip, I try to make it a point of getting a room in Excelsior Hotel in Hong Kong. Why? 3 Reasons. Location, location, location.http://www.mandarinoriental.com/excelsior/ Firstly, it is not the most modern hotel you can find in Hong Kong. Excelsior Hotel is showing her age. The rooms are functional and rather out-dated by today's standard. The central air con hums a bit. The lobby, restaurants and facilities speak of an age gone by. Don't get me wrong. The amenities of this hotel are good. Just that it could use a major upgrading and retrofit. The hotel mainly see guests who are your tour groups, from China, Indonesia, etc. Air Crews and a small percentage of business travelers like me. So, what is great of this hotel. 1. Location: Overlooking Hong Kong Bay, get a room with the harbor view. The morning sunrise is nice to see and at night, with the lights turned on, the buildings across the bay seems to sparkle. Go up to ToTT's or Roof Terrace, on the top most floor of the hotel, and have a beer and enjoy this view as you unwind for the day. 2. Location: The hotel is right smack in the Causeway Bay area. Get out of the hotel, and you are at one of Hong Kong's busiest shopping area. Times Square is a good 25 mins slow stroll away and there a lots more shopping malls and stores as you take an evening walk to TImes Squares. If you are hungry, there are a lot of good eateries around this area, from your traditional Hong Kong 'tea rooms', Dim Sum restaurants, Japanese, Korean, Western food etc. 3. Location: Getting around is a breeze from this hotel. Hong Kong MTR station is only 15 mins away via a taxi, and 20 mins away to the financial district. Sometimes, during rush hour, it may take a while to get a taxi. Don't fert. Walk out of the hotel and in 10-15 mins, you are at Causeway Bay MTR station. Lastly, I always like the breakfast of fresh egg tarts and a good cup of coffee. Instead of your usual boring international breakfast buffet, I usually go to the ground floor to Expresso cafe for this hotel's famous Lord Stow's egg tarts and a strong cup of coffee. It only cost HK$80 for a nice freshly baked egg tart. So, if you are just in Hong Kong and your hotel is just for a place to sleep, then Excelisor wouldn't be a bad choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good as a tourist base, not the best hotel I have stayed in in HK”
Reviews.Author: Samsiebabes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer whilst visiting my brother in law. The hotel is in a good location as a base to explore HongKong. The rooms were quite small although well maintained with nice bathrooms. We were staying on a business rate which included buffet breakfast for one and free internet. The free internet was very useful. The free breakfast for one, was a little irritating as the room was booked for two people and to pay for breakfast cost around £30, although the range of food was impressive. On several occasions we did not use our free breakfast and went to Starbucks across the road instead a much more cost effective option. We also ate at the restaurant for dinner, our family had the buffet which again was expensive but had a large and impressive selection of both savoury and sweet food. We ordered of the A la carte menu which was much more reasonable. There is nothing wrong with this hotel, however for the price we preferred the Marriott which has its own pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel along busy road.”
Reviews.Author: DutchGld
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a nice hotel that offers a lot. I had a 19th floor room with full harbour views, stunning! Around the corner of the hotel the Wan Chai business/shopping/eating area can be found catering to every taste. The Subway is only a few hundred meters away. The Gloucester Road is very busy and noisy. The sound insulation of the rooms is OK. Bathrooms are on the small side but with great amenities. Internet is not free, something I hate when the price of the room is sky high already!! The service is great, very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is superb: fresh fruits, juices, cold platter, Chinese, etc. Opposite the hotel is the Noon Gun, a thing of the past worthwhile seeing for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “A retreat in the middle of a busy city”
Reviews.Author: thequeeeen
Reviews.Content: From the suite on the executive floor, the view of Victoria Harbour is simply breath-taking. Love how you can be right in the heart of Causeway Bay, amidst skyscrapers and throngs of people yet feel the peace and quietness of a sub-urban area. Room was spacious, with a separate bedroom and living room and two bathrooms. Fruits were provided in the middle of the afternoon, perfect for the afternoon hotel pitstop, together with the Nespresso coffee you could make in a jiffy. Decor was a bit dated, but room was clean and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustDNA
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong for 2 days earlier this year and found this hotel to be just what I needed. Great price, great location, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Louise F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The service was exceptional, facilities were all of a high standard. Nothing was too much trouble which made for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, could do with a refurb”
Reviews.Author: travelling74
Reviews.Content: We had interconnecting rooms with 2 adults and 2 small children. Its in a great postion and although housekeeping do a good cleaning job it really could do with a sprouse up. The carpet is overdue for replacement looking very dirty especially in the hallways and the little built in couches need to be reupholstered and modernised. I have to say thought it made a great little bed for out 4 year old. Overall its fine but for the price they really need to sprouse it up a bit, but I guess you're paying for location. My sister stayed at the Parklane at the same time. Bigger rooms which are cleaner, newer etc for a cheaper price. Also fantastic location, has IKEA under it and a supermarket a few metres down.

Reviews.Title: “The tide is changing.”
Reviews.Author: row62
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say we have been a strong supporters of the Excelsior for many years, we love the location, the staff, view, pretty much everything. However it appears to be getting over run with "mainland tour groups" on their first trip out of China, (with all that goes with that), there isn't much you can do about it, I guess it's the way it is, but it's gone from one of our favourite things about HK, to, well, one of the list of disapointments in 2011 HK. Flying from the UK to down under we always stopped in HK, now I think it will be Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Tired noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel for a recent business trip to HK, as part of my employer's cost cutting initiatives. The hotel is very tired, the lobby is swarming with truckloads of noisy tourists from mainland China and the rooms smell musty! It is a nightmare getting a taxi in the morning from the hotel. I ended up jumping on the Airport Express bus to get to my office (it's right near the HK Airport Express station). Needless to say, I won't be going back there. If you are thinking of staying there, my advice is: DON'T!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but over priced”
Reviews.Author: sohailisd
Reviews.Content: Excelsior seems like a grand hotel from outside but it is a cramped over priced hotel. I stayed for 7 days there to attend a business meeting. My advise it is not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: pepper1108
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on my way from Australia to England. It was very clean and neat. My travel agent requested a higher floor and a harbour view at no additional cost and i got it. Food was great and staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They all spoke perfect english. I booked two trips organised by this hotel and i really enjoyed them! The pick up and drop off was at the hotel so it was very convenient .You can also book a transfer to and from the airport , it leaves every hour and takes about 40 minutes. This hotel is situated on Hong Kong Island in area called Causeway Bay and is overlooking Victoria Harbour.There is a subway very close to the hotel and you are just a few stops away from Kowloon Island or from Central if you feel like exploring the city.There is a lot of stores near the hotel if you feel like shopping. If i come back to Hong Kong in the future i will definitely be going back to Excelsior! I would give it 5/5 !

Reviews.Title: “small rooms good location”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: located in causeway bay and few steps away from SOGO dept store and around 5 blocks to TIME SQUARE mall . 7/11 across the hotel. restaurants everywhere. the rooms are small. also make sure you get the harbour view rooms or else you might get a room facing some old buildings which is an eyesore, you can actually see people watching television, eating dinner and everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Not a wow Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Masons4
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is really well positioned right on Causeway Bay and is a very short walk to the MTR (underground), alternatively you can walk a few blocks up and catch a Tram very easily (if you can work out where it's going!) The Hotel itself impresses on entering reception and appears quite 'glitzy', however this sadly doesn't continue in the rooms. Ours was small, old and tired (carpets very worn and furniture a bit bashed), we also kept getting wafts of cigarette smoke even though we had asked for a non-smoking room it was also on the side of the hotel so had no real views. The bathroom was in need of updating and again small, shower curtain was a no-no..... To conclude - good location but in need of a facelift beyond the flashy reception...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but changing guest”
Reviews.Author: Aviator42
Reviews.Content: I have had the chance to stay in this fine hotel for most of the trips that I make to HKG. Personally, I have no complaints of the room nor the hotel service, as they are pretty professional. Not exceptionally warm service, but doable. Through out the years, I have seem changes in the guests that they entertain, from the airline crews to the current tour groups of china tourist. Their hotel staff have manage indivdual's expectations on services exceptionally well. The location is excellent, within working distance to time square and MTR. Restaurants are everywhere near the hotel vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: jamesjustin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions over the past couple of years when visiting Hong Kong. I've found that the best thing about it is its location near to the many shops and restaurants in the Causeway Bay area. In particular its about a 5 min. walk from the Times Square shopping mall, which has just about every kind of shop you could want if you're in Hong Kong to do some shopping. Additionally the MTR subway station is just a 1-2 min. walk away given quick and easy access to the city. The rooms are quite average in size for Hong Kong (which means relatively small). I've always found my room very clean and well kept but the hotel is in general in need of an update and you would certainly not describe the furnishings as modern or luxurious. That said, there's nothing particularly wrong with the rooms either...they just show their age a bit. Internet (both wired and wireless) is available in the room. As this hotel is managed by the Mandarin Oriental group I've found the staff and service always to be quite good. Not over the top but always quick and efficient. I recommend this hotel as a good value if you can get a good rate and want to stay somewhere convenient to Causeway Bay and the nearby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Adithi_85
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to spend some money this is a great place ! Great location , friendly service , good rooms ! The breakfast buffet isvery good and so is the food on a average ! I stayed here 6 nights and was totally satisfied !

Reviews.Title: “No consideration for guests.”
Reviews.Author: AlanM59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked for 4 nights through a travel agent as part of a 25th wedding anniversary trip and needed to extend our stay by one night. They charged us about $100 more for the 5th night than we paid for the other nights and when I quizzed them about it, I was told "that's the hotel rate". There was no effort made to try and meet halfway or recognize our predicament. I got the feeling that they knew we didn't have many options so why would they even try to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a massive refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwikimchi
Reviews.Content: Good spot in CWB but so dissapointed by rooms. Small ,sheets damp, aircon was poor quality and furniture was damaged and needs replacing. Pity they only refurb the lobby and TOTTs. Will not go again as the tiny rooms were so bad. Not worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “The warm, personalized service keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: TimVdB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Excelsior at many occasions. What keeps me coming back is the friendly staff and warm, personalized service. The Executive Lounge is excellent ... nice breakfast, tea in the afternoon, drinks in in the evening. The fitness center offers good workout options. Fast WiFi. The rooms need some upgrading (refurbishments have started I believe) but the harbor view more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, spectacular views, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Supermensch
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Excelsior Hong Kong, having booked an executive room with access to the executive lounge. First, I will stress the convenience of this booking - if you book an executive floor room, you can bypass the (usually) very busy check-in in the lobby and go directly to the lounge for check-in and check-out. This, as well as the excellent service, was worth the slight price increase per night. The rooms, while not terribly large, are clean and well laid out, and comfortable. If you can get a harbor view room looking east (toward central), the views, particularly at night, are marvelous. The hotel is located near the subway and causeway bay shopping. The fitness center was exceptional for a hotel and always had staff on hand for any needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LenaAnita
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the excelsior about 6 times in the past 2 years and have to say it's my favorite business hotel in hk. Hotel itself is functional, has everything you need - good quality linen, iPod docks in every room, harbor facing rooms have great views. Breakfast is fantastic, overlooking the harbor. But the best thing is that the service is flawless, totally intuitive and consistent. I have tried to pick holes on recent visits but I really can't! I don't often write reviews but think I owe them one :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scot_in_Aussieland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for work. I used the gym most mornings, it's god size & range & the staff are very helpful. Even though it didn't officially open til 6 I headed down at 5.45 & the staff were always already there. Room service food is amazing quality, both breakfast & dinner. What is so great about this hotel is the service, it's a brilliant standard. I filled in the customer service feedback & I had commented on the room service employees being the most polite I had ever experienced. I then got an email from the hotel telling me the names of the employees & that the hotel has a reward policy for good feedback so the staff had been recognized & rewarded which I think is great. I'm back in hong kong for work a couple of times over the next 6 months & I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A consistent hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephenday50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights ... lots of shopping to do ... have to try the dickens bar which has been unchanged for as long as I've been alive ... Great hotel and location. No complaints. Just what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: sammi222
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Excelsior in July 2011 in a "Superior" double room. The hotel was in a perfect location with Causeway Bay MRT being just two minutes walk. There was also a large shopping complex with floors and floors of shops and restaurants. There was also a Starbucks directly across the road. The room was small, as you'd expect in a city hotel. The breakfast buffet was expensive (HK$350 for two) but good! The Cafe on the 1st floor was reasonably priced however the Italian was very expensive (although lovely). We had a 3 course meal and a bottle of wine and the bill was HK$1400. The Italian meal gave us food poisoning, possibly due to the weird vodka-olive concoction we got after our main course...

Reviews.Title: “A room cramped for room”
Reviews.Author: Deekay31
Reviews.Content: One thing that stands out for this hotel is that the rooms are sooooooooo small. Compared to another hotel in the same area, I was pretty disappointed with the room size. Although they give you a lot of freebies when you get there, you will struggle for space! Breakfast is decent, room view is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Central, but no pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: fishle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week in July during a business trip. We had a room on the executive level for 500 HK$ extra. What we liked: - Central position and very close to Causeway Bay MRT - Catering in the executive lounge: great variety of snacks and cakes throughout the day. - Decent range of drinks during the cocktail hour. - Free late checkout until 3 PM was really appreciated - Decent room size considering you are in Hong Kong - Very friendly and helpful staff in the executive lounge - Rooms were clean and tidy - Free internet - 20% discount came with exec level rooms for all bars including sunday brunch at ToTTs What we didn't like: - Old fashioned bathroom with bathtub, no seperate shower - NO POOL!!!! This is hard to take in summer when it is always hot and sticky in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and harbour views”
Reviews.Author: pmd203
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to explore the city. We had a side harbour view room and we could plan our days by looking out of the window. It's 2mins walk from causeway bay mtr station and a myriad of shops is right on the doorstep. The Cantonese resteraunt on the second floor is under going refreshment at the minute but the only thing that gave this away was the note in the lift. If you come out of the lobby and turn right there is a street full of quality restaurants a very short walk away, anyway. The only very minor observation I would make is the hotel decor feels slightly dated. That's not to say its shabby (all very clean and well kept) just feels a bit 1998. All the modern facilities are there though and the rooms themselves are faultlessly clean, well appointed and well laid out (desk over looking the harbour? No problem!). Make sure you visit the rooftop bar at night. Don't worry about buying a beer... just savour the view. Its very special and puts the cherry on top of what was an excellent place to spend 3 days of our honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Terribly dated and drab hotel”
Reviews.Author: IainandGavin
Reviews.Content: Given this is badged as Mandarin Oriental I was expecting a pretty top rate hotel. How wrong I was. Other than the great TOTT restaurant / bar at the top, there was nothing to commend this place. The room was really poor - looked untouched from the 1980's. Bathroom in a poor condition, windows were so dirty you could barely see out of them. Walls are paper thin. No wifi in room. Bedroom was scuffed, torn wallpaper. In short, really poor for the money. Practically impossible to get a cab in the morning. I am shocked MO allow this hotel to use their brand - they should be ashamed. Checked out after 2 days to a much better hotel - JW Marriott. I do not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: etittley
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much! Staff were quite friendly. The view of the Harbour was spectacular! The breakfast buffet was certainly the most varied breakfest buffet I've ever encountered. The location was ideal. My one criticism was that the hallways and business centre were somewhat 'dingy'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but freebie treats in the room were a bit cheap”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustfulJL
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We were upgraded to an Executive room on the 31st floor with a great view. Lovely Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries but to be honest, the complimentary Chinese titbits (no matter how nicely packaged) came across as cheap. Also disappointing that broadband connection in the room isn't free. Very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location. must for those looking for a central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: picshar1
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is located at the heart of the city on Causeway Bay. The rooms are nice, spacious and the service is splendid. Quite unlike other places in Hongkong here the staff speaks English and are very helpful if ever you need any help, directions etc. Most of the shopping places, eateries and more importantly Times Square is just a stone's throw away. They have an elaborate breakfast spread. And is surely a must have. The food from their restaurants though is strictly ok. They have a rooftop restaurant on the 34th floor which is certainly worth a visit for a birds eye view of the entire city. Super by night. But dont linger here too long as the food & drinks are ok, but over priced. All in all its a super place to stay largely for its location, staff and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good pricing for an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Kalexyco
Reviews.Content: This hotels very well located in Hong Kong. Most of the main attractions are close by, by metro. Metro station is at walking distance from the hotel. The hotel does not have the nicest view, part of the hotel facing the highway which is always crowded. We had the surprise to arrive at the hotel and to be offered a twin bed despite the fact that we had asked for a queen size bedroom in our booking. We spent a night in a twin bed room and then we were moved to a single bed double room. Personnel very attentive and helpful. Very nice and rich breakfast. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “THE EXCELSIOR REALLLY DOES NOT EXCEL !”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: I did not have too much expectations from this hotel seeing the building and rooms inside , my company had booked a conference and stay for about 12 of us in the hotel but I really did not like the hotel. The conference room was good and comfortable but the bedroom (superior) was small and had a funny smell to it since I was staying for a couple of nights only I did not make too much of a fuss.The buffet in the coffee shop (cafe on first) was pretty good. The staff however was very non interested basic courtesies were missing IMHO, all in all it was a very average experience. There is no pool in the hotel as well. For those who want to get here from the airport one of the best ways is to take the airport express to Hong Kong station and then catch the H2 free shuttle to the hotel you can do the same on the return to get back to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be on causewaybay”
Reviews.Author: JiguPiyu
Reviews.Content: With a minutes walk from causewaybay mtr, the location of the hotel is excellent. The terrace restaurant overlooks the river has a great view in the night. We stayed at the executive floor which provided us access to the executive lounge which provided personalised services. With round the clock snack and soft drinks the lounge provides good atmosphere for business meetings. It also provided complementary alcohol in the evening. The staff was well groomed to help the business traveler. The breakfast provided loads of variety. No swimming pool and slightly old interiors are the only problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel..a little stuck in a timewarp.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hong Kong feels a little dated. Not in a bad way as such. It is immaculately clean and very well maintained but I don't think the lobby or rooms have had a full refurbishment for a decade! Which being managed by Mandarin Oriental group it suprises me. However, I guess all things considered I prefer function over design and the hotel is comfortable, efficient and clean. Pros: - Fantastic location. - Friendly, efficient service in all areas. - Comfortable beds. - Fantastic gym with sauna and spa. - An exceptional breakfast bufffet complete with juicing bar and many of the breads and pastry items baked within the hotel. Cons. - The rooms are small. But to be fair this is true of many hotels in Hong Kong. - They could definitely do with some updating as well. - No free wifi/internet (HK$130 per 24hrs) - There is no pool or any outdoor area to relax in the sun. Personally I wish the hotel would get rid of the outdoor tennis courts and replace them with a pool and/or sunbathing area. All in all I would have no hesitation staying at the Excelsior again as long as the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, somehow fails to excel...”
Reviews.Author: Safemach
Reviews.Content: Not the slickest front desk in Hong Kong, rooms in need of an upgrade. But fantastic harbour views, good breakfast and pleasant location with helpful door staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: dinglenoam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights after staying at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights. I stayed in a Deluxe Harbour view room which had great views over causeway bay and over to Kowloon. The room was of a good size but even the standard rooms were good for a city break in my opinion. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms were of a good standard (this is four star so dont expect luxury and you wont be disappointed). The breakfast is great with a fresh fruit juice station were you can mix whatever fruits you would like into your glass. All the food you could wish too. We also tried the dickins bar which for a hotel is very reasonably priced and shows all the sports from the uk should you want that. There is also the TOTTs bar and restaurant, although I didnt eat up here we had drinks and canapes which were lovely and it is a nice stylish bar with good atmosphere and a lovely little roof terrace where you get a great side view of the light show at 8pm. Location here is fab and i would definately recommend it for this, the mtr is very close and for nightlife Wan Chai is just behind. This is a great hotel for the purposes of a HKG city break and I would definately tell my friends to stay here as it is very good value and the staff are lovely and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: wantaword
Reviews.Content: I last wrote a review on this hotel in 2005 and since that time I have continued to stay at this hotel dozens of times. I stand by what I said in that review, for combination of price, location and quality I am going to continue to be staying here in the future. I still have the opportunity to stay in some other hotels in Hong Kong (only on the island side) and still love some of the big 5 star hotels like the Shangri-la and Mandarin but given the price differential - and given the excellent service I receive at the Excelsior - I generally don't feel the need to pay double the price for these 5 stars - especially given I prefer the Excelsior location with all that Causeway Bay offers (shopping & eating options) right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: RealTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I am not the biggest fan of this hotel but I like the location. In the middle of Wan Chai with tons of shopping and restaurants around and connected to a mall but the rooms need some updating. The interior seems old and outdated and Wifi is not included. The quality of living in the hotel doesn't justify the high price. Other hotels in Wan Chai are much more modern and updated for cheaper. I stayed at the Excelsior in the winter several times and the heat never worked. There is also no pool area. However, the roof top bar is very chic and stylish and offers visitors a great view of the Hong Kong skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night...”
Reviews.Author: affiliatelife
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is in a great location and walking distance to Times Square and other shops. The hotel has a great nightclub style bar at the top floor, and an even better bar in the basement where I was able to watch the FA Cup Final. The room I was in faced the harbour so the view was probably better than in some other rooms. Not that I was in the room looking at the view all day as there were a lot of other things to do and look at. A bit on the expensive side, but then again a lot of things are expensive in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GJW8
Reviews.Content: I always stay at The Excelsior in Hong Kong. Great location, fantastic service and the most comfy bed! This is a great place to stay if you are a solo traveller as the staff will always make you feel very welcome. The TOTT's bar upstairs is amazing, what a view!!! I feel like this hotel is my home away from home which is such a great feeling when you travel alone. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel in Heart of Shopping Location”
Reviews.Author: ShaunDhaka
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a good business hotel that has excellent staff and facilities, but is let down a little by the tired decor of the rooms. Attention has been given to the communal areas, but the rooms have peeling paper and look due for a refurb. Having said that, the room was comfortable, and the staff attentive. On one evening the connecting door carried noise from a business grouip partying in the next room. A call to reception at 2330 promptly stopped the noise, and ellicited a written apology the next morning. Breakfast buffet was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great gym and bars but paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: chrisbarras
Reviews.Content: As the title says the gym is one of the best i've been to in a hotel, Dickens bar in the basement is a great place to unwind with a good selection of beers and good food at a resonable price, the ToTT (Talk of The Town) bar on the 34th floor has a fantastic view of Kowloon. The main down side to this hotel was the noise that could be heard whilst in our room, i could hear the guy in the room accros the hall having a shower, when someone else flushes the toilet it sounded like it was in my room, my partner got woken up one night but the lady in the next room unpacking her shopping bags, i don't know what it was but my partner and i woke up most nights at 3am sweating, this was with the air con on or off it didn't make a difference. One of the few places i've stayed that wanted $16 per day for internet access on top of the $250 for the room

Reviews.Title: “Booked room not available until 10:30 pm”
Reviews.Author: wildercab
Reviews.Content: We had a pre-paid booked room and arrived at the hotel at 7:00 pm but were told our room would not be available until 10:30 pm. We were compensated with meal and drink vouchers, but we were really severely restricted on what we could do in Hong Kong on the first night of our holiday. The hotel seems to give priority to flight crews and allows very late check outs for them at the expense of all other customers. There were many other patrons in the same situation as us. Totally unacceptable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheat in charging”
Reviews.Author: Ramanathan76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel during my first visit in April'11. The Hotel punched my card for 3 days rent although i was ready for cash payment. At time of checkout, they again charged me to pay Cash for 3 days rent i.e. i am charged twice. When i took up the matter they inform that credit card debit will be reversed and they attached a document to taht effect. But nothing is reversed and it appears the hotel is cheat. Beware when u check into the hotel in not submitting the Card for any reason. Deal with cash and take receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Calfie
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the room. When you enter the lobby, it is modern and stylish, however the room, at least the basic room, was nothing like the lobby. The rooms seriously in need of renovation and slightly on the small side. You could tell the interior is from the 80s or early 90s with scratches everywhere and not much functionality in the furniture. There were positives of course: 1. Excellent location behind Causeway bay SOGO shopping mall, next to World Trade Center. 2. Fast and good room service 3. Very accommodating house keeping. Alot of Airline crew stay here, so you know it is a excellent 5 star hotel of the past, now struggling to keep up with the pace of modern boutique or 5 stars, but get enough business to stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: traveller64Glasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago and would go back. Excellent location, lovely food & service. Yes the rooms are small and maybe need updating but still superb value. Handy for the MRT, ferry, shops and restaurants. We arranged a half day tour through the hotel – good price and luckily we were the only people on it – so an 8 seated mini bus + guide to ourselves. Had a great morning talking to the guide who was very relaxed and friendly. When I explained I used to cook professionally he took us to the spice market and happily changed the itinerary from the “boat” trip in the harbour to the fish market. We also visited some smaller more local areas. Had a great wander in Temple St market one night and eating in the street stalls never caused us any issues. Hong Kong was impressive though I would recommend a good pair of walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: makeminealargeone
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a busy hotel in the middle of Causeway Bay. It is in a great location, minutes walk away from the MRT. The rooms are small but very comfortable - some with a view, some without. The staff are very efficient. The Dickens Bar in the basement gets lively at the weekend and does a great curry buffet during the day (during the week only?). Breakfast in the cafe on the first floor is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a Great View from the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ramachandraniyer
Reviews.Content: This was my trip to hongkong in December when the weather was to be the coldest on one of the days when i was to be there, i searched and found this hotel as i had stayed in other hotel The park lance before, To be frank i would anytime recommend people to come and stay in the Excelsior, as everything about this hotel was great.
