The Moment i got down from the transport the guy at the gate greeted me and also took care of my luggage by just handing over a baggage tag and asking me to give it at the front desk. It made me a bit worried but then thought such a big hotel there should be some co-ordination and also i saw others doing it. I went to the front desk checked myself in and they asked me for the baggage tag themselves. I reached my room on the 27th floor again a non-smoking one as i dont smoke, The view when i entered the room was amazing a huge room, very clean and the best part was the View from the window oh my it was amazing, it was facing the sea. The view made me stand at the window for he next 10 mins and observe the beauty of HongKong. In the mean time my luggage was delivered to my room which was amazing. The hotel traffic was comparatively cheap than other hotels and it included a free breakfast. When i say breakfast it was a whole range stuff that was being offered to you for breakfast and again the sitting area was awesome facing the sea. i could sit there the whole day and observe the beauty if i was asked too. Though it was a buffet breakfast there were people around to help you serve the same and they were so polite and helpful which i did not find in the last hotel i stayed. i was there for a week and everyday i used to go for my work and the moment i reach the door the guy at the door made a point to greet me. which is again not the case in many hotels in HK. I would recommend people travelling to hong kong to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravi_s13
Reviews.Content: Excelsior, hongkong is one hotel which you are sure to stay when you visit hongkong again. The hotel rooms are really spacious, wonderfully done with very good staff, who would cater to all your requirements. The food is really wonderful, they have variety. This hotel is located in a good shopping locality with a lot of malls/shops for your shopping. This is one good hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Exceded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: indshal
Reviews.Content: got a chance to stay at Excelsior for a night and it was indeed a wonderful xperience. everything is efficient about it the staff, conciergem check in , check out . was on the 28th floor and the view was superb. the rooms were small but had every amenity, including a IPOD docking system.fortunateley i had access to the executive lounge and spend quite a few hrs there just enjoying the quietness and the tasty tit bits along with the view. In teh evening had a quiet walk around victoria park too Overall it was a great experience and the charges were reasonable by HK standards

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first-timer to HK”
Reviews.Author: Nosnibors
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in Hong Kong and we were impressed right from arrival. We arrived early from the airport at 8am and they had a room ready for us by 9.30 (Deluxe on 10th floor). Our first impression was that the room was bigger than it appears on the photo. We had a fantastic view of the Noon Day gun, the Victoria harbour and could see along to Central skyscrapers. My wife spent about half our visit just staring out of the window. The room was spotless and the king-size bed extremely comfortable - the best in our four week holiday. Air-con effective and quiet. Hardly any street noise despite the busy roads outside. Very handy for transport links (MTR, buses, tram). All staff very friendly and extremely attentive, always leave 'evidence' of a room service (e.g. left bookmarks on our books). We had the buffet breakfast included which was a great banquet - however the cup of tea we had one day was overpriced at HK$45 plus tax (each). We used Dickens Bar for one meal which was good food and OK price-wise. Hope to visit again sometime when we come back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with friendly staff & great position”
Reviews.Author: kaw118
Reviews.Content: Arriving by the airport shuttle bus - we were greeted by friendly door staff, this set the tone for the hotel. We were given a harbour facing room by the reception and it came with an added bonus - it was the day after Chinese New Year and we were able to watch the magnificent fire work display from the comfort of our room. The room was light & airey with a high quality bed & came with a free English language newspaper, breakfast was good - although if you picked the wrong time - it was very busy! The Concierge were very willing, in not only helping to plan our trip to Sha Tin races, but also directions to the nearest supermarket & the MTR (all from the side door of the hotel). For dinner we went to West Villa (Cantonese) as recommended by Lonely Planet some 8 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly, efficient staff - perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NomadicBrit10
Reviews.Content: The moment you walk in you can tell that this hotel caters to the guest. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The food is very good, fruits are delicious. Great place to stay as you can relax after a day of running around. Would highly recommend getting a massage in the health club.. Was so relaxing that I fell asleep during it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tired...”
Reviews.Author: TNJP_Explorer
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Near shopping eating etc. Just 3 minute walk from subway station. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean, but small and very dated (except for mid-size plasma tv) Windows are smaller than most hotels I have stayed at. For the money, expected a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy001
Reviews.Content: Its a average hotel, but if you are in HK for shopping then its the right place to stay coz it in center of causeway bay which is heart of HK shopping. Rooms are average lobby is small. But can enjoy the breakfast . View from hotel is also not great. But since it is un center of of city metro station restaurants are just walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, cheap”
Reviews.Author: bankergirl1016
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed in The Excelsior, and they get it right every time. Nothing luxurious, no frills, but fantastic location - right in the middle of Causeway Bay, clean rooms, fantastic service. And I get it with our corporate rate of HKD 900 all in. Cant beat the price. Great sound insulation! Hong Kong is known to be all hustle and bustle, especially in the busiest area of Causeway Bay. Room is quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good service and location.”
Reviews.Author: charlesriver_10
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in the shopping area, within minutes walking to the subway (MTR). Excellent service, very accommodative.

Reviews.Title: “A lesson which other hotels need to learn”
Reviews.Author: loanarranger_8
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 days at this hotel and the experience was brilliant, the room was very good and certainly comfortable, it was quiet so afforded a good nights sleep after being out all day. The amenities in the hotel were very good indeed the restaurants were excellent and offered very good value. Very good priced offering via BA Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Attyboy
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was great, from the affable Sikh doormen to the band from Detroit in the cocktail bar on the roof. The toTT bar was stylish and welcoming, with a fabulous view. The rooms were spotless and spacious. We got a great deal on the room price from Travel Republic UK so of course we were happy. However the prices in the restaurants were scary. We had one meal in toTT. Cost a bomb and the food wasn't worth it, but Hong Kong is packed with restaurants. Otherwise we couldn't fault the hotel. Right beside the Noon Day Gun. MTR down the street. Victoria Park round the corner where we had a hilarious New Year's Eve buying flowers with a about a million locals. Good clean fun.

Reviews.Title: “great stay shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: ddbella
Reviews.Content: we spent 9 nights at this hotel in feb 2011 we could not fault anything about this hotel except for the beds which were like sleeping on concrete we had a fantastic time in hong kong and this hotel is in a perfect position for the mtr and trams the breakfasts were very good and worth the money and the staff were friendly and very good at their jobs we would stay here agin

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: reeva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for the first time on our recent holiday to Hong Kong. We arrived At the hotel to a friendly porter and lovely reception staff who made our check in very smooth and efficient - our room was ready straight away. Our room was very large and overlooked the harbour. Breakfast was very nice with friendly waiters and waitresses. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels and the Excelsior staff were much more welcoming and polite than many of the staff in these hotels. I would not hesitate in recommending the Excelsior to anyone who may be visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel: but cheaper rooms may be noisy”
Reviews.Author: beijingduck
Reviews.Content: The location, service and rooms at this hotel are of the good standard that you would expect at this price. But strangely none of the rooms has double glazed windows, so light-sleepers may find the cheaper rooms (which the hotel calls superior rooms, at floors 20 and lower) noisy from the busy harbourside expressway.

Reviews.Title: “a bit old but comfort enough”
Reviews.Author: coermask
Reviews.Content: Good access for local shopping area and good location from the frontsea. But one thing I cannot really stand with was, it took ages to check-in. I was standing the row for a half an hour for checking in. It was probably my bad luck to stand after group tourists. But there was no person to try to make the queue shorter, i am afraid. Except that, my room was clean and tidy and the people was nice. Here my question about taxi in Hong Kong!, Did they charge you on your luggage? :(

Reviews.Title: “20th stay in this hotel and still not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: yvakat
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you the feeling to be a real guest, I've stayed here as well with my wife for leisure as for business purpose and each time getting the same excellent quality of service, the staff is wonderful and gives you right attention. The excelsior is well located on causeway bay and directly around are plenty restaurants and shopping, although you should also have a drink on their rooftop terrace at Tott's, very nice view by night ! The rooms are comfortable, not too big, but again everything is made up with the extra service/attention you get in this place. I'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: likestoeat53
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very nice rooms. Get a room on a high floor with a view of Victoria Harbour. Amazing !!!! Make sure you go have a drink at their roof top bar, especially the outdoor patio. The view is fantastic especially at night!!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find fault...”
Reviews.Author: jamaine1066
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to fault our stay. We arrived at 8:00 in the morning and were amazed to find that we could check in straight away and also have a free breakfast, as we paid an extra HK$ 500/£45 a day for an upgrade which was the best thing that we could do. For that we got breakfast, lunch snacks and as much as we could drink. It included an upgrade to a room on the 30th floor on the side away from the centre, but still a great view (see photograph). It also included all-day access to the Executive Lounge on the 31st floor which did look that way (again see photographs). The staff were excellent; friendly and attentive, and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The hotel is in Causeway Bay which at first seems a bit out of the way, but it was very convenient for the station on the MTR as well as restaurants and a major shopping centre. Definitely recommend getting an octopus card to be used on the MTR, trams, ferries and many other points (including even Starbucks). Well recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and view”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireRosie
Reviews.Content: The location was very good as the hotel is close to the harbour, the shopping area and the tube station. We visited on a room only basis so our involvement with the staff was restricted to checking in and out; however, everyone was efficient, friendly and helpful. We had a great view of the harbour from our room and I never tired of the view, both day or night. We had a bath in our room which made the room a little cramped but my wife loves a bath and we felt it was an acceptable compromise. Some people have criticised the rooms for being dated, but I feel the a good nights sleep and a clean room is far more important. We had a pub meal one night in the basement bar which was good, other than that I cannot comment on the food/service. Out and about Hong Kong we went on the open top bus tour which was good value but allow a bit more time than we did to visit the Peak. We enjoyed visiting Stanley (on the bus tour) which reminded us of resorts in the med and had a great lunchtime meal overlooking the bay. We went on the Big Budda tour and the cable car ride on the way back was very impressive. Would I recommend this hotel?....... well all I can say is that I would use this hotelagain if I returned to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: euroluxtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights last December. Booked a standard room and got an upgrade to a room with harbor view. Positive points: - Very friendly hotel staff - Hotel was very clean - Bars and restaurants are very nice and good quality - There is a metro station just behind the hotel (5 min walk) - Wonderful breakfast buffet Negative point: - Rooms are a bit “old” I was very pleased with this hotel and will go back as soon as I plan a new trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Just go into the Sports Bar and you're at home”
Reviews.Author: Habibisambo
Reviews.Content: Great views, restaurants and bars. Be sure to say you want a marina view if you do. Everything you'd expect from a quality hotel, and you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: mikki6416
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Excelsior on 7 January 2011. We had booked a standard room and on arrival we were asked if we would like a smoking or non-smoking room. We requested a non-smoking double room however they did not have any left available. Insteas they apologised and offered us a non-smoking twin room which was fine with us. As a compromise for them not having a double room available, they upgraded us for free to a twin room on the 30th floor overlooking the harbour! I have never had such a fantastic view from a hotel room before - it's beautiful. Throughout the stay the hotel staff were extremely helpful and polite, and the hotel was very clean. The breakfast consists of a buffet so you can help yourself to what youlike. It has a good selection including fruit, pancakes, pastries, cooked meats, cold meats, cereals, rice, soup, salad, yogurts, toast.....just to name a few. The sports bar in the basement of the hotel is a good place to chill out at the end of the day. It's informal and relaxed if you are want a beer after running around the city. The bar on the top floor 'TOTT' is very swish. We had a couple of drinks there on our last night and they sat us by the window overlooking the harbour (great view again!). The band playing were very talented. We ate at the chinese restaurant at the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and the food was good. The only thing I would comment on about this is that the table layout and the order of food are different from that in the UK. This was a formal meal and so there were extra bowls and spoons placed on the table which we were not sure what to do with! The prolem with this is that we spent much of our time looking at other tables to try and copy whatever they were doing, but it wasn't easy as they didn't seem to have the same stuff. I'm still glad we did this though. We were very pleased with this hotel. As such we are planning a trip back to Hong Kong next year and are planning on staying at this hotel again for that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and needs a good lick of paint and freshen up”
Reviews.Author: TheChimps
Reviews.Content: Great location but this hotel trades on its mandarin oriental brand. It's decor is tired and the rooms are average for what you pay. The staff are helpful and the service good but this hotel needs an overhaul. After a week there on business I moved to the crown plaza in causeway bay...it might not have quite the same view but for a similar price it was MILES better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lazyboy52
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and the fantastic customer service. We were in transit to Sydney and arrived at the hotel around 10:30am. I was amazed and delighted when we were checked in with no fuss or problem just very efficiently. The location of the hotel is great and throughout our stay every member of staff we encountered was polite, helpful and friendly. When we left the hotel very early to catch a flight we were about to go to the gate at the airport when my daughter realised she had left a valued item of clothing in her room at the hotel. Despite emails we did not get a response and mentioned this in my first review of the hotel here. Almost immediately I was contacted by Wendy Lee from the Hotel Group and it transpired the hotel had never received the emails and the item of clothing had been found and kept safe. Alicia Too at the hotel has arranged for it to be forwarded to us. This not only shows the power of Trip Advisor but also how on the ball the hotel was in reacting to the one part of my review which was negative. I thought the reaction was first class and consistent with the customer service we had received at the hotel. We will definately stay here again, this is a company that actually delievers great service not simply use it as a slogan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Superb service and great views”
Reviews.Author: HongKong27
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel many times but had felt it had grown somewhat tired. After hearing it had undergone a facelift we stayed there last year for 10 days. What a change - the staff were wonderful - nothing was too much trouble - the concierge is a pearl amongst men - he ensured that our stay in Hong Kong and at the Excelsior was first class and recommended a special restaurant for my special birthday! The hotel facilities are excellent and the Dickens/sports bar is great with very friendly staff and good food and beer. The hotel's position is wonderful ideal for the Noon Day Gun and easy access to Kowloon side. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbor views and rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sylvestor186
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered great views of the harbor. Nice roof top restaurant and great pub in the basement. Convenient to subway, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel with little going for it other than near shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the causeway bay shopping area- so if you want to be near there- there is the one plus of this over-priced hotel. Rooms are really dated and tired- you do not want to spend much time in them.. Bathroom- ok with crabtree items but still looks tired.. The executive lounge also is very basic and not as good as many in asia and elsewhere. The spa looks ok and massage was good- just shortened by the lady doing a barely disguised hard sell of products which was pretty damned annoying....up to 20 mins lost of the hour... I wld not go back to this hotel- tried to get in nearby Crowne Plaza but it was full hence ended up here..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for business - would choose somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: mikey_sara
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excelsior, Hong Kong during a two week business trip to Dalian and Hong Kong. Having stayed in a large, well appointed Shangri La room in Dalian for the previous week, I was expecting soemthing similar from the Mandarin Oriental chain in Hong Kong when staing at the Excelsior. I was to be sorely disappointed. Upon arrival we were met at the front of the hotel and arrangements were made to transfer our luggage to our rooms. So far so good. We joined a long line for check in and after a lengthy wait I was called forward. I was booked into a deluxe double room and once we had gone through the usual formalities I was taken aback with the throwaway line "by the way, it's not a double bed in this room it's two singles pushed together". That's the sort of comment I might expect to hear in a Travel Lodge or Premier Travel Inn but not at a hotel that is part of the Mandarin Oriental chain. "Is this ok?" the staff member enquired. "No, it's not ok" was the fairly obvious response. I asked to be changed to a room with a proper double bed and was told this wouldn't be possible. I pressed more firmly and was told I could have a room with a double bed if I was prepared to wait for three and a half hours until 10:30pm. I told them this too was unacceptable. The check in staff refused to look at any other options and finally I was told that I would need to take the assigned room and change at a later date if I wanted a different room. After unpacking everything this was going to be a hassle so I took the original room and the unpleasant experience with me. The room itself was small, dated and a real disappointment for a hotel chain with such a good reputation. I was glad I wasn't having to pay for this. The bathroom was clean but had a grubby feel to it. The view out of the bedroom window wasn't bad. To add to the mounting disappointments, there was no free wifi in the room and fixed broadband was also chargeable. Not great for a business hotel. Breakfast wasn't included in the room rate so I didn't eat any meals in the hotel, instead opting for cheaper local options nearer the office. On the plus side the location of the hotel is very good and is probably its best point. Would I stay here again? Only under protest. This was my first stay at a Mandarin Oriental Hotel and as they say, you only get one chance to make a first impression. The Excelsior failed on that count.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: slsLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Excelsior 3 times. The first time I stayed in a standard room. I was not impressed by the hotel, mainly because I asked for a non-smoking room and the room I got stank of smoke. I talked to the reception desk and they were not prepared to do anything about it, saying they had no other vacant rooms. The second and third times, in April and Nov this year, I stayed in an Executive floor room, and both times I had a fantastic stay. The executive lounge is staffed by lovely people and they are helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and had great views. The bathrooms are not great, and the showers, over the bath, are not up to much. Noise from other guests in the corridors can be a bit disturbing. It never actually became a problem during my stay. But the rest was great and I had a comfortable stay. The welcome tea and mangos was lovely, and the attention to detail from the staff was good. I had a meal at ToTT, with a colleague, which was rather disappointing. Overpriced and with not great service. Fabulous views though. The first floor restaurant was good. I am likely to be back. The location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Imagine ... an old 14" BOX TV for the Executive Floor Room!”
Reviews.Author: WeiWei2006
Reviews.Content: Disappointing for a business traveller, not sure if it's because I'm an Asian, I was assigned the worst room I have ever stayed in HKG. The irony is I was on the Executive Floor, and I would have expected a more premium room assigned for it. This is my 2nd stay in Excelsior after 4 years. During this period, I stayed in Shangrila, Marriott, Sheraton and Langham, all beats Excelsior hands-down. (The only compliment I have is for the staff in the Executive Lounge, read below) The room was the smallest among the 4/5 stars hotels I had stayed in HKG, though many people presumed that the rooms in HKG are small, but that's not entirely true. The nightmare is the TV ... it's the oldest and smallest TV I had experienced. It was a box TV and slightly larger than a 14inch. To make it worse, it was tucked away to the extreme right side of the room, while the bed was in the centre. I'm generally not a TV person, hence I decided not to create a fuss by demanding a change of room. Later that night, I tried to on the TV, and true enough, the remote control doesn't work from a far, I have to sit at the edge of my bed, stretch my hand to control it. Gave up immediately. The amenties are from Crabtree & Evelyn (I believe only for the Executive Level). The bathroom is clean. Compliments for the staff in the Executive Lounge, very professional, prompt and pleasant. The lounge was actually a better place to hang around than in the tired-looking room (it reminds me of the 80s). The food in the lounge was slightly disappointing too, had almost the rest spread for 5 days, especially the cut-fruits. I doubt I would return to Excelsior (unless the rest of the hotels are full) as HKG is a small island after all. I hope Excelsior management will look into upgrading the TV for the Executive Level, it's a disgrace as how much is a plasma TV today.

Reviews.Title: “Back again for the third time!”
Reviews.Author: liberaceLondon
Reviews.Content: So it can't be all that bad! It's comfortable, the staff know what they're doing and it's not a bad location. There are flashier hotels, there are bigger hotels, but for business and somewhere to base yourself during a busy trip to HK this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: KittyCatSingapore
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the negative reviews on this hotel. Yes, I admit that the hotel is not too new but they have a great location, not only to shopping but also great food. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Also had great turn down snacks as well as an ipod docking station. The Chinese gentleman (sorry I didn't get his name) at the front desk who checked me in and out was simply great! Made me feel really welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: weeklytraveller711
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am at Hong Kong, I always stay at the Excelsior hotel for the location, it is so perfect that as you walk thru the back door of the hotel, you are already in the middle of Causeway Bay area, with Sogo just a few meters away, and Times square a block away. The rooms are nothing out of the ordinary but the bathrooms could use extra space. Being part of the Mandarin Oriental Group, one would expect impeccable service and quality, but since this hotel is over twenty years old, the location makes up for the age of the hotel, overall, would still stay here in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan040254
Reviews.Content: Loved the location in Causeway Bay area wher you can just walk out of the hotel and be right in the thick of shops and local restaurants..and the energy of the pace is contageous. The buffet is very good and the TOTT's lounge on the top floor offers spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline. First class place with clean rooms, great shower, good view.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and easily accessible location, in the heart of HK”
Reviews.Author: ThoughtFool
Reviews.Content: We had travelled on business, so hardly any time to spend at the Hotel, though the location is one of the best, at Causeway Bay which is easily accessible from any directions, and you can easily go around and reach any shopping destination. Has a few restuarants too, we tried one of the oriental ones, and being a vegetarian, was surprised to see how they customised the dish to my taste! The rooms are good and comfortable, mine was a standard room and did not offer any view of the harbour, though i understand they do have rooms with this view, and since harbour is just next door, the view has to be good.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: We started our world trip honeymoon here. Causeway Bay is a good place to stay and this hotel is ideally located in the city. Check in staff we're friendly and although our room was a lot smaller then anticipated when booking it, it was clean, comfortable and we had a good view of the city and harbour. Internet is free for guests. The bar is quite nice and the happy hour even nicer ;-) The concierge is on hand to help you with your bags when your checking in and out. There is a nice park diagonally from the hotel which leads you to the main shopping/business district. We didnt eat at the hotel except for at breakfast, and that was nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place at affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: LucyLu007
Reviews.Content: Located in Causeway Bay, it has a great view of the harbour as well as it is close to the shopping area. The metro (the MTR) is also very close, making it extremely fast to move from the hotel to other areas of the city. While not the prime location for a business travel, i found the MTR very convenient to move quickly to the financial center. Taxi is also a great alternative otherwise, as it is so cheap in HK. I was warned that it was an older hotel, but the room was very nicely furnished, and had a spectacular view of the harbour (had a harbour view room). The bathroom was also good. There is a cafe on the first floor where they serve nice food, and the gym was well furnished. The hotel also offers airport transfers at very good rates (a bus takes off every 30 min in the day - has to be booked in advance).The only negative was that internet was not included in the rate, so overall i was very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Quintet1975
Reviews.Content: My family have lived in HK for a few years when I was just a wee child and given the chance to choose, Causeway Bay would be our top choice for convenience and familiarity. We have stayed in The Excelsior on and off over the past 30 years and having encountered a bad experience once (extremely noisy neighbours), decided to find new alternatives. That said, upon our revisit in Aug 2010, we were pleasantly surprised at the level of service and quality of the rooms. The hotel is located less than a five minutes walk from the MRT station if you exit from the Causeway Bay Sogo Department Store exit. Cross the traffic junction and in about 100m you'll find yourself at the World Trade Centre (WTC). From there, if you cut through the WTC by going up the escalators, there will be a sky bridge that links WTC to the second floor of the hotel. This reduces the amount of time exposed to the unbearably humid conditions during the summer. The Portugese Egg Tarts from the hotel's cafe (ground floor) are quite delicious and my personal favourite HK styled cafe, Tsui Wah is just a hop, skip and a jump away (in fact there are two). Tsui Wah's Pork Chop Buns and the "Piglet Buns" (direct translation) are highly recommended. Speaking of good food, the hotel's breakfast buffet for HKD178 per pax provided a wonderful selection of breakfast goodies enough to satisfy the tummy till mid afternoon. Note to hotel: The Excelsior should carry out renovations to all their rooms as soon as possible to revamp the slightly dated room interiors. Choose lighter wood interiors over dark cherry wood to help enhance the feeling of spaciousness inside the rooms. The step up shower should offer a higher marble barrier to prevent water from spilling out during use. Older rooms have a mild musty smell that may be eliminated with a carpet deodorizing agent.

Reviews.Title: “In NO WAY meets Mandarin Oriental expectations”
Reviews.Author: nyc345
Reviews.Content: When you hear that you will stay at a Mandarin Oriental property on a business trip, you think you've hit the jackpot. Not so with the Excelsior Hotel in Hong Kong. Its location is its strongest asset, the views are superb and the service is amateur. That said, the rooms are dingy, outdated and feel somewhat unclean and smell unfresh. The bathrooms are miniscule and the whole experience was an immense let-down. Breakfast was a depressing affair, whether in the restaurant or room service. The rooftop restaurant/bar are beyond cheesy. Having stayed at the real Mandarin Oriental, I can vouch for this hotel being a depressing disappointment. In fact, my colleague checked in and out within 15 minutes, refusing to park herself in such a dumpy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to spend a rainy weekend in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ShaneM8
Reviews.Content: Executive floor room with a partial view of the harbour. Great big bed with comfy pillows. Noisy people staying on the floor who should know to make noise in their rooms and not the corridor. Fantastic location in CauseWay Bay, near to Times Square and other great shopping. Easy undercover walk to the MRT, and then all of HK is available. Free shuttle service to the train and airport make getting in and out a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Just great! (Perfectly located 5 star property on Hong Kong Island)”
Reviews.Author: Vaporiser
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is part of the Mandarin Oriental hotels group and is easy accessible by all means of transport. This hotel has no pool but its bigger brother the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong does have a pool. If you like shopping in Hong Kong this is without doubt the hotel you need! The rooms as you would expect in Hong Kong are small but very comfortable. The breakfast is fantastic and well known by the locals. I have never seen so many choices. To name just a few Chinese, Japanese, Thai but also English, Dutch/German, French/Continental or fish, salads, hamburgers, cold bakery items and sweets. There are all sorts of freshly made to order vegetables juices as well as the normal fruit juices. All staff are very keen to help you and I nearly forgot to mention the harbour view for all hotel restaurants. In the basement is a busy bar to sit and relax with a drink when back in the hotel. I give this hotel 10 of of 10. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: travelingmadam
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights at Excelsior with my family and friends. booked by the travel agent so we got quite good discounts. all of our rooms were located at the 20th floor, overlooking the harbor view and kowloon so it was great. room was spacious enough and the bed was good. bathroom was okay for the standard of the hotel and clean. the TV is somewhat old already but i don't mind :P mini bar, well i never used it. i remembered that there's used to be an ice bucket available on the mini bar section, it is for us if we want to retrieve ices from the ice machine located on each floor (dunno if it still exists or not) well it was worth for us consider we stayed in the summer. anyway, breakfast was awesome i think. best yet i have ever tasted in Hong Kong so far. the selection was superb indeed,both American and Chinese cuisine really satisfied me. and the staffs are so polite and honest. i forgot my mobile phone which i left carelessly at the restaurant and surprisingly it was still there. good one. check in and outs were fast, i did not wait for 10 mins i guess. it is just amazing. MTR also near (very near indeed!), Sogo, Times square, SaSa, restaurants and coffee shops and grocery stores are nearby so it is like home away from home. well, again, since i was always on the go so i was not sure with the other facilities the hotel offered. i don't know if there's pool/gym there. would love to stay at Excelsior again when i have chance. i stayed there many many years ago so i dunno if it is still good as i have stayed previously.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Paolo L
Reviews.Content: We spent more than 10 nights at The Excelsior during a summer trip in Asia. The hotel is conveniently located just few steps (real walking distance) from the exit D of Causeway Bay MTR station. SOGO, Times Square and other minor malls are few minutes walking. This is definitely the plus of the hotel: for the rest is an ordinary 4 stars business hotel. Rooms are quite spacious for Hong Kong standards (26mq +/-) and well furnished, even if the hotel wasn't recently refurbished. Internet connection is not complimentary but offered for a reasonable price (HK$35/hour 150/day) The hotel offers to the guests 4 restaurants and a modern fitness center too. The Tott's restaurant on the top floor offers a stunning view of Victoria Harbor but just mediocre food: not the place you're looking for a good dinner in HK. Be patient during the check in: it will take longer than you can expect.

Reviews.Title: “great service!”
Reviews.Author: cute_kaila
Reviews.Content: I love their service! Love their location! I go to HK every year and this is one of 2 hotels I only stay at. I had items from Apple Online shipped to the hotel and they kept it for me until I arrived. Everything was in good condition!! Rooms are quite small... for me thats a problem. Since most 4 star hotels in HK are big, this hotel's room is not that. One thing they should give as part of their service is free internet connection... they dont have that. Charges for the usage is quite hefty too. Nowadays, its very important to have internet connection. SO they should look into that as well.

Reviews.Title: “a confirmed reservation not !”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Excelsior hotel numerous times we will definitely not be returning. Check in – We arrived at the Excelsior Hotel at 7pm and waited in the crowded lobby queue for 45mins before check-in. The staff seemed to be searching for a room for us, what a nightmare at this time of night! Wouldn’t you think if you had a confirmed reservation that your room would be ready? Hello, evidently not this time! The staff however offered us a smoking twin room which we declined. Only excuse the hotel could offer us was they were very busy. At 7pm after a long haul flight it was the last statement we wanted to hear. . Evidently, we were supposed to be happy with, a twin non smoking room which was later made into a queen bed by adding another mattress. ~! Our paid confirmed reservation was for a Grand Luxe harbourview/ king bed / non smoking room. We found the whole hotel experience appalling and wished we had booked into the Crowne Plaza up the road. Staff – The staff were very remorseful and offered their sincere apologies but quite frankly there is NO excuse for a room not to be ready at 7pm or not being given the room one had booked through the Excelsior hotel website with a reservation & confirmation number. We were later given an apology letter from the management but offered no reduced fees, free breakfast or drinks. Overall: we could not trust the Excelsior Hotel again regarding a secure guarantee reservation or the confirmation of a requested room and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: shbt1985
Reviews.Content: We started off our Honeymoon with a 5 days stay in Hong kong. the hotel is beautiful very modern and clean. staff were very helpful. all in all a very enjoyable stay! The room top bar is amazing and we really loved going up there for a drink stunning views. Also the hotel buffet was amazing. even if a little expensive the food was amazing and we were completely soilt for choice. def would recommend eating here. Hong kong its self is just amazing and buzzing! so much to do. but def highlight were using the metro! nong ping via cable car and ocean park. we did so much in 5 days but have some utterly amazing memories!!! the other thing i will say is we went in July and its SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO HOT AND HUMID!!!! thank goodness for aircon. The only thing i wish we did have was a swimming pool becuase of this. But still have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “awesome views”
Reviews.Author: SarahandChris
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel ater overnight flight from Australia at around 7am, our room wasnt ready so they gave us a standard room to use until our room was ready at no ectra charge! Room was Harbour facing, so had great views over the water and of the nightly light show! Room was fair size, with couch at window! 34th floor bar was fabulous!! .... Only thing that could have made this hotel better would be outdoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: superdash
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right in the heart of causeway bay. and just a few steps away from the shops and shopping mall. the hotel itself is very clean and well presented with excellent facilities. as it is part of the mandarinn oriental group then it up to exceptional standards. the coffee shop in the lobby area is really good. there is also dickins bar which is located on the lower ground floor. its a bar that has lots of golf memorablia in it but it has good drinks promotions. if you looking for a more glam location then tott's and the roof terrace located on the 34th floor is great place to start. it has amazing views across the water and there is a light display every night at 8pm as all the hotels and buldings in the area turn on there outside lights! ver fun to watch! there is a concierege service who will help you get a taxi etc to the local areas. there are so many things to do in hong kong and this hotel is a great staring point.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great position, great service”
Reviews.Author: MadHatter16
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned that The Excelsior would be too far out of the centre of Hong Kong to be a useful base for a 3 day visit. Wrong. Perfect position. 2 minute walk to underground station. 30 seconds from shopping centre. 10 seconds from Starbucks (choc frappacino for teenage son!). We had 2 superior twin rooms facing the harbour on the 15th floor. Perfectly quiet and peaceful. Average size, but nicely appointed. Be warned though, we had a shower room on our last day (much appreciated touch), 5th floor room 518. Very small standard double room facing piping and side of other building. Would have been very upset had that been our room for real! We arrived at 8.30am and were allowed to check in to our rooms straight away, for which we were very grateful. Nice understated and efficient service. Make sure you pop across to the noon day gun - well worth the burst ear-drums.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: LilyChina
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excelsior numerous times in the past for one reason: they get the basics right and its location is EXCELLENT for shopping. The hotel is not fancy or luxurious, but the service is professional: from the bellboys, to the reception, to the cleaning ladies who polish the glass doors non-stop. This visit to the hotel is consistent with my past experiences. If you want to maximize time for shopping and minimize travel time to the shops, the Excelsior is a great choice. By foot, Times Square is less than 5 minutes away, SOGO is about 2 min (subway under SOGO) and the World Trade Center is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: goonybones
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located, near everything in Hong Kong, specifically Causeway Bay, the shopping and nightlife mecca.

Reviews.Title: “A well-priced, well-located hotel, not Mandarin Oriental standard though”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: Decent 4-star-ish hotel, located in Causeway Bay very close to Victoria Park, Times Square and other shopping. Rooms are compact and tired but sufficient, and have the damp smell many reviewers have mentioned. Not over-powering, the smell hits you when you enter but you get used to it soon. LCD TV and Ipod dock look like recent upgrades. Small bathroom also needs up-gradation, slight smell there too. Otherwise, the service is good, the price is reasonable for Hong Kong (I paid around US$170+ B&B), and the breakfast buffet is excellent. Their food outlets seem pretty good too - there's a nice rooftop bar/restaurant with a great view over town, and the Dickens bar in the basement is friendly and atmospheric, and gets quite active when a game's on (I watched a World Cup Football match there). Close to the Causeway Bay subway station, and taxis are pretty reasonably priced anyway. Cab to Airport Express Central station costs about 35 HKD. Internet is expensive at 35 HKD/hour. Not a luxury hotel, but quite ok for a short stay for some shopping and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Only Business”
Reviews.Author: RajeevThakkar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well placed in Central Business district, had everything what is needed for a business trip. The staff are very accomodative and is also at the heart of Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel to me is pretty close to perfect. It's not posh and crazy-expensive and it's definitely not below-par either. It's a great, clean, spacious 4 star hotel and the best thing about Excelsior is its location, right in the heart of Causeway Bay. After hours of touring or shopping, it's easy to get back to and easy to duck out again for a quick shop or feed. Even though there's so much to eat around Causeway Bay, the hotel buffet breakfast is delicious and there's also a great dimsum restaurant inside. I've stayed here three times and love it every single time.

Reviews.Title: “One man's meat is another man's poisson”
Reviews.Author: Yingtong
Reviews.Content: I visit HK twice a year and usually stay at one of the two Renaissance hotels. This trip the Renaissance Kowloon was closed for refurbishment and Harbour View wanted to charge the earth so my travel agent booked me and my colleague here, the Excelsior. I love it. She hates it. I will ignore her moaning about the crowded lobby and rather faded decor, because this hotel gives me all I want as a business traveller. The service is first class, terrific value for money, comfortable well equiped rooms, all the facilities one needs except a swimming pool and the hotel hairdresser can only cut hair to a menu (I have no hair on my head but a beard that needs trimming but they couldn't handle that). So, super four star with real value for Hong Kong. Just aroud the corner from the Park Lane Hotel where the hair dresser didn't have a problem with my beard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hkdc
Reviews.Content: I received exceptional customer service from the concierge desk. I could not ask for more. Location-wise, it's only a few steps from the subway and bus stations. Stores and mall next door. Starbucks is across from the entrance. I had the buffet breakfast - was delighted at the variety! Rooms were large enough, not at all small from what I read in other hotels' descriptions and I was given a free upgrade. I was granted a late checkout but since my flight was not till 7pm, I came back to use the spa, with no issues. Will definitely stay here again when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: tmbobSlough
Reviews.Content: Very well run hotel with excellent staf. One of the Maderin Oriental Hotels and only rated 4 star but better than most 5 star hotels i have been in. Harbour view rooms can be small but stil comfortable with lots of amenities. Good restaurants and teh Dickens bar on teh lower floor one of teh best sports bars in town and well patronised by locla expats. Lots of good cheap eating place nearby for cheaper food than hotel but buffet in Dickens bar good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: elswickian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days which qualified us for their "long stay" rate - very worthwhile. The rooms are small and starting to look somewhat dated, but housekeeping is fastidious (sheets changed every other day). Tiniest niggles (1) Would have been nice to have had more than two bath towels - I have long hair and like to wrap my hair up whilst then towelling myself dry (husband had used the second bath towel, so not an option); (2) if it had a swimming pool that would be the icing on the cake. Location is great, so close to MTR, bus stops, food places - although the restaurants within the hotel were also good. The outstanding feature of this hotel is their staff - nothing is too much trouble. We had an Executive Room and the ladies in the Exec lounge were just fabulous, recommending that we get ourselves some Octopus cards for use on public transport (really useful). Would certainly recommend (and indeed have already done so) and would stay again. Thanks Excelsior for a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in the heart of Causway Bay...”
Reviews.Author: Lycheeice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Causway Bay. Very convient location to restaurant. There is a free shuttle if you are taking the airport express. The room we stayed in was pretty small considered the hotel class and the price we paid. The furniture has shown some wear and tear and can use some upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: quan_campbell
Reviews.Content: I can’t rave enough about the excellent care and advise that the staff at the Excelsior Hotel provided. From the run-of-the-mill dinner recommendations to finding us local fight tickets, they went out of their way to make sure that we found what we needed. The rooms were clean – and all amenities ‘fit’ my very tall husband. We somehow got stuck on a smoking floor – and I never remembered to ask for a room change. If I went again, I’d make sure that we were on a higher floor. Location was great, taxis abundant and great food within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Poppy_Ben
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our 4-week honeymoon enroute to Sydney. As this was effectively a "city break" within our overall holiday the hotel was perfectly positioned in Causeway Bay, had adequate facilities including bars and restaurants and had good service. A good solid all rounder for a fun city break in HK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ilovehkg
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Hong kong, i always stay in Excelsior hotel in causeway bay. location-wise,it is very convenient, supermarekts, MTR, bus stops, malls, restaurants are within the vicinity. The rooms are clean, the fixtures also(some hotels get renovated but skip to change the fixtures, eg. shower, faucets, lighting), but the room is quite small compared to others.they have friendly staffs too. overall"excellent

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteM
Reviews.Content: We stopped off at Hong Kong after staying in Australia and as this was our last port of call before we went home we wanted something a bit special. We got this at the Excelsior. We upgraded to Club which we probably didn't use fully but it was nice to use some of the facilities and perks. Staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for you. Next time in Hong Kong I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: JBLANCASHIREUK
Reviews.Content: Rooms not the most luxurious but well looked after and very clean .they contained everything you needed for a comfortable stay.The staff from front of house to housekeeping were very polite and friendly .The concierge were extremely helpful .In fact nothing was to much trouble for the staff of this hotel. Thank you for making our stay a very enjoyable experience

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trvlrz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior hotel for the whole month of January 2010. The location was great and close to many amenities. Many great restuarants around the hotel and the cafe on the 1st floor always offered great fresh food. The hotel is close to the subway and other public transportation so no location is to far to get to. If I travel to Hong Kong again, I would definitiely consider this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, only thing missing is a swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: ThaiChickBangkok
Reviews.Content: This is an efficient, busy hotel with good sized rooms for Hong Kong. Customer service is excellent in all departments. Excellent breakfast, freshly-squeezed juices, huge range of high quality food and no waiting for tables. The gym, bedroom and bathrooms are all well-appointed and very comfortable...gym is one of the best I've ever used in hotels. The location is great, next to the noon-day gun, also near an extensive shopping area. Go out of hotel front and turn right, walk about 200 metres for a great outdoor restaurant lane that seems relatively undiscovered. MTR is close by, near Sogo (go out of side door and turn left, keep walking). If no breakfast included then there is a starbucks opposite side entrance or a great illy coffee shop adjacent to ground floor lift lobby. We love this hotel for consistent high standards of service, facilities and location but the price is creeping up faster than for other similar well-appointed hotels with nice swimming pools. If you get a good deal then would recommend this but do check out competition. Great rooftop restaurant but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: mogathas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe harbour view room - the ones with the window seat. While the room and the presentation of the room was very nice, there was a musty smell and the windows had some mold around the sills. I'm not sure if this was down to the hotel being slightly dated or to it being right in the firing line for any weather front that comes in to the harbour. The hotel could probably do with investing in a whole new set of double-glazing that can try and combat this and hopefully eradicate the musty smell. In saying that it in no way affected our stay, or the lovely evenings spent looking at the amazing harbour view (worth the upgrade alone). Lovely buffet breakfast, with a wide choice of food available. We were so full we didn't really need lunch. Great atmosphere in the Dickens bar but I preferred the bar and nightclub on the top floor. Great views, great entertainment but the drinks weren't cheap! The hotel is in a great position, right on the harbour front, overlooking the yacht club, with a great view across and down the line of the harbour. Walk outside and you're straight into the hub-bub of Hong Kong shops, food places and the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Victoria park is a short walk away and well worth a leisurely stroll. The rest of Hong Kong is readily available on the nearby metro.

Reviews.Title: “Busy popular hotel, good location,”
Reviews.Author: combebelle
Reviews.Content: 35 minutes from airport, good views from higher level, higher price, rooms, and some restaurants. Everything works. Not the freshest decor but upper middle of the range facilities and prices. Busy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 19514G
Reviews.Content: By no means is this a 5 star hotel/ more like a nice convention hotel. The Mandarin name oozes great but this one misses the mark. The entire place looks very worn and tired. Too bad because the location is great and the staff does work so hard. When we arrived on our Non-smoking floor the hall reaked of smoke and I mentioned the smell to the fellow who led is to our room. By the time we exited the room the hallway had been sprayed and there was an air purifier set up. Another plus- although the room was small there was a queen bed for my husband and me and a built in twin bed for our daughter. It was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for eating out and public transport”
Reviews.Author: superwrong
Reviews.Content: I found the Execlsior to be in a good location for the underground and a very short walk out of the back of the hotel leads you to the thriving area of Causeway Bay, with lots of shops and a good choice of local restaurants. At the front of the hotel is a very busy road, and across from there the harbour, although not the best part of the harbour, which is further up Hong Kong island at Central -that's where you'll get the good views of Kowloon and the Star Ferry coming and going. If I return to HK I would choose to stay in Kowloon. That said, the Excelsior was a decent hotel, rooms were spacious and very clean. The fitness centre is excellent and I can definitely recommend the breakfast -the best buffet breakfast of any hotel I have ever stayed in. We did have 1 major disappointment on check in, which was that the room wasn't available for us. We had flown in from London and arrived at the hotel around 6pm, but were told we couldn't have the room until 11pm!! This was very frustrating for us, as we wanted to rest after such a long journey. They did allow us to use the fitness centre to have a shower and get changed, but that's not the same as being in your own room. They also gave us free breakfast for the duration of our stay and the manager sent us a bottle of wine and some fruit as an apology, which was all very nice. If you're interested in using the internet in your room, it's pretty expensive. For 1 hour we were paying 900 HK $. In summary, I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind being on the outskirts of town and if you get a good deal -otherwise I would advise you to check out hotels in Central or Kowloon with harbour views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, poor quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: waynecom7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior for another 11 nightshaving stayed there two years previously for a similar period of time. It has a good gym, great restaurants and lovely staff. It is pricey - internet, free in most hotels of this class, is extortionate and the bottle of water in your room will set you back about £5. The location is great for shopping and there are fantastic views from the top of the hotel. The problem with this hotel however, is the rooms. You pay 4/5 star prices but you get 2 star rooms. They're very worn and dated and you can't help feeling slightly cheated by the prices you pay around the hotel when the most important experience in a hotel - the accommodation - is so poor. The rooms were in desperate need of updating 2 years ago and things have only gotten worse. I spoke to a member of staff who told me that the hotel is always full hence the reason updating the rooms is not a priority. There are certainly tons of air crew there as well as coach loads of people who turn up each day, made noice through the night, and leave the next morning. Certainly not the best hotel in the area for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Had hoped for much better”
Reviews.Author: terryliz
Reviews.Content: This is a typical tired city hotel in serious need of refurbishment. We were on 25th floor in the rooms with partial view of the habour. The rooms were small and the bathroom hardly big enough to turn around in. The furnishings for both showed considerable signs of age and in urgent need of renewal. Corners seem to be cut on the most trivial of things - for example there was no complimentary water in the room and no fruit or chocolates as we had received in other Hong Kong hotels of a suposedly lesser standard. The rooms were kept clean but we were surprised to find that they were still being cleaned when we returned at 4 o'clock in the afternoon. Of course there was also an additional charge for the internet which is something we quite resent paying when staying in top class hotels nowadays but at HKD.130.- per day this was also expensive. The pubic areas and restaurants are small, very busy and crowded and not at all welcoming. The staff seemed to adopt an attitute that they would assist as much as they needed to but not be any more helpful. As a result we felt inclined to spend our time away from the hotel in the city. We did not take the breakfast at an extra charge but found places nearby instead (there is a Starbucks just outside which opens early). Admittedly were were staying over New Years Eve but the hotel seems to offer very poor value for the not inconsiderable rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, but great lounge”
Reviews.Author: takateazi
Reviews.Content: On the day of arrival, it took 45 minutes to check in due to the computer system being down. After finally checking in, we were told we could've checked in on the 31st floor at the executive lounge as we were staying in the executive suite. The rooms cost over $500 aud per nite and the rooms were absolutely tiny. The view of the harbour was very nice, however there was just no room to move around. For such an expensive and prestigious hotel, there was only a bath with a shower curtain and the room just fit a queen size bed and there wasn't enough room to walk either side of the bed. However, the executive lounge and TOTT's were fantastic. Complimentary drinks, snacks, beer and cocktails at the lounge all day was a nice touch. The view from TOTTs was amazing and I would only stay at this hotel again to make the most of the executive lounge. If you can afford to splurge, stay here, otherwise there are better value hotels in Cbay.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Fairy_Nat
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the excelsior hotel in October this year. My mum was on a business trip and so we were allocated rooms on the executive floors. The rooms are spacey with a range of drawers and space to put clothes. The rooms and bathrooms are clean, and the maids tidy them (very well) every day. We were given free internet connection due to the purpose of our stay, but it was easily accessible and the prices were reasonable. Breakfast in the executive lounge was delicious, with a definite variety of food about! Also, as part of the executive lounge, we received lunch, afternoon tea, and snacks for free whenever! The staff in the lounge were wonderful, very polite and quick to learn names which made you feel special. I do recommend the upgrade, it may be slighty more expensive, but you do get what you pay for. Otherwise, there is a range of quick snack cafes to traditional restaurants around. The restaurants we visited were TOTT's which offers an exceptional view over the harbour and the traditional Cantonese restaurant. These were both of very high standard. There is also a bar/pub which is VERY BRITISH downstairs. Throughout the day it is filled with obviously British men and women, with football or rugby playing on the TV's and recognisable music playing over the sound system. This is a lovely 'homely' getaway from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Other nights we ventured out to the centre of hong kong which is a very quick metro ride away. Most of the population chose to ride via metro, but it is not busy. It is very well sign posted, with LED lights noting which stop you are at and even which side of the carriage to exit! The prices are also AMAZING! I would recommend buying an 'oyster' card or as they call it 'octopus' card. They may not make it quite clear about the conditions, but we later found out after opting not to buy these, that they were a much better deal. You can travel the metro, the bus, the ferry and the tram with these cards, and if you do not use your credit by the end of your stay, you simply return to an information desk and they give you the money back which you have no spent! The hotel views look out upon the harbour which at night is a sight to see. In the day time, the heavy smog that hangs over Hong Kong does prevent you from seeing too far out. I definitely recommend the markets in Hong Kong, even if you do not buy anything, they are worth a wonder round. Especially the night market over on Kowloon. You can definitely find knock of brands for fractions of the prices, especially a lot of Polo Ralph Lauren! The hotel are also very helpful with troubleshooting. We left a laptop on the plane and realized when we got to the hotel. Luckily our airline crew were actually checking in at the exact same time as us, and they managed to give us the flight phone number. The hotel then took things into their own hands and did everything for us. We arrived at about 4pm local Hong Kong time, and by 9pm that evening the laptop was with us. The concierge and desk staff are very helpful. They can help with absolutely anything, and are very kind. I would gladly return to the excelsior hotel. The welcoming staff, cleanliness and general atmosphere all should be praised tremendously. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Hong Kong, and I do not doubt that this was mainly down to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Terrace bar along the harbour”
Reviews.Author: IndiaAha
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel was its 34th floor restaurant and bar. Tot's bar was excellent. You can enjoy the Victoria harbour. The ''Symphony of Light'' show on the harbour could be best enjoyed sitting at the Tot's bar. The collection of menus are simply superb. I would recommend ''Lobster Burger''. It was excellent. Rooms are average. But considering the location, its worth.

Reviews.Title: “The Good Price v/s facilities Hotel Excelisior HK”
Reviews.Author: PKA420
Reviews.Content: The hotel has is at excellent facility near victoria harbour and victoria park. Secondly, the hotel provides free fruits evey day and wine or chaimpaine bottle on check-in. The hotel is good with comparable 5 star facilities. The hotel is much cheaper compared to other five star facilities hotes in vincity e.g. The Hotel charged HKD 1200/- per day as compared to Hotel Park Lane which was charging HKD 1500/- per day. The restaurants are good. The location (Causeway Bay) is excellent, which is the prime shopping mall area with lot of vibrant atmosphere in vincity. Overall I am very satisfied with the service v/s price / locatlity of the Hotel. The staff members were very co-operative and service was great. The talk of the town bar in the hotel has live music facilities andis one of the best bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELSIOR great position - old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marko K
Reviews.Content: In november i spend 3 night and hotel is on great, i can say perfect location for everything, food, shops, caffe, bars....many good local small chinese restorants whith domestic food and restorans of all others asia nations. And all other things are near: exibition center, strong center, streets for night life...all is 10 minutes whith taxi from hotel. Hotel have very good restoran on 34 florr whith perfect view of Hong Kong and open teraca for drink. Is spetial in the evening, but little bit to expensive for this level. Services in hotel are great, on every place you have good explanation and help, spetial on reception. Try espresso caffe and fresh watermalone or grape juice near lift in small natural bar!! Bad point is room: deluxe room is enough big for one and is clean, but all furniture is too old and too much spend. You have inside LCD big TV, i box for iphone or ipod nano and perfect view on bay (specially in the night) and you have old furniture:)) Strange. But for shure o choice this hotel and next time when i visti Hong Kong. p.s. if you like massage and spa, try LET'SPA in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ExpTravellerOulu
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small and a bit tired, but clean. The staff is very friendly. There is a huge amount of shopping possibilities nearby and also the Victoria Park is close. The pub / sports bar at the basement was really nice. However, I recommend you to have a drink at the top floor bar that has magnificent views. If you are there on Sunday, the champagne brunch at the top floor is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “club floor on excelsior”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay here, this time on the club floor. first thing we notice is the room is slightly bigger especially the bathroom. not flashy but still a good 4 star hotel. furniture and fitting starting to look tired. apparently the club floor has been re-furbished, hard to tell cause the hotel choice of furniture is already looking dated. you can get 3 main meal there a day, there is breakfast, lunch and canapes for evening. apparently kids are not allowed in the evening - cannot work out why cause everyone was casually dressed - no dinner/cocktail suits noted during that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CahirO
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this one especially if you can get a Bay side view which we had. The buffet breakfast is well worth the value and sets you up for the day....honestly! Hotel is close by to main subway terminal, shopping, parks and stuff. The bar downstairs is very nice, good bar snacks but obviously a world away of what Hongkong actually is..... so if your not interested in culture then hit the basement bar, otherwise get outside and see around enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: loggerPeterborough
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all that one needs, the room service was really great and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: MarsbarNorthants
Reviews.Content: Just spent my 30th visit to this hotel & it was the usual 'safe pair of hands' in this fantastic city. Other reviewers have got it right - especially ''Flighattendant's'' frst-class review - the hotel is maybe a little tired compared to some of the newer arrivals (Crowne Plaza, Grand Harbour etc.) but it has occupied ''Plot Number 1, H.K. Island' for many years and is unequalled in location - both from being right on the very edge of the spectacular harbour (especially the night-time view) & in terms of the abundance of shops, restaurants, public transport and other attractions literally right outside your doorstep. Causeway Bay itself is a better bet than a Kowloon-side hotel in the writer's opinion and the whole ambience is fast, busy, exciting and above all safe. The hotel's restaurants are all first-class and not over-the-top expensive - dinner-buffet on 'Cafe on the First' is a real treat and extremely good value with an amazing array of varied & delicious choice, likewise the 'Yee Tung Heen' cantonese and 'Cammino' Italian restaurants. The basement 'Dickens' Bar' has a good atmosphere by night and does a geat lunch-time curry buffet for a tenner with a free drink ! Staff are cheery & courteous and give the impression thathey are there for your benefit not vice versa. In summary a great place to be and one I hope to return to another 30 times !

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bingleyboy
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 31st floor as asked for a Deluxe Habour view room which was well worth the upgrade when we booked. Excellent view over the habour and the whole of Hong Kong. Rooms are very clean and plenty of space especially with 3 suitcases with us. 5 minutes walk to the Causeway Bay tube station and 4 stops to Central. Very much in the centre of the shopping district of Hong Kong Island. Not tried the food in the hotel apart from the breakfast which was very good and lots of options. Great it is also available until 11am which was lucky as laid in a couple of times with the jet lag. Good location, nice staff, expensive for drinks etc but it is a quality hotel so what do you expect. Go to the 7 Eleven store 2 minutes away for your cheap water and drinks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: I stay here 4-5 times a year and never disappointed.Great Location and Service.Food is buffet style in main restaurant with harbour views of very high standard.Bar "Talk Of The Town" has fantastic views and has relaxing cocktail bar.Dickens bar in the basement in the style of "Brit Pub".Some guest rooms are a bit tired now!Location excellant for Royal Hong Kong Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Peewee74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon. At check in we were offered to upgrade to club floor for an extra £60 oer night. This then gave us breakfast and access to executive level where there were free drinks and snacks all day and the best view over the harbour. Breakfast was excellent and the service from the staff was exceptional. Location of hotel is perfect - good access to transport links - star ferry/tram and underground. Recommend the Peak by day and at night. Avoid the Aberdeen fish market if in an organised tour as not much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run business hotel, rooms may need a facelift”
Reviews.Author: SEAsianFlyingFish
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in Excelsior Hotel in late August in a premium room facing the bay. Room was spacious, with excellent beds and linen. Furniture a bit tired, as well as bathroom marble. Bathroom's shower curtain was stained and smelled of humidity - a replacement was clearly needed. Check-in and check-out was quick and efficient, a reflection of the hotel's excellent staff. High-quality, varied breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a fun location”
Reviews.Author: 3GDude
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least 6 times and just realized I've never reviewed so here goes. If you love to shop this is the place to stay. You're only a few minutes walk from huge mainstream shopping, big department stores, and very close to Jardin's Walk and the Ladies Market. If you want to try local Chinese cuisine there are scores of little places hidden all over the Causeway Bay area. As for the hotel, the service for me has always been exceptional. The rooms tend to be a bit aged, but they are well maintained and very clean. I always stay on the executive floors, so the service level kicks up a notch or so plus there's nothing like the free bar in the evening or the ability to get soft drinks all day. There's a 7-11, Haagan Daz and Starbuck's just a minute walk from the hotel, along with what is probably the busiest sushi restaurant on the planet (Itamae). Also, every single cab driver in Hong Kong knows "Excelsior" so there is never a problem getting back to the hotel. Last but not least there is Dicken's Pub in the basemet, a relatively genuine English Pub that shows all sorts of sports and has many TVs as well as some big screens for major events. The hotel is home to many flight crews, so the bar gets busy with them early evening and then again late evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, very friendly and welcoming, high quality”
Reviews.Author: dawnlancs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days, speedy checkin. on arrival at our room, a member of staff brought up a complimentary bottle of chardonnay on ice! room was great, my son was pleased with the complimentary tin of sweets! We had dressing gowns and slippers provided, and toiletries which included bath gel, shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, moisturiser and vanity kit - all replaced every day! The breakfast was amazing, lots of choice, waitressing staff are lovely especially tabie and scarlet, who gave my son a box of chocolates on the last day. The hotel connects with the world trade centre which has lots of shops and eating places such as starbucks. The hotel is in an excellent location, everyhing is on your doorstep, i would choose causeway bay over kowloon. I would highly recommend the excelsior and would return there tomorrow if i had the chance! if you go with children they are allowed in the dickens bar, just not allowed to drink alcohol (not as if they would). A must is to have the curry buffet in dickens bar, £15 for 2 people and 2 drinks included, it was the best curry i have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “great start to the honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: wayulooktonige
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for three nights. The lobby is very impressive, gloriously air-conditioned and the staff were always courteous and attentive. This was the first few nights of our honeymoon and we were upgraded with a view across to Kowloon and a complementary bottle of champagne. Our room was, despite being upgraded, was rather average in our opinion. Nice king sized bed but otherwise not particularly spacious and the view was quite limited. Dickens Bar beneath the hotel is excellent, great atmosphere during 'Happy Hour' - 4 til 8 p.m. The Roof Top Bar has stunning views up on the 34th floor - very recommended although the drinks are more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, fantastic food!”
Reviews.Author: Sydsider
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here for a business meeting. Rooms large by Hong Kong standard. Beds very comfortable and showers great. Nice little touches such as chocolates and biscuits in a tin shaped like the hotel on arrival. The view was beautiful! Ate in the first floor restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The buffet was amazing!! Such a variety of food and excellent quality. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: amanda25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for 5 nights during a far east tour. We arrived at 07:30am and had no problems checking in and getting our allocated rooms. Great location and staff very helpful. View from hotel room over the harbour was superb and the room size for hong kong was above expectations. Room staff even put book-mark in my book which I had left open on the side one morning. Ladies: make sure you have a manicure and pedicure at the hotel.... the best ever looked fab for over 2 weeks!!!!!!! Quite a busy hotel as seems to be used by a lot of business people but not a problem. Bar at the top great but a little expensive - good entertainment - live band/singers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, great position”
Reviews.Author: TamarTiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two Mandarin Oriental hotels on my trip and will try to use them as much as possible in future. Their service is outstanding. Nothing is too much trouble. The Excelsior was no exception The greeting from the reception staff was amazing. They were already aware that our bagge had been lost and arranged emergency packs of necessities to tide us over until it arrived. The room was spacious and comfortable. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The speed of room service or anyone coming to the room was unbelievably fast. The position of the hotel is perfect for getting around although the hotel arranges pick ups from the door for anything their guests want to do. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Value Hotel near Causeway Bay.”
Reviews.Author: NicholasPhan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money and the location is not bad if one wants to be near Causeway Bay. Definitely not as luxurious as the Four Seasons or the hotels located at Pacific Place but not as expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Bun_H
Reviews.Content: My visit to this hotel really was quite faultless. The hotel organised a car to pick me up form the airport and the driver telephoned ahead when we were nearly there so that a manager could assist me with check in at a separate desk to save me queuing up with the other arrivals.
