This was appreciated after a 12 hour flight from the UK The Excelsior is right on the habour, and the room afforded excellent views over to Kowloon. All the staff I came across at this hotel were excellent. The hotel has a great Chinese restaurant on the 2nd floor, where a set menu will cost about £20 a head. There is a rooftop bar as well that has live music, but the drinks prices were quite dear here, as they seem to be in all hotels. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here and would definately book again the next time I visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to detail and service”
Reviews.Author: maozhou
Reviews.Content: I think the room size is fine for a luxury hotel in Hong Kong. When I go to HK I spend very little time in the room since there is so much to do and see (and eat). I don't really understand the complaints unless you tried to get the cheapest room available or arrived during HK Sevens when the hotels are packed. I had a very severe slice to my foot from the escelators in the HK airport. When I arrived the manager immediately asked me if I wanted a wheel chair and help to my room. They then provided me a list of clinics nearby that could treat my wound. (which ended up requiring stitches). Another example is that I was reading a book in the morning before leaving the hotel and left it open by my bed. When I returned the maid had placed a bookmark inside to avoid losing my place. These kind of small things all add up to a world class hotel. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel - Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Carmen1318
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2008. The lobby is nice, but do not let that fool you. The rooms are outdated and need remodeling. I have stayed at 5 star resorts in beijing, shanghai, and bangkok, but excelsior looks like motel 6 next to those resorts. The rooms were small, but I expected that considering how densely populated hong kong is. Location is descent as there is a shopping mall across the street and some local street vendors, dessert place, and crepe place. But that's about it for the positives for this hotel. Otherwise, stay at four seasons (right on the water) or the peninsula in kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong for 5 nights and decided to stay at The Excelsior Hotel. This proved to be a fantastic choice. From the moment we arrived, we were looked after by the staff at the reception area. The check-in process was very quick and informative. We upgraded our room to a Harvour View room and it was superb! They even gave us the corner room - room #1001 which is incredibly spacious and this is rare in a space constraint city like Hong Kong Island. The king size bed and pillows were sublime and the view, stunning. We rang for a cotton sheet and it was brought up to our room within 5 minutes - this is fantastic service! We also dined at the hotel on 3 occassions - twice in Dicken's Bar for drinks and dinner. Beware - the food portions are huge so if you are not hungry, share 1 meal! We also had a very generous and scrumptious dinner buffet and once again, make sure you starve before you show up because the quality and variety of food is excellent and very generous! The Excelsior Hotel is very well-situated and the MTR is merely 2 mins walk and located at the 12 storey SOGO shopping centre. If I ever return to Hong Kong, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night as a stop over on the way home from Sydney. Transfer from airport took well over an hour due to the traffic so we arrived late in the evening and feeling very tired. Staff very welcoming and attentive. Room small but clean and beds lovely and comfortable. If you are only staying as a stopover and have a day to spend before travelling on I would thoroughly recommend the half day tour with Tour East tour company.Following a delicious buffet breakfast we had a wonderful four hour tour taking in Aberdeen Harbour - with a trip on a sampan arranged as an extra if wanted ( I would recommend this), Repulse Bay , the market and finally a trip up to the Peak with a trip down in the tram included. As we had never visited before and had such a short time this was ideal to get an overview of the area. The trip was made all the more enjoyable due to the friendliness and efficiency of the guides. We still had the rest of the afternoon to enjoy the shops before getting our transfer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: royalton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our toddler. We had an upgraded room which was a very good size, with sofa, desk and chair and a large bathroom with bath. The best thing about this hotel is its fantastic location in Causeway Bay Hong Kong Island, near the metro, shops, restaurants etc. We can't comment on the food as we were on a room only basis and did not eat in the restaurant - but it did have a great menu and lovely nighttime views of the harbour. The staff were always friendly and courteous and the door staff always helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “The room is soooo tiny!”
Reviews.Author: Barlowgurl
Reviews.Content: It was my second time in Hong KOng and we decided to change our hotel not because of some bad exp but because the TV in the other hotel room did not have a single english language channel. So we booked out trip with our 3 year old at that time at Excelsior Hotel. Excelsior just finished renovating a new wing during that time and we were hoping to get that room. Sadly our package did not include being assigned to the new room. We arrived a bit tired and we waited 1 hour to check in because the line at the check in counter was toooooo long! When we finally got to our room we were surprised to get a teeeny tiniest room ever. Its like a step and you are at the bathroom door, another step the bed and two more steps and you get the window. We couldnt even put out luggage down on the floor because we wouldnt be able to walk around. Besides that though, the hotel is in the heart of Hong KOng, easy access to transportation as soon as you step out o the hotel. If you can take the closet of a room it was given that it was a bit pricey for the space, then the hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location and Exemplary with special diets”
Reviews.Author: RINSO84
Reviews.Content: Transfer took from airport is about 45 minutes. We stayed five nights. The hotel located in a great area at Causeway Bay. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. We had booked an executive room and breakfasts were serviced in the executive lounge. The meals in the restaurant were great, the breakfast was included with a selection of eastern and western foods,. We had emailed ahead regarding the requirement for a gluten free diet (one of us is a celiac). When we first went to the executive lounge they brought up the gluten free meals and from then on things went exceeding well. We eat in the TOTT’s and Cammino and the food and the staff were fantastic, and a view from TOTTS is a must! The staff in the executive lounge were exceptional Our room was great and was extremely nicely furnished and super view across to mainland Would we stay at your hotel, a definite yes, would we recommend your hotel a most definite yes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for both business and tourism. Friendly and helpful staff and the room is a good size if just a tiny bit on the tired side. The breakfast makes up for everything though. There is a fantastic choice and juice combinations of your choice are pressed freshly for you as you wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keegan_9
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing experience. Great hotel with helpful staff. Great bar Dickens with plenty of action and an brilliant lunch at a cheap price. I would recommend a harbour visit room because the view is out of this world. Do try cocktails on the 14th floor for more splendid views of the city. All in all a ten out of ten experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: The location of the Excelsior in Causeway Bay is its main attraction for me. It is close to the MTR, plenty of buses to Stanley etc., the trams, plenty of shops and the nightlife area of Wanchai, besides having a wonderful harbour front position. The hotel itself is very efficient with excellent service. The rooms are very small but contain everything you need. They could, however, do with a little bit of a modernization. The bathrooms are minuscule but again are well equipped. Some rooms have terrible views of the World Trade Centre building next door, so avoid these if possible. There is a good health club, but no swimming pool. The Dickens Bar downstairs is a good place to start your evening and serves great pub grub. If the rooms were updated this hotel would definitely receive 5 stars from me. In the meantime it is still my favourite hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: kennystag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights as part of my wife's 40th birthday celebrations. This was a surprise holiday for her to a place she had always dreamed of going. So here we go... Check in, Is it me or does it seem to take an age to check in (anywhere) nowadays, however, we had just got off an overnight fight from London and were knackered, but it was worth the wait as they upgraded us to a full harbour view room. The Room What is it with these people who are consistently moaning about the size of rooms in the far east - where have they stayed before? I'd love to know. Do you go on holiday to recharge your moaning batteries. They're probably either Americans or business types who don't get out much. I didn't go to HK to stay in a hotel room all day. It was clean and well appointed with a 2 seater built in couch (beneath the full harbour view window!!), a single built in seat, a good sized wardrobe, mini bar & coffee making area, a large desk area that ran half the length of the room which my wife turned into her own makeup department with associated toiletries, (I had a small section for my one bottle of aftershave in the bathroom!) And if you were able to swing an asiatic lion around, you wouldn't touch the sides!! Oh and then there's the king size bed! Its plenty big enough. On the value side of things, the mini bar was very expensive (aren't they all) and so never touched. The Bathroom Always very clean. Power shower over the bath, always got hot water, shower curtain was spotless (even though you could tell it wasn't brand new). One point here is that a taller person may have trouble standing upright in the shower as the ceiling appeared low. Housekeeping Fantastic. The girls were extremely friendly and kept our room immaculate. I think our carpet was hoovered every day (that's for all you lot who like discussing dirty carpets on this site!). We always walked back into our room at night and it was as if we were entering the room for the first time. Hotel amenities Never tried Dickens Bar or any of the restaurants so can't really comment. There's a few shops in the hotel but we were so keen to visit the sights of HK, again we never visited. There is a small bakery shop on the ground floor (this WAS visited on several occassions, plus a few more that the wife was unaware of) that sells various danish pastries and cakes/sweets and the most delicious egg tarts. Reception Typical of your now common big hotel concierge. There were about 3 to 4 concierge staff on at the same time and this is where I marked them down on the service score slightly. Whilst they seemed very keen to service your request for information, they never really answered the question I asked - its as if they assumed they knew what you were going to ask, and then decided on the answer they would give while you finished asking the question and then answered with info' you didn't really want or understand, however I asume an allowance has to made for my northern UK dialect. "MIke" however, was fantastic and always answered with info' I was looking for (but he wasn't always on the desk), he even knew ALL the bus numbers to get around the city. Oh by the way, don't go everywhere by MTR, take the bus and really take in the city, or a tram, especially at night. Location I believe excellent, some may not, for the reason I do. It's on the less manic side of HK (HK island, not Kowloon). Its next to the impressive Victoria Park, far enough away from the central district to avoid the crowds yet close enough to get to quickly. Times Sq and all the bright lights of Hennessy Rd are all close by and the MTR is just round the corner. Hong Kong itself Amazing, we went for 7 days, no way near long enough, going again next year probably for 10 days to see all the stuff we missed. Its a very clean city, even around the "knock off" (sorry, bargain areas) of the Ladies Market and Temple St Market. Public toilets are exceptionally clean and there always seemed to be an attendant waiting to clean the cubicle you have just visited, prior to its next occupier. The Pro's - The peak, the skyline, the lightshow, Bank of China Tower, Stanley, Star Ferry, Nathan Road, Shopping experience both mall and street, Chi Lin Nunnery, Lantau Island (including Big Buddha and the Ngong Ping cable car) Victoria Park (garden peace and T'ai Chi amongst a bustling city) the cleanliness and many many many more. The cons - You have to come home sometime. Finally and this is one for the ladies - Shoes - My Mrs says its one of the best places to view and buy shoes..... tell me about it (my credit card needed to come home for a holiday!!)

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: GCH059
Reviews.Content: We have been to HK many times in the last few years, and now will only stay in the Excelsior on one of the Executive floors (we are dead posh). Service is wonderful as are the views from the Lounge and the restaurant on the top floor. Location is brlliant for Causeway Bay and the MTR is only 5 minutes walk away. Pay a bit more and live a little! Gordon and Heather

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: spikeyredhead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated close to the ferry for Kowloon Staff very happy and helpful My room had a wonderful view of the harbour Opposite the Noon Day Gun

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with some short comings”
Reviews.Author: paulreg
Reviews.Content: Good location and very friendly staff especially in the bar and housekeeping. The basement bar has good selection of European beers and shows sport however no children allowed probably best as very smokey. Rooms quite small and hotel is right next to the busiest road on Hong Kong Island. Check IN was a pain due to long wait Don’t use their wireless service as slow and weak signal in 2 places I tried and also very expensive. Discovered from a work colleague the price for one days internet is what he pays his telcom for 1 month. More and more hotels now offer free WIFI hopefully Mandarin Oriental will follow suit else pop round the corner as the government provides free service in Victoria Park

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accommodation and location”
Reviews.Author: Rowey14
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Hong Kong it matched our expectations and The Excelsior only added to the experience. It is a top notch hotel in an ideal location 2 minutes from the hustle and bustle of Causeway bay and the MTR and only 5 minutes from the serenity of Victoria Park or a walk along the waterfront. We were glad we opted for the 'calmness' of HK Island as opposed to the buzz and constant approaches from tailors, etc. in Kowloon. The service at the hotel is exceptional and all the staff are so happy to greet you. From the moment we checked in we met with nothing but politeness and smiling faces. The variety of food on offer at breakfast was vast and the dining room setting overlooking the harbour is sensational. Don't have any hesitation about booking a room at this hotel, I'm sure you won't be disappointed. If we return to HK we won't consider any other hotel. Top class accommodation in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, small but functional room”
Reviews.Author: hjk1221
Reviews.Content: I stay here to attend a conference in HK convention center after a disappointing 2 night stay at Royal Plaza. Compare to RP, Excelsior is heaven. I booked an executive floor room and was upgraded to partial view. Room size is a little small but in HK you don't spend much time in your room and it has everything you need including adequate storage space. Bathroom amenities is VERY nice. Room is very clean with nice touch such as all our books were given a bookmark by the maid! But the best part of the hotel is its great location. Easy to get around and shuttle service provided to the convention center. Breakfast buffet is the best I had in HK and I had stayed in at least 6 other hotels in HK. Food is very fresh and tasty, very delicately prepared, not like other buffet breakfast but more like what you will find in a fine restaurant. Juices are fresh including custom juice bar where you can pick the fruits & vegetables you want for your juice. Service in the restaurant is very quick with beautiful view out to the harbor. The executive lounge is another great point about this hotel. Although small, it is very comfortable and great service. Wine and champagne glass are filled immediately and the canape is just to die for during happy hour 6-8pm. I don't even bother with dinner and just enjoy myself at the lounge at night. The best part, of course, is the dessert which is of the quality you only find at the best restaurant, easily costing $8 each and they have a different selection every night. With the breakfast buffet, light lunch, and happy hour, the lounge fee more than pay for itself, I highly recommend it. Compared to other HK hotels I stayed, Excelsior has the best service. It is very good value if you choose the club floor rooms. Seasoned travelers who seek a little bit of luxury and comfort will find Excelsior a great choice. It is, however, definitely not a budget hotel, but if you are on a long journey its well worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent view”
Reviews.Author: Samkeith
Reviews.Content: Excellent view of the harbor. Very convenient to everything. We stayed in the harbor view room at a great rate. The only problem is the bathroom was very small and the room had no real ventilation - thus not a fresh smell. The staff were very efficient. Definitely, we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware the buffet”
Reviews.Author: soosiesoosoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights as a stopover on the way to Oz. The location is perfect, the staff are amazing, really friendly and helpful. The rooms are fairly average, quite small, but from our room on the 22nd floor we had the most amazing view of the city. The decor is modern and everything is well maintained. Our only complaint against this hotel comes from our visit to the buffet restaurant on the second floor. After a long flight from the UK we arrived in the evening and not wanting to go out of the hotel hunting for a meal we ventured to the buffet restaurant in the hotel. We made the mistake of not checking the price before we sat down, and I wasnt even very hungry so I only picked up a few items. When the bill came I nearly choked. I have no idea what the cost of the buffet actually is per person but it certainly left a big hole in our wallet. Despite this, it is a good hotel and pretty good value for money (buffet excluded!).

Reviews.Title: “A consistently great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqFly
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Excelsior off and on for over twenty years. It has always been good. My most recent stay was in February 09 and I was not disappointed. Although the hotel may need a refurb its customer service does not. It has always been a feature for me as well as the fantastic harbour view rooms. On this occasion, the staff at all levels went out of their way to assist me and my wife, to such an extent that in two cases we were literally 'amazed'. The hotel is owned by the Mandarin Oriental group and it shows. My favourite hotel is the Mandarin Orientel in Manila, and it only just shades the Excelsior. A great location and fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: 98ajc
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hong Kong. Last time we stayed at the Shangri-la in Kowloon (which was fantastic) so this time we decided to try to view of the harbour from the island. Plus we have kids now so couldn't afford to stay at the Shangri-la again. We had booked interconnecting side harbour view rooms with a guaranteed upgrade to full harbour view. However when we arrived the interconnecting full harbour view rooms were all taken. After some hard negotiating at reception we upgraded to a suite with two bedrooms on the corner of the 21st floor. The cost of the upgrade was very reasonable when you take into account that it included access to the executive lounge on the 31st floor with free buffet breakfast, all day snacks, drinks and cocktails included. Also the view from the lounge and the kids bedroom was amazing. We sat looking out of the window watching the boats going by for hours. It is also a good spot to watch the lazer show at 8pm each night. Our suite had a large double bedroom with a walk-in wardrobe and ensuite bathroom. The lounge was even bigger and there was a seperate bathroom in the hallway. The kids room had twin beds and an ensuite bathroom. The decor may be a little dated but the carpet was luxurious and there was a big flat screen TV in each room and a games console in the lounge. If you are staying in Hong Kong with your family then I would recommend a suite at the excelsior - after all with that view and all that space you can't go wrong. Breakfast was excellent. The staff could not do enough for us. We had a wonderful 5 nights at this hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel other than breakfast because there are so many other great places to eat nearby - try crossing the air conditioned bridge link from the hotel to the World Trade Centre for starters. To get about in Hong Kong you couldn't be better placed. The MTR station at Causeway Bay is less than 5 minutes away and the trams are just a bit further. If you have young children and can stretch to a suite then this is a perfect way to experience Hong Kong. The vibrant city is on your doorstep and the exciting harbour makes a perfect backdrop to start and end each day. This is a very good hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaKenya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and thought HK was amazing, it blew my mind, we loved everything about HK. Back to hotel review.... HOTEL We thought the Excelsior was in a fantastic location for shops, MTR etc, check in was really quick, they did try to sell us an upgrade, but we declined and nothing further was mentioned. We went up to our room on the 25th floor, and at first thought room was slightly on the small side, but we were only using the room to catch some sleep, so not overly concerned.It was clean, had a kettle for my morning cuppa and a decent bed for me to have some sleep. Side harbour view was pretty good, but as before, we only seen the view on waking as we were never in room. Room was cleaned every day, we did use the toiletries as we had forgotten toothpaste and this was replenished for us, which we did not expect. Service in Dickens Bar and TOTT was good, drinks pricey but they were all over HK, cannot comment on the food as we never ate in the hotel. Staff at the hotel were polite, helpful and always ready to point us in the right direction as it was my first time to HK, certainly won't be the last. It was a busy hotel, especially with airline staff, but not overcrowded. Only thing I was disappointed with was it was my anniversary and I wanted to buy one of their robes and I could not find the shop to purchase one on our final day, and didn't have time to ask staff on morning we were leaving. But my hubby managed to purchase his HK rugby sevens top.....

Reviews.Title: “No value”
Reviews.Author: AiDa88
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed at a different Excelsior. I asked for a king and got a twin bed room. A hard sell at the front desk to upgrade. The lobbby is like a train station. The rooms are dated and walls as thin as a cheap motel. You hear every bathroom moment your neighbor has. This must be my 50th stay in HK and Kowloon is a much better place and value for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast, OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: amsam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near Causeway Bay. Very close to shops, restaurants, bars and metro station. The room was small as was the bathroom and starting to show its age, that said it was clean and appropriate. The staff are very friendly and attentative to all requests. The breakfast is as good as any full buffet breakfast with incredible choice and freshness. Overall a good hotel with no real issue's.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: parkoSydney
Reviews.Content: I joined my husband for a business trip that was a week long and we upgraded from the business booking to a Deluxe Harbour view with the extras package. What a lovely place to stay! The lovely lounge built in for easy harbour viewing was delightful as were the staff - all very happy to please. Hotel was central for all on Hong Kong Island. I had previously stayed in Kowloon and will have trouble next time deciding where to stay as this hotel was just fabulous but I missed being in Kowloon

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Arbitratorjohn
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonable quality hotel in a central location for a few days en route to New Zealand. We knew this wasn't the best hotel in Hong Kong but we couldnt afford the Mandarin. It was just what we wanted. The harbour view was magnificent. The room was spacious and clean. The public rooms were big and impersonal but fine for what we wanted. Breakfast was a huge international event. The staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: muckyfloor
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior hotel is fabulous place to stay. From the minute you arrive everyone tries to make your stay special. You hear people say oh it really doesn't matter where you stay as your not in the hotel much, well i must say you will want to be in the Excelsior. The room we stayed in was spotless and the bed was to die for. Just what you need after a hard day sight seeing. The service we had was second to none. We would once again like to say a big thankyou for making our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxfordtravelller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location for a tourist wishing to sight see, with the MTR close by (cheap and very easy to use) and right on the doorstep of the shops and restaurants around Causeway Bay. It is also within easy walking distance of Wan Chai. The staff were friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff were the best I have come across. The breakfast was expensive but of a high standard with everything you could think of avaliable. The room was fairly small but the view across Victoria harbour was excellent. The Dickens bar was just right for a night cap and a big hit with my boyfriend since it showed the premiership matches live! If I were to return to Hong Kong (Ihope to since it is an amazing place) I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-Mediocre, left after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: karlos01
Reviews.Content: This is your typical old musty hotel that wants to be 4 or 5 stars but is the US Equivilant of a $80/night Day's Inn plus a Plasma TV and Concierge/Nice Lobby. Everything about it was mediocre, we left after one night went to the less expensive W Hotel which was infinitely more enjoyable. Service was rediculous at the W vs. the barely English speaking concierge and 2 different rooms we had that smelled like smoke at Mandarin Excelsior. Oh and book online if you do go because they try to charge you more than the Website if you show up, we had to haggle over that too.

Reviews.Title: “Heartwarming Service”
Reviews.Author: BBYr
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in Hong Kong and Macau. Before I've even checked in to the hotel, I've already experienced their excellent service. The reason being I wished to watch a particular play in Hong Kong on Xmas day and the by the time I've confirmed my trip it was too late for the tickets to be mailed to my house as it takes 10-15 days for overseas patron. Hence I emailed Excelsior requesting the tickets to be sent to the conceirge and be collected upon my arrival. My request was very promptly attended to and followed up by sending me acknowledgement that the mail has been received. One may think that it is expected of the hotel to provide such personal service; nonetheless I'm still very impressed by their speed and sincerity to serve their guests. Apart from excellent service, this hotel by Mandarin Oriental Group offers great location. Ladies, get ready to shop til you drop as SOGO and Patterson Street is just a 5 mins walk away. World Trade Centre (Shopping again!) is just beside the hotel with Starbucks facing the side entrance of the hotel. But I suggest to stroll down to Jaffe Road for a taste of milk tea in Hong Kong Cafes. There is a 7-11 store very close to the hotel in case you need something *ahem* urgent in the wee hours.. (to fill your hungry stomachs I mean). The nearest MTR exit is also of a very short walking distance. Airport express bus stop for bus A11 (costing only HKD40 per trip to/from airport) is also easily accessible. The hotel is also the only franchise in Hong Kong that sells possibly the best portugese/macanese egg tartlet from Lord Stow's Bakery minus the queue common at Coloane, Macao. Finally I'm coming to the rooms. I've booked a double room with side harbour view; but its not worth the extra price for the side harbour view. Perhaps one should just go for the full harbour view or just the city view. The room is very spacious and human intelligient (at least this is what I feel in comparison to the Venetian @Macao). The bed is not hard where hard beds is a common phenomenon in the SARs and China as other members have reviewed. This is one hotel I'll recommend to people without budget constraint (actually not too expensive either, ~USD160) who prefers to tour Hong Kong Island more than Kowloon/New Terriories.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior for several days in November in a superior side harbour view room. The public areas of this hotel are very well-maintained. My complaint is that there was a very unpleasant, moldy odor in the bathroom of my room, which seeped into the rest of the room, even with the bathroom door closed. Because the room and bathroom *looked* very clean and orderly, I assumed the smell had to do with some problem with the building's structure/plumbing (rather than a problem with that specific room), and I tried to ignore the smell for several days. However, after staying in the room for several days, I finally realized that the foul smell was coming from the shower curtain; I requested that it be changed and the problem was instantly solved. I really have a hard time reconciling how well kept the hotel was in general with how little attention the housekeeping staff seemed to pay to something as simple as asking "what is that smell?" and "what can I do to fix it?" without the hotel guest having to request that the shower curtain be changed. I am also disconcerted by the fact that the shower curtain had that smell when I first checked into the room, suggesting that the towel either had not been changed from an earlier guest, or had not been adequately cleaned between guests. Apart from that not-inconsequential issue, I was generally very impressed by the Excelsior. The location is very convenient in Causeway Bay, less than a 5-minute stroll to the nearest metro subway entrance (and you can take the train, with a transfer, all the way to the airport for much less than the cost of a taxi or private bus ride). The hotel's fitness room was one of the best-equipped of any hotel I have recently visited (unfortunately, the fitness room closed a little earlier than what would have been ideal). The housekeeping staff paid attention to such little details as leaving a separate bookmark to be placed in each of the books that I had left out on the desk! Fresh fruit and bottled water were replenished each afternoon. Rather than telephoning to ask whether turndown service was required, the staff respected the "do not disturb sign" and silently slipped a note under the door indicating that they had stopped by instead. All the staff with whom I interacted from check in through checkout were extremely efficient and gracious. The website description of the room is misleading in that it advertises "these rooms are located on the 14th to the 27th and 33th floors, with partial views of the harbour and offer facilities including internet broadband and multi channel TV," yet the internet access required a separate fee (the multi channel TV did not), and this fee was not disclosed on the website. I have no objection to paying a separate fee for internet access, so long as the the hotel makes that fee very clear when the room is being booked. As for partial harbour view rooms, there was so much fog most days during my stay, and the view of the harbour was so narrow, that the additional premium for a side view of the harbour was probably not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: denise_carlyle2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excelsior for three nights as part of a tour we were doing of Bangkok, Hong Kong, Bali and Singapore. This is a very busy hotel but I suspect all hotels are in Hong Kong. The room was good if a little small and dated. It was clean and served its purpose. You are hardly in your room anyway. The breakfast was fantastic and the TOTT bar was fabulous, if a little pricey. Very good location. I would recommend a visit to the revolving restaurant as a must. Fantastic views and good service. We went as part of an organised trip that included shopping and a cruise round the harbour. The buffet meal was so good we went back to the restaurant again!! Stanley market was good and had the best items. We found Ladies market too busy and the items were not good quality. A visit to the sampans was interesting seeing people live in ramshackle boats alongside the play yachts of the rich!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baxie
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel in Causeway Bay with stunning views from the 1st floor cafe. Rooms are well appointed with comfy beds. The bathroom was fully functional if a little dated. Service in the hotel was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sueidge
Reviews.Content: I booked an airport pickup and from the minute someone met us at the airport we were treated so well! we got water bottles and cold towels in the car, and asked if we wanted music! I'm not used to this sort of thing! A lady met us at the door and took us in, our bags were taken to our room and we were shown where it was. We had a side harbour view room which was very nice. Couldnt fault the hotel. We went to the bar on the 34th floor which is lovely, brilliant views and they had a band on who were amazing!!! People were up dancing, we had a great night, it was a really nice place! Easy to get to the tube and shops. Now the only thing I would say is that it is expensive but you do get what you pay for. And maybe the decor in the rooms should be updated. I would definitely stay again if i could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jim1664
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the excelsior at the end of september 08 and found it to be a good but not great hotel for the price. However it is in a good location at Causeway Bay and the two bars we went in were some of the best hotel bars we have ever been in - the TOTT bar has great views of the light show every evening at 20.00 and the English bar in the basement is fairly authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: UKVisit0rs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for 4 nights (booked via Virgin), and this trip was our first time in Hong Kong. In short, the location is excellent (just a couple of mins from the MTR which is very easy to use), the staff very friendly, and the hotel typical of the Mandarin chain - clean and tidy 4/5 star. We would have no hesitation whatsoever staying there again as we had a great experience. The only downside was the cost of the breakfast which we felt was pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: abstahar
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished rooms make this a good place to stay. My husband used to live in Hong Kong and thought it was a great place to start from. The staff were helpful, we were given champagne on arrival (it was our honeymoon) and a free drink in the downstairs bar. It was a very cool place to relax in the humid Hong Kong heat. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What the Dickens”
Reviews.Author: darwindc
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is in need of a bit of updating in places, but essentially its a good enough hotel, where you won't be overly disappointed unless you are expecting 5 star luxury. The rooms are a bit functional, and the bathrooms small. That said though the hotel doesn't try to be pretentious and the staff are very friendly. The hotel is extremely close to the MTR with good links to all parts of Hong Kong from Causeway Station. There is, however, one good reason to stay at the Excelsior, and that is Dickens Bar in the basement. This is a Brit style sports bar and one of the best hotel bars I've come across. Its so good that it doesn't seem like a hotel bar - indeed many of the clientelle were ex-pat locals. The service is fanstastic, the range of beers amazing, and the food is good quality pub-grub that seems to be on your table as soon as you've finished giving your order.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Experience”
Reviews.Author: tripkaki
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at Excelsior through their website which as offering a special promotion (Pay 2 nights, get 3 nights) for the Deluxe Harbour View Room. Check-in was fast & seamless. Room size considered good by Hong Kong standards and the view from the room was excellent. However, we were given a room on the top floor, just below the bar/pub (TOTT) & being the weekend, we could hear the band playing until 2am. It wasn't a problem for us since we was not ready to sleep until pass 2 but it could be a problem for early sleepers. Full toiletries offered and diligently replenished every day. Good location with a 7-Eleven right by its side, MTR station & lots of shops & good food nearby. Friendly staff also granted us a generous late check-out at 3pm with no extra charge. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “great for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: LISAG2323
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior in Causeway Bay was an excellent choice for this family of four. My husband & kids had not been to Hong Kong before and the Excelsior was perfectly located to be our launchpad. We had two adjoining rooms which were very large by Hong Kong standards, the beds were extremely comfortabe and the staff were very helpful. The first morning we had the buffet breakfast which was outstanding. We also had dinner in the Cantonese restaurant one night and were very pleasantly surprised by probably our best Canonese meal of the trip!!! Very good value, but ensure you book a harbour view as the view the other way is a bit grim.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.. Rubbish Suite”
Reviews.Author: Perspective
Reviews.Content: Hello, stayed here for one night living in the most expensive suite ... the cateogry below presdential suite... The suite is rubbish... dirty torn toilet and rooms.. the suite was quite big around 950 square foot.. service is excellent.. but the suite was really really rubbish.. harbour view was very nice... IF they renovate all the rooms then this place is excellent to stay but till now... dont stay there.. unless you want good service and just a place to sleep because most of your time is exploring then come here... the location of course is perfect... in the busy causeway bay life...

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: aufcno1
Reviews.Content: Hotel This hotel was simply superb, its very modern, very clean with outstanding customer service. We upgraded to deluxe full harbour view and it was well worth it. The staff are very helpful and made us feel special. It has several resturants and the one on the top floor is simply fantastic, beautifully decorated with great views, not to mention the wonderful staff and menu. Location Superb right in the centre of Hong Kong close to fantastic shopping and only a short subway to anywhere else you would like to visit. Overall Hong Kong is a fantastic place to visit everyone was friendly and helpful. The cleanliness of the whole Island is exceptional . I would certainly come back to this hotel as it is one of the best I have ever stayed in/.

Reviews.Title: “does exactly what you expect without fuss”
Reviews.Author: noonie
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location for shops, metro and getting around HK island generally. The Causeway Bay area its in is very safe with plenty to do around and about. The hotel is failry old and dated now, with huge turnover of guests and a very slick check-in / out process accordingly. Rooms are fairly small, as are the bathrooms, but all clean and tidy and no real issues (just faded elegance). The basement bar / British pub is very cosy and the TOTTS restaurant at the top has a brilliant champagne buffet lunch on Sundays. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable, however don't expect to be wowed by the rooms...then again who wants to stay in a room too long when you are in HK!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: norwichguys
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was recommended by friends as we were not generally disappointed. Upon checking in and going to our room it was large, clean and comfortable but did not have the harbour view we were expecting. So we went back to reception and they gave us a room with a great view but it was smaller: still very clean and comfortable with all you needed though. The staff were all very helpful, the facilities in the hotel were all very accessible and food/drink was reasonably priced and of good quality. The breakfast service was excellent. Location-wise the hotel was in a great position, near public transport links and shopping and eateries but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of down-town HK. It is not cheap, but it is probably worth it. The hotel also arranges a pick-up/drop-off service at the airport which is very good. All-together a great place to stay for a short break in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: unclescooby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days recently for a break in Hong Kong. The thing that sets this hotel apart from any other is the location - we had a deluxe harbour view room and we could see all of Kowloon plus all of Hong Kong Island Harbour, the Noon Day Gun and the Peak all at once - brilliant! The room was huge and had everything you could wish for and also the hotel was right by Causeway Bay MTR station and within a few seconds walk of Causeway Bay shopping so very convenient. We tried room service one night which was excellent value for money, we went to the Dickens Sports Bar on the ground floor and we also went to the TOTT bar on the top floor of the hotel which for the views alone you must visit. I wouldnt hesitate to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - perfect for a stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: NGarrity
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is the perfect complement to this vibrant city. The public areas have a buzz about them with a mixture of business travellers and tourists supported by enthusiastic and very efficient hotel staff. The rooms, although not huge, are well designed and very comfortable. The Executive Lounge is very useful if you pay the extra for the rooms in that part of the hotel - and is a calming antidote to the bustle of the city - with has fantastic views. The rates here are good value for what you get. This is the only hotel I've stayed at in Hong Kong so I don't have a benchmark, but given the positive experience I've had here, I'm not inclined to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel In A Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior Hotel for 5 nights and were more than happy with the hotel and its environs. I think we would have been happy anywhere in Hong Kong, as the first impressions of this amazing city almost made the actual hotel accommodation irrelevant. After a 12 hour non-stop flight from the UK, we finally arrived at the Excelsior a little after 2:00pm and checked into our 10th floor room. We had a side-harbour facing room but even so, the views were simply stunning looking over Victoria Harbour towards Kowloon. We caught a couple of hours sleep and awoke to find the whole of Kowloon twinkling in the darkness - absolutely magical. The room was comfortable, if a little shabby. We were booked on a room-only basis and didn't bother with breakfast on any of the five mornings. We also didn't eat dinner in the hotel as it was far too expensive for our budget. The Excelsior is in a wonderful position on Hong Kong Island. Causeway Bay is lively and bustling, full of open air markets and close to the trams and Star Ferry Terminal. We found plenty of affordable restaurants close by and wore ourselves out every day walking practically everywhere. Apart from the obligatory tour up the to the Peak, we also visited the floating restaurants, took a trip to Lamma Island, walked around Happy Valley, visited Stanley Market via Repulse Bay and wandered around the shops and markets off Nathan Road. I would lovel to revisit Hong Kong at some stage, but would probably try to book into a more affordable hotel with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Water Views”
Reviews.Author: RoamingSeattleite
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior for four nights on a business trip. Overall, the hotel was very pleasant with courteous service. My room was a harbor view room on the 14th floor. The furniture consisted mostly of built-ins and could have used some updating, but was quite clean. There was a minibar/fridge in the rooom, as well as a decent workspace, a smallish TV and a roomy closet. The bathroom was small, but clean. The buffet breakfast was slightly pricey (about HKD 200) but very good, with a variety of Western, Chinese and Japanese choices, and really tasty baked products. Again, the service was excellent. I also ordered a Western dinner from room service and found it to be really tasty, and quite reasonably priced. The hotel gym was compact, but surprisingly well equipped. My only quibble is that it didn't open until about 9 on Sunday, and I was hoping to use the chance to exercise to fight off jet lag. The location is great, right near the water at Admiralty. The MTR (subway) station is only a couple of blocks away, and the area is a major shopping district, with quite a few good restaurants just across the street in the World Trade Center shopping complex. I found the Excelsior to be a fine choice for my trip, and would consider it again for another trip, either for business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AsHlLoYdTaYlOr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hong Kong a couple of times as a backpacker and as a traveler who likes a little more comfort these days. The island is where it all happens and the hotel is in the best district "Causeway" right on the water front. The tube is around the corner and gets you to central in 5 mins where you can get a ferry to other islands or to the mainland. I did not eat in the hotel apart from the bar under the reception area where you can get a light snack or a full meal and i have no complaints. The rooms are a little small but you spend so little time in them it does not matter.The staff are great and the decor is simple but tastefull. The view on the harbour front rooms is amazing and must be one of the best on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times.”
Reviews.Author: Tomythewho
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years and The Excelsior moves like a well-oiled machine. It is a large hotel in a busy part of town with several restaurants. The lobby has a high volume of foot traffic, but congestion is never a problem. I have always found the service to be outstanding, after all the Excelsior is now run by Mandarin Oriental. The restaurants are appealing. The location makes travelling anywhere in the city incredibly convenient. My partner and I think of the Excelsior as our 'home away from home' and always look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: SalBhead
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We chose a harbour deluxe room and it is well worth it for the views of the harbour and the skyline from both sides. Entertainment in itself. The staff are friendly and the room had everything you needed for your stay and was immaculately clean. We stayed 9 nights. Room service was a luxury but affordable and you really have to have breakfast in your room overlooking the harbour. Lots of nice little touches like postcards of the views, a daily morning paper and sweets in a replica Excelsior hotel tin!!This is a great area for shopping and eating and it is only 5 minutes walk to the MTR. The hotel restaurants are great as well and there is an English pub (with weekly pub quiz) for those of you missing home. Great for families and it is really safe around. You overlook the noonday gun. You can walk to the star ferry in about 15 minutes. Victoria Park is also a short walk. Really glad we stayed on Hong Kong island and not Kowloon as the night life is on the HK side.

Reviews.Title: “The Convenience Factor”
Reviews.Author: atlas1059
Reviews.Content: The Convenience Factor I’ve been to Hong Kong more times than I can count, so I’m quite familiar with the roads, so if you are looking for a hotel with convenience, The Excelsior is one of them. It’s not spectacular…actually, it’s far from it, but if you are looking for a hotel in the center of a bustling location, then Excelsior would pretty much fit that profile. The Arrival. Upon check in, we were told that the Club Level Non-Smoking Twin One Bedroom Suite did not exist, even though we were able to book it. The one bedroom suites only came with a king bed and only existed on a smoking level floor. Anyway, to make a long story short, we chose to go with the Club Level 1 Bedroom Suite on the Smoking level. They offered to push the two twin beds (that made up the King bed) as far apart as possible…which was about a foot. Oddly enough, I read on someone else’s review that they found themselves in the same predicament. Anyway, since we opted for the Club Level One Bedroom Suite, a full buffet breakfast, light lunch, and afternoon tea and cocktails were included. There was also complimentary bottle of wine, a large box of chocolates, fresh fruit, and Chinese tea upon our arrival. The Room. Tired and haggard would be a good term for the room. There were open electrical lines, ajar windows that couldn’t close, peeling wallpaper, a not so cleanly toilet and very battered furniture. From afar, it was a very basic room, but when you actually start to sit and actually use the facilities, you’ll find that it is high time The Excelsior goes through a major renovation. Please see pictures and decide for yourself. Let’s just say it wasn’t worth what we paid. Oh yeah. I almost forgot. The in-room safe was unbolted to the floor. Technically, I could pick it up and walk away with it. The Service. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. A trait that I was a bit surprised at since service and helpfulness are often not part of the “vocabulary” in Hong Kong. Most people could care less about what you wanted and care even less about trying to helping you out. The Dining. We only ate our complimentary breakfast buffet at the hotel and that was…uh…how should I put this nicely…not so great. But breakfast was breakfast and if you just stuck to the basics: an egg, a piece of toast, and orange juice, then everything was OK. Let’s just say it was wonderful to have a Starbucks across the street. The Departure. Check out was pretty normal. Everyone was courteous and professional. Hindsight, I think I could have done without all the complimentary gifts and amenities and preferred the same room at a more reasonable rate. The room rate was about HK$5000/night (approximately US$625/night). Honestly, I wouldn’t stay there again since Park Lane is right next door. Between the Park Lane and The Excelsior, Park Lane wins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doydy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 3 nights and it was great. Location is good as its near the MTR, Starbuck is just across the street at WTC. Time Square is just a few minutes walk too. There's also a 7-11 nearby for those who wants to save on water instead of buying it in the hotel. Staff are friendly too. The only downside is that the bed they gave us is 2 single bed joined together instead of 1 queen size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good functional rooms despite ‘Bus Stop’ lobby”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: My review is based on having stayed here over 12 times. Excellent location in Causeway Bay near shopping and subway. The unpleasant, noisy, always crowded lobby is frequented by flight crews who have their own check-in desk. Once you get through the lobby, however, the upstairs hallways are quiet and rooms are fairly well soundproofed. Rooms are small but very functional and comfortable, and have all essential amenities. Some have harbor views but that costs extra. Satellite TV includes CNBC and USA Fox News, but not HBO. Internet, which should be free, is HK$ 130 per day. The hotel will provide a free Herald Tribune newspaper daily on request. For meals, avoid the noisy coffee shop which lacks its own room and is crowded into hallways and aisles on the second floor. For breakfast I usually bring in much better coffee and fresh juice at less than half the price from the Starbuck’s immediately next door. An even better Pacific Coffee Company is located 8 mins walk away in Windsor House shopping center. For other meals, the hotel’s room service selection and quality are very good. Service is efficient but mechanical, as is usual in Hong Kong. Comparing Excelsior to the other standard business hotel neaby, Park Lane: Park Lane has larger rooms and a much quieter lobby, but Excelsior has much better room service selection and quality. Therefore if given a choice, I’d still prefer Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great”
Reviews.Author: samandjet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from CXHolidays and was kind of a last minute trip. Hotel is in a great location and I received an upgrade to Deluxe Horbour View Room on the 12th floor. The room is clean, decor is a bit old style. But I am impressed how clean this old hotel is, the bathroom, the carpet and everything. Bedding is not as great as other Mandarin Oriental for sure, but still a great 4-star hotel quality. The EXpress on the lobby floor has the best egg tart in HK!! Will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel in interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ML13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located next to the World Trade Center in a very vibrant neighborhood of restaurants and shopping malls, frequented by locals and travelers. Underground access to the Noon Day Gun, and near Victoria Park. Close to metros and trams. Staff is friendly and helpful. Good variety of dining options in hotel. The Chinese restaurant was excellent, but expensive. There is a British pub on lower level. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: Green26
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Terrific location. Very good and friendly service. While it is true the hotel décor is a bit tired, and it is not a fancy hotel, it is well-kept and clean and seemingly well-run. By the way, we don’t agree with most of the criticisms in prior reviews, except for the small/old tv's. Comfortable beds, nice shower, good air conditioning. The size of our deluxe harbor view room was fine (and larger than many European hotels) and a very nice view. The bathroom and tub/shower were on the smaller side but not tiny. Service at the desk, front door, restaurant (floor 1, breakfast) and lobby area was very good. The concierge desk was helpful and good, and always had multiple people working. Our longest wait for concierge assistance was a minute or so. Taxicabs were always available, and the wait, if any, was never longer than a couple of minutes. The hotel is located across a main and busy street from the bay and Noon Day Gun, a minute or so walk from Victoria Park, and near the entrance to the tunnel to Kowloon (thus relatively easy for cabs to and from the airport and Kowloon). The restaurant/buffet on floor 1 is nice. The breakfast buffet is terrific and large, with views of the bay. it was about U.S. $25, including the 10% service charge, . The coffee/muffin/fruit café by the elevators is handy. Starbucks is steps away out the side door, on the ground floor of the adjacent World Trade Center. Dickens pub, downstairs, is nice. The hotel is adjacent to a bustling and bright (and large) shopping and restaurant area. This busy area is steps away out the side door and towards the back of the hotel. The World Trade Center is next to the hotel and literally steps away. The World Trade Center has floors of nice shops and good restaurants. We ate at good Vietnamese (Rice Paper about floor 4) and Korean BBQ (maybe floor 12) restaurants. The MTR/Causeway Bay is a few minutes away, on Hennessy near the Sojo department store. Times Square, the very nice multi-story shopping mall, is a 5-10 minute walk away. It has very good restaurants in the top floors. We purchased inexpensive cell phones (368HK) and local SIM cards at one of the many telephone stores on Yee Wo street (a couple blocks from the hotel). Very handy for keeping in touch with our group and friends. Useable on other foreign trips, with the purchase of a local SIM card. We were in Hong Kong for a week for the rugby 7’s. We would stay at this hotel again, primarily because of the location and friendly and good service. Our two prior stays were at the more expensive Shangri-La (which is a great hotel, but in our view, not as good of a location). If you want a fancy hotel, don't stay here. If you want a good hotel with a terrrific location, consider this one. Jack and Molly Manning, Missoula, Montana, USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base to Explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: HilGray
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Excelsior prior to boarding a ship for a Far East cruise. Check in was quick and efficient. The lobby area isn't that big but all you need. The room wasn't that big but perfectly adequate for one night. Good comfortable bed and nice bathroom. We had breakfast served in the room. The Japanese breakfast was lovely as was the traditional one. The hotel is well situated to explore Hong Kong and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Probaly the best value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: lostineconomy
Reviews.Content: I have found my new Home when on business trips in Asia. The Excelsior in Causeway bay is Rock solid, it has a great location, friendly staff, & fantastic Breakfast buffet & Dickens Sports Bar is probably the best hotel Bar I have ever been in ! The rooms are clean & well appointed & most of all the beds, pillows are super comfortable. You can just walk right in to the shopping buzz of causeway bay on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - very good in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Mirry
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 night stay while returning to the UK from Oz, we had also stayed in Singapore on the way over so were really looking forward to the hotel and Hong Kong. Upon arriving we upgraded to the executive floor but were a little surprised at the size of the room! Although comfortable and very clean it was very small - but the service and exec lounge access made up for this. The best things we found about the hotel were the level of service, range of restaurants, the quality of the room service (food great!!!) and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Although we are fairly well travelled we still found Hong Kong a very unusual place to stay. Be prepared for the smog/pollution, grumpy but cheap taxi drivers and the anti-climax when you reach some of the tourist attractions. Best thing about HK is definately the shopping - visit all the malls and markets to experience the full effect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lpw54
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great and although parts of the hotel and rooms look a little dated, I would gladly stay here again! I also want to make special mention of the fact that I left my journal, which I've had for 15 years, in the room after I had checked out and didn't even know about it until I received an email from the hotel's housekeeping service that it had been found! They subsequently sent it back to me by registered mail! That is outstanding service and I am forever grateful for this kind act as my journal is invaluable and impossible to replace. Kudos to the hotel's staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Scawby
Reviews.Content: Good size of room even though it was not big (same like all hotels in Hong Kong), but spacious enough for 2 people. Good location right on the harbour. However, as we have had experienced with Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group, this one was a bit far from their standard...not too bad, but not quite in a group. The small details like quality of bath towel was very thin and not good enough, slippers looked cheap quality and no spare toilet rolls in the bathroom, windows looked very dirty, fixture seemed worn out and old. However, the overall was ok for money and location. Be ware of surcharge in the restaurant in World Trade Center. We had Chinese Food at King Dragon Restaurant there on the last night. Food was cheap, service was slow and staff seemed so busy...cannot speak fluent English. They always had headphone or walkie-talkie in their ears and had to ask us to wait and stopped ordering food while the waitress had to take a call first. Can you believe it? The bill came with surcharge of "room with a view" charge £5 per head in total 6 of us we paid £30 only for a "sit-down with a view"...food and drink was only £24. Nobody informed this surcharge and we did not see it anywhere. Quite annoying, but never mind.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an overnight stop to Australia. We booked it as it is part of the Mandarin Oriental group and we have had excellent experiences at other MO hotels. Sadly the rooms are ridiculously small - our room, despite being "Executive", was not big enough to have a proper door to the ensuite bathroom and had a sliding door instead which was about 4 inches from the side of the bed! The room was disappointing, but the staff were very helpful and check-in / out was efficient and breakfast in the exec lounge was nice enough. On the whole I would recommend the Sheraton in Kowloon as a better mid-price option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luvlie
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, as it is near Fashion Walk, Sogo and Times Square. Also very near the MTR. Hence, extremely convenient. Hotel staff are polite and welcoming. Drivers of the airport coaches are nice and friendly as well. There's a nice little tea break place next to the elevators at the ground floor called Illy which serve excellent egg tarts. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and spacious enough. Comes with free bottles of water, bedroom slippers and a safe, which to me, are some of the little things I need in a hotel room for a comfortable stay. Highly recommend the hotel for anyone visiting Hong Kong. I definitely would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of Hong Kong Harbour”
Reviews.Author: sean_e78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, and loved the hotel and location. Get a harbour view room when checking in. The hotel is very close to the subway, and right in the shopping district. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not more than that”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: The very best breakfast buffet I have seen for a long time is always a good start of the day, and Excelsior delivers just that. The room I got (1501) was a corner room with a full harbour view – very nice! Unlike many other HK rooms this was spacey, mostly because of the corner position that actually wastes some space for an in-room corridor in stead of enlarging the room. The couch at the window is a nice touch but too small to be really good. Prices for internet are hilarious and not fair at any account. The room was cold with no heating available, so temperature seldom rose to more than 19C – even in late January when out door temperatures went as low as 10C during the night, this is not OK. Value for money is not high enough, the rooms seem a bit worn down, the TV must have been bought in the 1980’s, but location in the middle of Causeway Bay is definitely great. Would I stay here again? Not really – I was a bit disappointed and hope that other M.O.s are better.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Whitewallscuba
Reviews.Content: I travel alot, and was meeting my brother in HK for a few days. I normally stay in the Grand Hyatt or the Penisula - but I thought I would downgrade a star and stay at the Excelsior. It was more like downgrading 3 stars though!! Location is pretty good, but as soon as we checked in - the receptionist tried to hard sell an upgrade to the executive floor. When I declined - my originally booked rooms were not available (suprise suprise) - and I was forced to sleep in a single room - when I had booked a deluxe king! I then had to change rooms the next day. They tried to do the same with my brother but after pointing out at 6ft 6 a single bed is hardly feasible - they found a new room for him. (But it later transpires a downgraded room at the same price). When we checked out the doorman ignored us - as we didn't want a taxi. The halliburton luggage should have given away the fact I travel all the time - but given I had comfy travel clothes on - I obviously wasn't worth spending any time being polite too. How different from Cathay First Class lounge later that day - who didn't seem to care I didn't have a suit on ! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone - its full of airline crew and long stay guests - so if you are neither of those don't expect much level of service. I'm actually shocked this is part of the MO group. I personally would be embarrased to be associated with this hotel! The public room as pretty dark and dismal - and I spotted more than one lady of the night in the elevator - being over friendly with her client. The entrance road is too tiny - so using the side entrance you have a reasonable chance of being almost knocked down by the coaches and delivery vehichles - so keep hold of your loved ones!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: frankaUK
Reviews.Content: Good location on Causeway Bay (direct access to shops). Harbour view room was definitely worth the extra. Service was impeccable, and staff genuinely friendly. Excellent room service at reasonable charge. Very high standard of cleanliness. We were made to feel welcome and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Julie-AnnFrost
Reviews.Content: British Airways use this hotel for their crew and a friend had recomended it to us. The good service started as soon as we arrived in the taxi with a friendly welcome from the bell boys. The lobby was bright and check in was again friendly, unfortnatley our room was not ready despite it being 5.00pm but we were offered a complimentary drink in The Dickens Bar. After only 30mins we were told our room was ready. The room was quite large by HK standards, was clean and well appointed. After being in the room for only around 20 minutes a complimentary bottle of wine was bought up to us as way of an apology for the room not being ready when we arrived. We both thought that this was a lovely touch and showed that the hotel did really care about its guests, later a letter of apology was received from the front desk Manager. It was my husbands birthday whilst we were there and he displayed his birthday cards on the side, when we came back from our day out their was a card on the tv from the Management of the Excelsior - just another small touch which shows their attention to detail! Each night housekeeping came in and turned down the bed and replenished any consumables coffee etc. Fresh fruit was put in the room each day and a free newspaper was delivered too - the hotel really did do all it could to make a difference. We ate in the Cafe on the 1st a buffett restaurant with a great choice of everything, the food was also replinished often keeping it fresh and not over cooked. Again the Manager Mo went out of his way to make sure everyone was OK. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the location of Causeway Bay is fantastic and connections by MTR and Star Ferry and easily accessible

Reviews.Title: “Great top level bar”
Reviews.Author: Marvelle
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a GREAT bar on the top floor (think Park H yatt in Tokyo from Lost in Translation). While the views from Kowloon looking at Hong Kong are always nicer, this bar has an awesome panorama view of Victoria Harbour. I had a partial harbour view and still had a great view. The only drawback is that Causeway Bay is pretty lame for single travelers. It is, however, a quick cab ride along the coast to Wan Chai and Lan Kwai Fong (and Victoria Peak). All in all, I'm really glad I stayed here and very much enjoyed the top floor bar after a 16 hour flight from New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Harbourview Room”
Reviews.Author: Ismail_NewYork
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels I stayed at during my recent two-week trip to Hong Kong was the Excelsior Hong Kong in Causeway Bay. I've known about this hotel for a long time but have never stayed there on any of my prior trips in the past 10 years. I'm glad I finally found my way here. The hotel is quite elegant and the harbourview room I booked definitely met my expectation in terms of decor, size, and view. When I first booked the room, I was sort of afraid that the hotel room would be quite small. It turned out to be pretty large by Hong Kong's standard. The room I stayed in was 2808. I had a King size bed that was very comfortable. The room had a very good view of Victoria Harbour and Tsim Tsa Tsui, Kowloon. The bathroom could be a little bit larger and grander, but it was suitable. One suggestion is that they change the lighting to be more warm and match the lighting in the room. If I remember correctly, florescent lighting was used and I always feel that florescent lighting is a bit dull and lackluster. I love the seats they have by the window. Allows for one to relax and enjoy the view or lounge a little bit. A negative I would point out is the TV. It's very small. They need to upgrade the TV to at least a 32" flat panel like the other two hotels I stayed at during this trip. It looks so out of sort to have a small TV in such a large and elegant room. Also, they need to improve their menu system. For some reason they did not have the option for you to review your invoice on the TV. The only two menu options were movies and changing the language. The internet service cost $130HKD (or around there) per 24 hour usage. It's not the best rate, but reasonable. The most I ever paid for 24-hour use of internet service was at the Hilton Park Hotel in Munich, Germany where it cost close to $40 USD. That was outrageous. Anyways, getting back to the Excelsior, the gym was a decent size and also had a lot of new machines. The location of the hotel is good and bad. It's good because it's about 2 blocks from the Causeway Bay MTR entrance (exit D, I believe), which is right below the Sogo department store. There are a lot of shops and restaurants about a block or two away. The 7-11 was a block away. Convenience-wise, the location of the hotel was excellent. Now, of course, being that it's located in Causeway Bay, the area is just too crowded. When you go back to the hotel between late morning and the evening, you must maneuver through a sea of people. I also noticed that there's a lot of smokers in Hong Kong during this trip, and they must have identified the area around the hotel as the camping grounds for smoking. It was just not a good experience for those of us who want some fresher air, even in an already smoggy Causeway Bay area. Finally, to get into the hotel, you are usually walking through the back of the building. With the amount of tourists that use this passageway, I would recommend the hotel make the area a bit more colorful and appealing. Add some murals or something to make the walk more pleasing. Despite my recommendations and negative comments, I would still definitely stay at the Excelsior next time I go there.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excelsior for 3 nights after a 3 week trip to Australia. The staff were friendly and the hotel is in a good location for shops and transport but it is in serious need of refurbishment. On arrival we were told there were no double rooms as we had reserved and so were given a twin room with 2 single beds in it which we were not very happy about. Our room smelt really badly of damp and almost took your breath away when first walking in. The breakfasts however were amazing as you get such a wide variety from the buffet. Also the Dickens Bar in the basement was very friendly and the newly refurbished TOTS bar at the top of the hotel was very nice with good views in the evening and live bands playing. All in all I really didn’t like Hong Kong it was smelly and dirty (I constantly had to have my hand over my mouth and nose to protect it from the smells of sewage) and the people very rude. There isn’t that much to do there and because of all the pollution it is constantly covered in gray depressing smog/cloud. We stopped off in Singapore the previous year and much preferred this as a stop over by miles.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel - As good as ever”
Reviews.Author: SUPERNELLO
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Excelsior for the 1st time for 3 years we realised that it's still our favourite upper-mid range hotel in Hong Kong. It's brilliant location at Causeway Bay next to the shops & MTR station & across the road from the Noon Day Gun is unbeatable. The service is still first class. A pre-booked trip with the concierge had been arranged for us and was confirmed on arrival (at 01.00 am!).The in-room breakfast is good value & although the rooms are a little dated, the side harbour view of Kowloon & The Convention Centre was spectacular & more than made up for the decor. We love Hong Kong (most exciting city in the world) & we love The Excelsior too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Fantokyo
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel if you are on business and need a clean hotel at a more reasonable rate than Mandarin, Four Seasons etc Rooms are not spacious but not cramped either. Service is good but check-in can be very busy at times. Arriving by taxi you have to wait in many cases since the area is very cramped with cars and the taxis are not allowed to stop on the road outside of the hotel Views. If you are a tourist in HK, ask for rooms with a view. Many of the rooms are facing directly into the building next door(just a couple of meters) with no view whatsoever. Since I go to HK frequently this is of no sigificance for me but I can imagine it being a disappointment for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrisMalaysia
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 7 nights (8th Oct - 14th Oct 2007) in an Executive Suite. I would say my overall experience was good. I am impressed with the room size, cleanliness, amenities and the view. I felt comfortable, relax and always look forward to coming back to the room after a long day outside. It was excellent. The only negative comment I have is regarding the daily fruit basket that was in my room. The first 2 days was good in terms of quantity, variety and presentation. After that the fruits delivered to my room is not in its basket anymore. The quantity and variety is not there. The fruit was just "chuck" on a tray and one day there was no knife given! I called to complain on the knife. The next day, the presentation is back. Phew! One last comment is for the reservation personnel. They are really efficient in answering all my emails. Good work! Finally, if I ever come back to Hong Kong....I will definitely stay here. Keep up the good work...Excelsior!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kissyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in an executive harbour view room. I recommend paying the extra for the executive floors as you get some nice touches in the room and the breakfast choice which is included in the price is great. After a few sleepless night due to - how do I put this - noisy neighbours, the manager happily moved us to another room in the middle of the night. There was no question of making us wait until the morning, he gave us the key to the new room and sent a bellboy to collect our belongings and bring them to the new room in the morning. It was very appreciated! The staff were very helpful, we encountered one or two whose English wasn't as good as the others, but my Chinese is virtually non existent so that isn't a complaint, just a comment. Even so, with hand gestures and a pen and paper the language barrier was no problem. The hotel is right next to Causeway Bay MTR station. We were apprehensive about using the MTR because of the crowds of people and everyone sems to be in a rush, but you should give it a go because it's a real experience. It is easy to buy tickets, recharge an Octopus Card and find your way around the stations. All are very clearly sign posted in English. It is also very cheap and saves your feet if, like us, you plan to do a lot of sightseeing. We tried the Chinese, Italian, ToTT's and Dickens Bar for food.
