Dickens bar wasn't to my taste, but hubby wanted to watch cricket. ToTT's is great. Ask for a table near the window as you can look out over the harbour. It's a real treat. The Chinese was lovely as was the Italian. Also try the Macau custard tarts from the coffee shop. One of the hotel doors leads into a small shopping centre. The local area is enchanting at night. We stayed in Kowloon on our first visit to Hong Kong and to walk through the busy streets of Causeway Bay with the neon signs and the noise is something I will never forget. Winterfest was on during our stay. I never imagined Hong Kong would be so festive! We had room service a couple of times which was very prompt and the food was good. We would return to the Excelsior if it weren't for the huge choice of hotels in Hong Kong of which we feel the need to try a few more before returning. We're going for the Intercontinental Hong Kong in 2 weeks, but I wouldn't hesitate to use the Excelsior again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: patissier
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at Excelsior. I was happy with the hotel given the good rate that I managed to get (<HKD900/nite, no breakfast). Location at Causeway Bay was fantastic. It is served by the Airport Express shuttle buses. It is also only a couple of mins walk to the MTR, and there's lots of shopping and food in the vicinity. Location is important in Hong Kong, because you tend to walk/shop a lot, and it's so convenient that you always go back to the hotel to rest whenever you are tired. I stayed at Hotel Renaissance previously - though I have no complains about the hotel, I need to walk a good 10-15mins from the MTR to return to the hotel. The rooms are of decent size and clean. Essentials such as daily newspapers and toiletries (except hair conditioner) are provided. The only slight problem was that the rooms were not very sound-proof (I had a connecting room and could hear some noises from the next room). The Expresso cafe at the hotel serves Illy coffee and very delicious portugese egg tarts (check them out at [--]). There is a Fitness First Platinum located within the hotel. Use of the fitness club is free for hotel guests, and you only need to pay a nominal amount (i think it was HKD50 thereabouts) if you want to join their classes (eg yoga). Overall, I am pleased with the hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Plush”
Reviews.Author: Traveller23456
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location. It overlooks the harbour, which is nice, but we wouldn't necessarily pay the extra for this feature again (although it is nice at nighttime). At the back of the hotel is the main shopping district which was great and the MTR (tube station) is right next to the hotel which is handy. The room and facilities at the hotel are really good - gym especially was a bonus, although there is no pool. We were a little disapointed breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room - and for the price you pay i would expect this usually. A cafe in the shopping mall opposite was fine though. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. We opted to get the shuttle bus to and from the airport - we found that this was the cheapest option and the most hassle free as it is door to door. The staff were quick and efficient at booking the shuttle and it arrived on time. We felt it a good sign when a coach load of cabin crew from a national airline turned up and checked into the same hotel (separate check in desk to avoid long queues). The airline obviously has a choice and choose to repeat its custom with Excelsior

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient Hotel for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times...Decent location with all of the Causeway Bay shopping behind the hotel without the hustling that you find in Tsim Sha Tsui...But the MTR station is a 2-min walk, connecting you to the rest of Hong Kong/Kowloon in just a few minutes. Clean, comfortable rooms with a good staff. The Italian restaurant in the hotel has decent food. Executive floor rooms offer a decent breakfast and great 'cocktail hour' with hot appetizers and a staff that really makes you feel welcome and seems to cater to your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good service.”
Reviews.Author: jonatey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay at The Excelsior in Hong Kong as part of our our of the far east. The hotel is very nice with good facilities including a gym and a number of restaurants. The reception staff were nice and helpful. The decor in the rooms was a bit dated but the rooms were clean and well stocked. I also found the air conditioning was a little too powerful for my liking. It has good links to the shopping districts and tourist areas. A good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nicholasdamian
Reviews.Content: Staying in Excelsior is all about location. It is located in Causeway Bay, just minutes from MTR (subway station), Sogo, Times Square and the shopping that you can get. You don't have to go to the Kowloon side or Mongkok to buy electronics etc because you can get the same things in Causeway Bay area too. As for the hotel, staff were very friendly. I didn't check the gym area since I was there for shopping and walking around HK the whole day constitutes a work out already. As for the size of the room, well let's just say that space is pretty tight in HK so unless you can upgrade to a suite then I guess you have to choose either between a good location or comfort living. Well, if you miss out this lively city then it's a pity to stay in the hotel too long. Anyway, nice hotel to live, friendly staff and can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “The Excelsior Lived Up to Its Name”
Reviews.Author: GoJeannie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to China and the standout hotel out of the three we stayed at during our trip was the Excelsior in Hong Kong. What set it apart was the courteous staff, the excellent amenities and most of all, the convenient location of the hotel. The Excelsior is located on Hong Kong Island in an area called Causeway Bay, it is the epicenter of shopping, great dining and nightlife. It is also very conveniently located near an MTR station, Kong Kong's subway system. What truly makes the hotel excellent is the way the staff will go out of their way to make you comfortable. A great example is our check in process. We arrived on an early morning flight -- about 5:30am. By the time we got through customs and immigration and arrived at the hotel, it was not later than 7am. Check in is not until 3pm. We prepared ourselves to check our luggage at the bell desk and wait until we had rooms so we could get some rest after our long overseas flight. When we arrived at the lobby desk we gave our check in information to the friendly English-speaking employee and were checked in immediately -- no questions asked. We were handed hotel room keys and within no time at all were resting quite comfortably in our room before 7:30am! All staff that we encountered spoke English to some degree. This greatly helped us ease into our transition while staying in a foreign country. The breakfast buffet they offer is a little pricey, but worth it! For those of us missing a western-style breakfast, their offerings were exactly what we needed to help us get over our chinese-cuisine overload! It had eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, fresh fruit and french press coffee, all the comforts of home and it also had items from a traditional Chinese and Japanese breakfast. Top that all off with a fresh squeeze juice bar and you've got a world class treat! The Excelsior Hotel has a walkway into the shopping mall next door called The World Trade Centre where you can find small boutiques and great restaurants and even a video game arcade to entertain the kids or in our case, the kid in us all. If I have one complaint about the Excelsior, it would be the size of the rooms. We had a double room for two people and it had two twin sized beds crammed into a small space with a small seating area. The bathroom is a normal size with only one sink. The deluxe rooms may have been bigger, but you can see from the pictures that there is no wasted space in this room! Our view of the Victoria Harbor was worth the size of the room, however! To sum up, I would highly recommend the Excelsior Hotel to anyone vacationing to Hong Kong, especially if it is your first time in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for... a good value in HK, not much else”
Reviews.Author: UESyorkie
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a good value hotel; you can get to "downtown" HK island and Kowloon easily by bus or subway, as well as hop on a bus to go to the beaches, etc. on the other side of the island. However, it is a far cry from the Mandarin Oriental "standards" I've experienced (not that I expected it to be on par with The Oriental in Bangkok, but come on), despite the fact that it is owned by the group. The room was reminiscent of an old Howard Johnson or Motel 6. I did like the British-style pub downstairs, which made me a little homesick for western creature comforts such as good french fries (they were great at the pub), as I was on the tail-end of my sightseeing / gastronomic tour of SE Asia. However, I have to say that I would not stay at this property again if (when!) I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: MalByrne
Reviews.Content: We stayed the 26th of June ’07 to the 29thth for 3 nights, as part of a stopover on the way to Australia. We got upgraded upon a arrival to a room with a harbour view. Overall a great experience only negatives: no nightlife within walking distance, though taxis are very cheap. It’s very close to the shopping area, and used by a lot of the airlines which is a very good endorsement. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrieMaple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised following some reports on here. We upgraded to a executive side harbour view room, which was clean and comfortable. Rooms not huge but you dont need them to be in a city!! We had breakfast in the executive lounge upstairs include, refreshments when we wanted during the day. free evening cocktails, light lunch all included and it was well worth it. We also had express check out. Staff were absolutely brilliant spending a lot of time with us and showing and telling us the best places to go and eat and visit. Definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SagaLout1954
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at location. Loads of activity right on the doorstep, very close to MTR so easy to get around. Had superior side harbour view on floor 28 (no. 2827). Looked recently decorated, clean, tidy and reasonable size, neither huge nor small. Bathroom somewhat compact but I've seen smaller! Fridge, mini bar, coffee/tea facility, safe, hairdryer (very good), iron and board, TV, digital clock. Checked in at 11am and only twin bedroom available - wasn't bothered. Very quiet located room, no traffic noise. Loads of dressing table surface and well lit. UK style sockets. Check out was noon, extended free 'til 2pm. After this luggage was stored with porters and we were given use of gym facilities to shower/change prior to 8pm pick up for 11.30 flight. Retrieved the bag with change of clothing etc from porters at appropriate time in the evening, no problem. Towels/tissues/hairdryers/deodorant/shower gel/shampoo all supplied in the gym. One couple given the use of an available room by reception for 1 hour during the evening instead of the gym, but gym facilities so good it didn't make much difference which you used. After changing into travel clothes wanted to stay 'cool' so went down into hotel Dickens Bar for 'English' meal and a few drinks. Bit smokey but service pretty prompt and not too bad value. Watch out as steak & kidney pie is the size of a dinner plate, which is why it doesn't come with any potatoes/veggies! Cafe on 1st floor a trifle expensive but can recommend club sandwich, freshly made. Coffee shop egg tarts - fantastic. Didn't sample any other restaurants in hotel so can't comment on those. All staff friendly, polite and helpful. Would absolutely stay here again - no question. Brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Excelsior...and the location too!”
Reviews.Author: sweetteaBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior for 5 nights around Chinese New Year. This is my second stay at this hotel and I was again very pleased with the hotel. [+] GREAT location in the center of everything in Causeway Bay...shopping, eating, anything. [+] Rooms are decent size and comfortably appointed [+] As with many Hong Hotels, the staff is overly helpful. I would like to believe they are a step above at The Excelsior [+] Pub downstairs is a fun place to go for a brew if you don't want to go out, although why would you not... [-] No negatives!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TB123
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the Excelsior for a long weekend at the beginning of June. We decided to stay at here on the strength of previous tripadvisor reviews. On the whole I would agree with those reviews. The hotel is situated in a great spot smack in the middle of the Causeway Bay shopping area, where the MTR (underground) entrance is no more than 200 meters away. The hotel staff was excellent, very polite and attentive. Upon checking in we were offered a room upgrade (I think this is a standard sales speech) so we decided to pay the little bit extra and have a 'partial harbour view' room. We were not disappointed. This was my first stay in HK, and the views from our 23rd floor room made the 12 hour flight worthwhile. The room itself was quite large, very clean and very comfortable, however, the photographs used by tripadvisor / expedia, aren’t old 80’s photos which haven’t been updated, the décor really is stuck in a time warp! The Hotel has two good bars. The basement level is where you’ll find Dickens Bar, an expat haven of a sports bar, which is well worth a look. The second bar is situated on the 34th floor, a bar / restaurant called Talk of the Town or TOTT. The views from the lounge bar are simply stunning (if you’re on a budget the best time to go up there is between 5 and 8 which is happy hour / buy one get one free). We didn’t eat at the hotel because we wanted to get out and explore HK, that being said the restaurant menus looked good and there were lots of local people eating there. In addition to the restaurants there is an excellent coffee shop situated to one side of the lobby, we found this a great place to grab a muffin and a hot drink for breakfast. All in all we had a great stay at the Excelsior and I would certainly go back / recommend it to my friends and family. One particular thing I found encouraging about the Excelsior was the fact that our airline cabin crew stay there. Ask yourself, would the trolley dollies at British Airways stay there if it wasn’t up to it?

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: IndustrialDesigner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior for nearly two weeks, and found the service to be excellent. I had a large room with a wonderful view of the harbor. Very clean rooms, excellent food, and attentive staff. Visas for mainland China were handled quickly by the concierge. Laundry service was fast and efficient. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon1956
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel, excellent location for both the finanical district and also the real "Hong Kong". Views from the rooms at the front of the hotel are brilliant especially the higher floors. Rooms were immaculately clean and the carpets throughout the hotel were steam cleaned weekly. The TOTTs Asian Grill Restaurant on the top floor is out of this world, the food is glorious and the service next to none. The hotel is used for both holiday-makers and business people, which is what you expect in such a city as this. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a true taste of Hong Kong. The hotel Limo service is excellent too and really reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for shoppers: great location, quality service”
Reviews.Author: Sjumsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Excelsior for 4 nights. Check in process was prompt and efficient, staff address me with my last name. I booked a superior room because I was travelling for leisure. Room was clean, although furnitures are bit dated. But all amenities were working perfectly. High-speed internet for HK$35/hour was a bit pricey (or perhaps it is Hong Kong afterall). Staff were all very nice and courteous. Nice gym facility with sauna and steamroom but no swimming pool. Since I did not include breakfast in the package, I had breakfast outside. There's a nice coffee stand in the lobby which sells great coffee and pastries at reasonable prices. Nevertheless, hundreds of restaurants and shops are located closeby. There is also a nice bar at the hotel's underground. Next to hotel is the fashion district and Sogo department store is located very near. Overall: a great place to stay for tourist and shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: angrylittlesoldier
Reviews.Content: Having just moved to Hong Kong to live my company placed us in the Excelsior for 2 weeks whilst we searched for an apartment. In my opinion the hotel is predominately a business hotel (being used by a significant amount of airline crew and people passing through for work) with the majority of tourists opting to stay in the slightly better class and better located hotels in central and admirality. Not to say that this hotel isnt used by tourists but they tended to be coach parties stopping by for one or two nights. The location of the hotel (in Causeway Bay) isn't bad but if your a tourist spending a few nights in Hong Kong then the hotels in Central will be the ones that you will give you the lifetime memories not the the Excelsior. Some observations from my time there: - the hotel is ok but it needs updating. The rooms are small and decorated in 1980s style - staff are friendly and attentive and nothing was too much trouble (bare in mind I was there for 2 weeks so I suspect I was considered a VIP by the end of my stay) - eat in the restaurants once or twice, but in my opinion it was better and cheaper to eat out (there are hundreds of decent restaurants nearby in Causeway Bay - go to Times Square or even across the way to the World Trade Center - fitness facilities are poor (no swimming pool) but if you are into running then go to nearby Victoria Park as that is lovely - it always seemed to be hectic at reception. even though there seemed to be loads of staff there were still queues - the business centre is very expensive to use (i.e. internet). go round the corner to the local internet cafe and get access at a 1/10th of the price. all in all an ok hotel, nothing special. if i had a choice i would suggest paying a little bit more and staying in a hotel in central. you will go home much happier with better memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: glowbal
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel is located at the busy shopping area of Causeway Bay. About a short city block away from the MTR Causeway Bay Station near the Sogo department Store. The hotel is at the action of both retail shopping and close to large shopping malls and stores. On the north side of the hotel there is front way a very busy highway and a small feeder road for access to the hotel with limited access. The west side of the hotel is really the main entrance which is a small unappealing one way alley coming from the World Trade Centre shopping mall. The hotel is frequented by airline crew. The lobby is clean, decent, and well kept. Overall it is quite acceptable for a four star hotel. The service was good and English was well understood. After check-in there is a hotel staff person escorting you to the room. The hotel is divided about half for non-smoking floors and the other half smoking. The smell of smoke in the lobby was minor and not overwhelming. The smoke smell in the non-smoking was not present or minimal. The room itself was very small, decent, and well kept. The rooms are adequate and nice and do not need much updating. Maid service was prompt and efficient. The bathroom could have used some remodeling and was considered a poor factor in the service of the hotel. Everything worked in the bathroom but it needed updating. The other problem related to the bathroom was the water knock. When people used their shower the pipes started knocking which can be heard from a considerable distance, for this issue the rating is downgraded a notch within the star grade. Overall at about $US190 (final price all tax in) a night at peak season the Excelsior Hotel can be considered a respectable four star hotel and is recommended for the quality of service provided at that price. Grade is “4 star minus” out of 5 stars. Pros: Good shopping location, close to MTR station, full non-smoking floors, air quality in hotel lobby is good Cons: Water knock problem, main lobby entrance is really an alley, close to busy and noisy Causeway Bay highway

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: kevinchesters
Reviews.Content: I entered the hotel with some trepidation having read some of the reviews...The location is fabulous, the harbour view rooms are tremendous (esp. at night). I stayed here on business and the LAN access was great. The room was large. the bed comfy. The hotel was quiet, the staff very attentive and the food fine. I have stayed in much better hotels (and paid 3 times as much). I have stayed in far worse (and paid 3 times as much as well!). A good base for a meeting, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning!!”
Reviews.Author: Torontoian
Reviews.Content: For Christmas 2006 my family left the cold of Toronto and headed for Hong Kong. While staying at the Excelsior Hotel in Causeway Bay, we, along with other family members and friends, had the Christmas buffet at the hotel's Cafe. Then the next day four people in our group became violent ill with food poisoning, an incident we reported promptly to the F&B Manager. However, nearly a month later they emailed me saying out of the 500+ guests they served that night, NOBODY got sick (did the four of us not count? Did they actually call everyone and check?). This was very unprofessional and irresponsible behavior on the hotel's part and we will never stay at or patronize the Excelsior in Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldnt be part of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: To put it bluntly the Excelsior is a dump and needs a major renovation. I am really surprised that the Oriental hotel group doesn't have a problem attaching its name to the property. The one exception is that the service from the staff was up to Mandarin Oriental par. The rooms were really quite small, run down and not the most comfortable. I ate in the hotel once at the buffet for lunch and was not thrilled. Decent location, good business services, good car service although it is prohibitively expensive. I would only stay there again simply because the rates tend to be much better than most other Hong Kong hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, but great location in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: It was the week of ITU Telecoms, and all hotels were booked. This was the only hotel I managed to get, and even then at some extremely exhorbitant rate. The Excelsior is sorely in need of a refresh, although it is smack in the middle of Causeway Bay. Service staff were fine, unlike what was said in the other reviews. The bay view is nice, although the rooms are smallish and old.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: reen2k
Reviews.Content: This was so disappointing. I was in HK on business the first week of Dec 2006,. My corporate travel dept. booked this as its on our approved hotel list. First, the hotel's lobby, restaurants, driveway are very busy and hectic at most times of day. Much of their clientele is airline crew - they have a separate line/check in (not a good sign). Even though my corp acct guaranteed my reservation, the hotel did not have any non-smoking rooms avail when i arrived at 7pm (what i had booked). I called the manager out and were told that a NS room would be avail by 10pm (!?). I had no idea what could happen in those 3 hours that would make a room avail. They said I could keep my things in an avail smoking room and use restroom, etc. - it was just awful! Dirty, very much in need of remodel, very small, and the smell was just terrible - I could have never slept in this room due to the heavy cigarette smell. Causeway Bay is nice to shop, but I wouldn't recommend staying there, you're much better off in Central. And in no way would i recommend you stay at this hotel. The staff didn't seem empowered to help me, it was the manager who "found" the NS room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms require TLC”
Reviews.Author: BUNGALION
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a very good location with regard to shopping and restuarants etc and has lovely views of the Harbour,but the rooms are dated and require a little TLC. We had reqested a Deluxe Room with Harbour View and got a Harbour Room but certainly not a Deluxe Room. The Tea and Coffee making facilities were of an absolute minimum and were pushed into a tiny space within the mini bar.We were on the 31ST floor which was because we asked for a smoking room.Ok so being so high we didn't expect the windows to open fully,but were suprised to find they didn't open at all!...Not even an inch! Reception area was very clinical and reminded me of a low end Supermarket . Breakfast however was great,and being a buffet style one could eat as much as you liked.The choice was astonishing and the food itself was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Oct 06. The deluxe rooms are a great size, and the beds are really comfy. Make sure that you get a view of the harbour,its great at night time. We ate at the Chinese restaurant in the hotel one night and the food was great. The bar that is part of the hotel has a really good atmosphere and we spent most nights in there, especially good for a nightcap. The staff are friendly and the hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. Its in really central place especially for shopping, but its a good 15-20 minute walk to the star ferry. The tram stops are about 10 minutes walk away.While you are in HK I would recommend having afternoon tea at the Peninsula hotel in Kowloon, its a real treat. Its a great city with so much to see and do and you would pay alot more for a hotel of this standard over on Kowloon, but there is no need with the star ferry so easy to use you can take the ferry over and stare at the view of HK for as long as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but rooms are a little tired”
Reviews.Author: buzziebee
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel (22 - 25 September 2006). The hotel is in a good location and is overall good, we just felt the rooms were a little tired and in need of renovating. We had a Deluxe Harbour View Room King that overlooked the harbour which was nice. But there was nothing special about the hotel that made us say WOW. Our room rates were : 22 September 2006 HKD2380 23 September 2006 HKD1880 24 September 2006 HKD1880 Total Rate: HKD 6140 + Rates are subject to 10% service charge and 3% government Unfortunately hotels in Hong Kong are VERY expensive on the whole. I chose this hotel as the rate seemed a little less than others and was in a good location with a harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “On balance, OK”
Reviews.Author: tal27
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on tripadvisor, but at the end of the day, had no choice about staying here as it was to meet up with a friend who had already booked the hotel. I arrived on a Saturday afternoon about 5pm, and that is where the problems started. Took 10 minutes to get to the desk with the queue Despite requesting a non-smoking room and phoning to confirm such, I had to remind them of this specific request at checkin, and then they had no room for me when I arrived. I was told the room might be available at about 9pm (why?) but in the meantime I could shower and freshen up in a smoking room they had available. There was no offer of an upgrade as the hotel was full. I was prepared from the other reviews for this, so basically I had a controlled quiet hissy fit at reception, being escalated through three people up to the manager, before they "found" me a non-smoking side-harbour view room (1720). Luckily it was renovated, with a new bathroom, but the "view" was laughable. Once in however, the room was spacious, quiet (apart from hallway noise), clean and comfortable. The housekeeping service was very efficient, and the facilities in the hotel excellent. Location also is very good, near MTR and walkable to Central if you like that kind of thing. Concierge was helpful with restaurant recommendations also. It is clearly an airline crew hotel though - they have a separate reception area (which had more staff than the regular one), and I spoke to a few different crew in the elevators during my time there, and they were all automatically in non-smoking rooms with an upgrade apparently. So regular tourists beware - re-confirm your booking and be prepared for a fight. I should note my friend who was staying there was put in a smoking room despite the non-smoking request at booking, and a non-smoking room was only made available two days into the three day stay (I am guessing once the aircrew checked out), despite him also receiving a promise of "9pm that night". And true to form in China, his clothes reeked of smoke every time he left his room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good”
Reviews.Author: Scianoir
Reviews.Content: Recently spent eight nights in this hotel and I cannot praise it more highly. The room (grandluxe with harbour view on high floor), service (from beginning to end of my visit) and food were excellent! Furthermore the Excelsior is convenient for the underground (MTR). Will certainly stay there again if I make a return visit to Kong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Excelsior in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: taurus304
Reviews.Content: I was there for 2 nights. It is a large, busy hotel with many tourists, business guests and airline cabin crew. My room (2021) was comfortable and clean with a good view towards the sea. It is a little small and the bathroom will need renovation in the near future. However the facilities in the room were very good and I was pleased that an iron and ironing board were provided. There is a wide variety of food outlets and something for every taste from fine dining to pub food in the Dickens bar. The meals that I had were all excellent and the food overall seemed to be of a very high standard. My only criticism was the check-out. There was a queue of 8 people and I waited 15 minutes to get to the desk. The check-out process that the staff have to go through seems to be tortuous and very time consuming. I would suggest the front office management have a thorough review of the business process and IT systems used for check-out. Check-out apart, I was very satisfied with my stay at the Excelsior and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb harbour views”
Reviews.Author: OllieW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of our 15 day Kuoni China tour. Our room on the 12th floor had spectacular views over the harbour. An ever-changing picture of which one could never tire. The room was clean and well-presented with all the usual facilities. This is a very large international hotel with a range of bars and eating places. We ate in the Dickens bar late one evening. Food was acceptable but the atmosphere was smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Big but efficent”
Reviews.Author: barolobrain
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in Hong Kong I stayed at the Island, Shagri-La. This time, it was business so I ended up at the Excelsior as most of my meetings were in Central. For starters, accomodation in Central or Causeway Bay are going to be expensive so that's a given. The Excelsior is owned by the Mandarin Hotel group. It's a rather large and busy hotel, apparently a favorite booking for International airline crews. That being said, it's very efficient. Check in is fast and hassle free. I ended up with a room on the upper floor with a harbour view. My usual needs, quiet room, broadband connection, mini-bar, hotel safe and good location were well served. There's a very nice pub down in the basement, serving decent food, beer, wine and spirits which seems to be frequented by a mix of expatriates and locals. All things considered, primarily location, this hotel is decent accomodation for a Central location.

Reviews.Title: “nice harbour view”
Reviews.Author: jglin
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in Prudential whenever I go to HK yearly but no, I think I may pay more and come to Excelsior. Beautiful room with a great harbour view both in day and at night. We upgraded to the superior harbour view room and were not disappointed. The location is fabulous if you are thinking of food and shopping. Across the street, you get good buys (in small lane) and trendy shops for the young and hippies in shopping centres surrounding the hotel. There is a cheap Japanese restaurant and a Korean restaurant serving authentic Korean food, not to mention 24hr eateries all nearby. Hotel is also near ferry terminal to Macau and HK central Station, so it is convenient to take a train to to HK station and then take a cab here. Its easy and fast and cheap too. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Roberto79
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from three nights in the Excelsior and it was a nice hotel. We paid for an upgrade to a Superior Harbour view room (I probably would have been rather angry with a city view). The only thing going for the Harbour views are the actual views (and hence city views must be disappointing). I thought the rooms were very dated and the bathroom was a bit on the small size. I thought the service was good but on my check-in (after a long flight like most people visiting Hong Kong and hence tired) the first question was..Passports please? (which is acceptable) and then second question was if I wanted an upgrade (in what I would call a semi aggressive way of asking)... I felt the check in staff were more in search of a quick sale then making me feel welcome. I did go for the upgrade to the Harbour view (one must especially if it is your first time to Hong Kong). Apart from the check in I thought all the staff were very welcoming. Breakfast is great...and good value for the sumptuous buffet you get. The location was good especially as the shops close late and transport into town is easy via the metro system. If I went back to Hong Kong I would probably try another hotel. I would not recomend this hotel if you are used to staying in Mandarin Oriental styel of hotels as this is not up to the standard of other Mandarins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: North_England
Reviews.Content: We checked in here in mid-June on the first leg of our round the world trip. An excellent start. We had a harbour view superior room - great views across the bay. The location of the hotel was excellent - although most places in central Hong Kong are great for transport. We had welcome gifts waiting in the room with complements of the management and found all of the staff to be exceptionally friendly and polite. Best bits of the hotel: The beds - probably the most important aspect (along with cleanliness) for us - they were perfect! Great nights sleep. The small coffee shop on the ground floor serves great cake/coffee - perfect to grab a take away for a lazy morning brunch in your room. The Sports bar serves excellent Nachos - perfect to go with the world cup game that we watched down there at 3am. The staff - nothing was too much trouble. Worst bits: Getting a little dated but did not detract from stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hong Kong 5 times and stayed at the Excelsior 3 times: 1984, 1992 and 2005. I last stayed for one week in November, 2005. This time I had a full harbor view room (I had ordered a low floor harbor view but was upgraded to the 27th floor upon arrival!). The view alone is practically worth the price of the room which was about $250 US. The rooms are large with plenty of amenities and great for business travelers. They also gave me a complimentary bottle of wine upon arrival. There are newer and more luxurious hotels in Hong Kong, but for the price and local atmosphere you can't beat the Excelsior. Causeway Bay is off the main tourist route (which I like) but in the middle of a very bustling neighborhood with great shopping, much better shopping than Kowloon, and the shops stay open late so you can go shopping after a day of work or sightseeing. When you want to get to other parts of Hong Kong, the MTR is a short 2 block walk. The buffet breakfast is spectacular and well worth the price. I had 7 of them and still hadn't tried everything they had. The Talk of the Town Bar on the 34th floor has great music, food and views. The Dickens Bar in the basement is one of the most British spots in all of Hong Kong. There are few moments in life more memorable than contemplating Hong Kong harbor from the hotel room or the bar on the top floor. I love this place and if I ever go back it's my first choice. It's may not be cheap buy you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: English
Reviews.Content: Having seen other reviews, we upgraded to a Harbour View Room at approx £20 per night which was well worth it. Great view, large clean room, god location. The breakfast is fantastic with great views over the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 stayed 2nights June 06. This a a Good Hotel we upgraded to the Executive suite on the 30th Floor overlooking the Harbour and for the few extra $$'s we also had the daily breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea and drinks included. Location is fantastic only minutes to train & shops, staff very helpful as well. The room was much larger than expected, compared to others we have stayed in before, this gets our thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Jaded”
Reviews.Author: lynkay
Reviews.Content: Very clean, fantastic location very close to the MTR and overlooking the mid day gun. The hotel staff were friendly but the rooms and the decor are VERY jaded and in need of a refurbishment. It definately is not "Luxury".

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at this hotel was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long day of travelling. The reception area seemed chaotic, but I expected that having read previous reports. However, it wasn't too long before we were checked in and from that moment, our stay at this hotel was wonderful. The staff always polite and went out of there way to make us feel really special. We did upgrade our room as it was our wedding anniversary. We had a large suite on the 26th floor with club lounge access. This gave us three different views of Hong Kong. The club lounge is on the 31st floor and provided a good breakfast, more than adequate lunch and other snacks at different times of the day. We had alcoholic drinks between 1730 and 2000hrs each day plus a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room because of the occasion. The room was well furnished and always clean and included a small kitchenette and walk in wardrobe as well as lounge and smaller than expected bathroom. Internet access is available inroom but in comparison with some hotels, rather expensive, charged per hour rather than per minute. A range of cafes and restaurants available in the hotel on various floors providing ample choice plus an English themed bar in the basement. There is also a pedestrian tunnel under the busy road outside to get you to the waters edge, important to be present at the daily noon day firing of the canon. Also watch for the symphony of lights on the waterside, both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon side, each evening at 8pm. Being on Causeway Bay gave immediate access to the shopping there and also spectacular views of the Harbour, Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. There arn't many hotels I would suggest in this City that could provide such great views. We checked out through the club lounge reception, much quieter and more personal. Personally, I would avoid the taxis like the plague, the airport express train is very efficent and quick and you can hop on a free bus from the station to the hotel. At 3000HK$ per night, not cheap, but who cares, the stay was one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in HK”
Reviews.Author: PNPChelt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on causeway bay and so access to many of the attractions is straight-forward. We thought we'd had a good time until we discovered that the upgrade we'd been offered was four times the price we expected. The staff on the front desk were unable to resolve anything until the next day, and their record of the room that we had reserved was incorrect. We effectively spent our last night in HK trying to sort out the shambles. Would I use this hotel again, probably, but only if there was nothing else comparable available, and I would check carefully with any upgrade offered, and any booking that I had made.

Reviews.Title: “sufficient”
Reviews.Author: jvangend
Reviews.Content: My fiancé had to travel to HK for work so I tagged along as I had leave and air-miles up my sleeve. We stayed at the Excelsior as his company has corporate rates setup there. Rooms are dated and worn, in need of refurbishment, and has none of the understated splendour and opulence associated with a Mandarin Oriental. Service however was top notch. Every member of staff we came across smiled and greeted us when we walked by. We had a room with a nice view of the harbour and beds were comfortable. Breakfast consists of a good selection of Asian and Western dishes. To be honest, we spent most of our time out of the hotel exploring the city rather than cooped up in the room! But in all, we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4101
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong for the Rugby Sevens, so the location was perfect--within walking distance of the stadium. (The hotel is actually in Causeway Bay, not Central, as a previous reviewer stated. But Central is just two quick stops away on the MTR--entrance is right around the corner from the hotel.) The hotel is also right in the middle of a great shopping district and right next door to a nice park. We had a partial harbor view and our room was clean and comfortable, if a bit worn. The hotel makes up for the slight shabbiness of its rooms, though, with a modern fitness center, heated tennis courts, great breakfasts, and an attentive and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Agnus-Fab
Reviews.Content: Hight marks for service, cleanliness and food. Located in a very convenient location for downtown Hong Kong. The rooms are very comfortable and the view of the bay is awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: rdmsmith
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Mandarin Oriental properties this hotel was quite a disappointment. Even though expectations were already lower based on the room prices, it was surprising just how run down and worn out the guest rooms have become. The Excelsior would benefit from refurbishment. I'm surprised Mandarin Oriental have their name on this hotel. On the plus side the service was very good and cleanliness could not be faulted. It was just a shame that it seems to have been left to decay. Maybe once the real Mandarin Oriental reopens again in Hong Kong then the refurbishment team can look at the Excelsior. Until then, don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. We had a side view harbor view club room. Would suggest full harbour view room for future. Enjoyed the breakfasts, snacks and drinks made available for club room floors. There for business. Husband could use lap top w/no problem in room. Sufficient for what we needed. However, we had previously stayed at Renaissance. I liked that better because I enjoy swimming in a heated pool w/a view. Renaissance seemed a bit more plush. No pool here. Didn't check out work out room, not sure if have one or not. Would stay here again if Renaissance not available.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: chiper
Reviews.Content: check in at 09.00 was very quick and easy shown to room with side view which was good then asked if we would like to upgrade which we did at a small extra cost superb view over harbour and midday gun. room was more than ok . food /restaurants very good especialy breakfast. pleanty of other restaurants in the area the hotel bar was very good and lively although pricy except at happy hour but you could get your drink stocked up in this time. most of the tours seemed to leave from this hotel which was good as other tourists had to make their way to this point hotel employies were always helpful all in all a good time was had.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights and could not fault the service, rooms and location. The location is excellent, literallly around the corner from the MTR-which is the lifeline to getting around. I personally found the shopping around Causeway Bay area excellent for choice and value and better than in Singapore. A must do - visit the "Rainbow Seafood Restaurant in Lamma Island including free ferry. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “well satisfied”
Reviews.Author: tallinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a stop-over from Australia to Heathrow. Throughout our visit everyone of the staff we encountered was pleasant and helpful. We upgraded to an executive room which provided access to a super lounge area with inclusive breakfast, lunch and early evening drinks. The bedroom was somewhat worn and in need of some refurbishment, but nevertheless we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Time to upgrade the rooms”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice, and it's well overdue for upgrades to the rooms. It cannot be classified as a 5-star hotel compared to others in Hong Kong. Bathroom in particular is poor, amenities are minimal. Am hoping that renovations aren't too far off in the future as it is still a good value. Staff was helpful and friendly, as always. Location is generally good, close to the MTR and lots of shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Koko04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior in Hong Kong for 7 nights at the end of January. We arrived at 8.30pm, the reception was not busy and we checked in our room without any problem. The room was a harbor view room, very spacious and with all the usual amenities. The bathroom was small compare to the size of the room. The furniture of the room needs to be updated; however it’s not a major problem. As it was my birthday, we received a complimentary bottle of champagne from the hotel, this was a nice welcome to this amazing city. The breakfast was the best I ever had, and I travel a lot and stayed at numerous hotels but never had such an amazing breakfast. There is everything available, from dim sum to roast meat to croissants and waffles. The gym facilities are great especially the steaming room and the Sauna. The location of the hotel is very convenient; you have everything near you and many places to eat at very good prices. Hong Kong is a great place and the Excelsior Hotel is definitely a very good Hotel to stay at to explore Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nshores33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel January 5-8. Prior to arrival, I spoke with the concierge several times. He confirmed my stay, set up airport transportation, and arranged tours. Everything was perfect when we arrived late at night. Our room had a fabulous view overlooking the harbour and Kowloon. The bed was comfortable. The shower was a little slow to drain and had some stains but fine otherwise. THe biggest downfall for us was the internet. The business center charges 100 HKD for 15 minutes even if you use 2 minutes. That's really expensive compared to everything else in Hong Kong and it's hard to find any internet cafes in the city. Also, upon receiving our bill, a room and service charge was added that seemed kind of high. Overall, the hotel was very nice, close to the MTR, and service was great. I'd stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the excelsior hotel in Hong Kong for 4 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. The hotel was lovely and we upgraded to an executive room and the perks that this entailed. We had a brilliant harbour view and although the room was a little small this was to be expected in such a city. The staff were extremely efficent but welcoming and friendly something we found throughout Hong Kong. We found staying on Hong Kong island was the best choice for us and we will definetly be planning a return trip to Hong Kong and a future stay in the excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be first-rate, but misses the mark.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is one of those mid-level hotels that tries to be a first-rate hotel, but can't pass muster. That they are owned by the Mandarin Oriental chain only makes it worse, since the staff thinks they are working at the Mandarin, but without the training and resources to bump up the service and amenities to make a stay here memorable or enjoyable. Certainly, if someone was not used to staying at first-rate hotels, they wouldn't notice how young and unprofessional the desk, lobby and business center staff are here. It's hard to describe it, since the differences can be subtle to those not used to good service, but to see what I mean simply walk into the lobby of the Peninsula in Hong Kong, and walk into the lobby here. Not taking into account the physical differences, which are not worth comparing (the Penisula is a more expensive hotel) but it doesn't cost anymore for a well-trained, professional and friendly staff. The Excelsior stumbles badly. The rooms are way over-designed. They look like a designer's first job, with an attempt to include everything they'd ever read about for a "hip" hotel (which this is not). A glass window from the shower to the room (senseless in this setting), glass sink bowl (always messy looking), backlighting, cove lighting, hidden lighting everywhere -- there are seven different light switches just for the room. It's silly -- and all the built-in furniture, shelves, tables, sofas, closets -- everything is over-wrought and jammed into the space making a typically small Asian room even smaller. I never did figure out how to turn the backlighting off inside the frosted glass closet. The room redo's are likely new, since they are in pretty good shape, but it looks dated -- mid-1990s stuff. The business center looks like it was passed by when the rooms were upgraded --definitely 1980s looking -- and get this, a 20 percent surcharge for calling DHL to pick up my box of laundry I was sending home. Every hotel I stayed in on this trip called DHL for free. That surcharge was absurd. And when I complained about it (a US$120 "extra" charge for making a phone call!!) to the manager on duty, he said "it's the hotel policy". Yes, but it's still stupid, policy or not. And a real hotel, offering real service NEVER tells a guest with a legitimate complaint, "it's the hotel policy" shrugs and walks away. As an overall experience was the stay bad? No, but what irks me is when a hotel pretends to be classy and service oriented, and it is not even close. Just be honest, Excelsior, you are a pedestrian hotel. Don't pretend to be anything else --that's what makes guests upset. If the hotel had simply advertised themselves as a middle-of-the-road place, my middle-of-the-road experience would not be nearly so disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: gabio
Reviews.Content: Great location but if you dont get a harbour view room which is priced much higher than the standard room then i wouldnt expect much. our view was of an adjacent concrete wall and from all accounts from friends we made in the hotel a lot smaller. The furniture was definately dating but outside the room you wont be too dissapointed. the sports bar is a great (if expensive) place to sit on a night for a good atmosphere and the buffet on the first floor is great. Make sure you get to mong kok market on kowloom side though and dont take the first second or third price they give you!!

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel over the last few years. Stopover before the long haul to Europe. This year our room 2306 was excellent overlooking Hong Kong Harbour, Marina and Kowloon. The harbour view rooms are a must as they are spacious with all the mod cons. Its magical watching the large cargo ships cruising up and down the harbour jostling for space between the ferries and junk boats. Dinner: eat at "Top of the Town" on the 34th floor-modern crusine with views after a few vinos its breathtaking. Otherwise eat at the Mandarin Hotel-its very chic and stylish with a fabulous view.(pricey but worth it) Breakfast: Is the best, freshly squeezed juices, 4 chefs cooking American and Chinese food. Its always exciting to wake up knowing you have wonderful decisions to make...What will I have today! Shopping: Nathan Street, Causeaway Bay-Times Square, forget Stanley Markets, Melbourne Plaza 2nd floor cheap perfumes, Macau IslaND.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tovakare
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. The fact that it's right next to a shopping center that stays open until quite late really gives you a feel of Hong Kong. The restaurants are expensive, but the food is delicious. I have stayed at other hotels in Hong Kong but have decided to make this my regular hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “It is GREAT! I love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a Great hotel.. I stayed there for 4Nights.. No complains for this hotel. The staff is friendly n polite with smile on their faces when they see u. It is near Causeway bay mtr. It is near to shopping centres like SOGO and many others more. The staff is very helpful when we asked them for direction to go to. The rooms is very clean. I will want to stay in this hotel again when i go to Hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “my regular stop over”
Reviews.Author: wantaword
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular guest at this hotel for several years and have to say that it is probably the best combination of price, location and quality on Hong Kong Island. I have stayed at a large number of other hotels on Hong Kong (little experience on the Kowloon side) and while there are other hotels which are truely wonderful in Hong Kong (the Island Shangri-la I love) when you factor in price and location (Causeway Bay has all the shopping and restaurants on your doorstep) I keep returning in the Excelsior. You may not have the over the top lobby, but if you want Great Service at an acceptable price, stay here. {an acceptable alternative at a similar price/location - see The Park Lane. I find the service/professionalism not as good but the rooms larger}
